description:
Wonderful bar with great bartender.

Mark was our bartender on a Saturday night and he took a normal bar experience to another level. My friend and I weren't sure what we felt like drinking, so he asked us a bunch of questions on what we liked and concocted two different cocktails for each of us. My friend had an egg white with gin and cracked pepper (a lot more I can't even name) and I had a refreshing gin cocktail with cucumber. We loved our first drink so much we stayed for a second, which he again, made on a whim and we were watching him make each one with love and care. The second round was also delicious, my friend having another vodka/rum cocktail with this caraway flavor (amazing) and mine was a peachy/refreshing drink. Must say this was one of the few times I was so impressed with the bartender and his level of interest in his customers and mastery of bartending. Highly recommend if you're looking to talk to some friends and have some quality drinks.
author: Alice K.

description:
83 Proof is a pretty small, unassuming bar that's pretty easy to walk past if you're not looking for it! But that's something that I love about it! I pass by it almost everyday on the way to grab lunch and I didn't even know it was a bar until some friends I met there for happy hour drinks one day.

In terms of happy hour, I'd say 83 Proof is one of my favorites in the area for cheap drinks and fast service. My go-to well drink is a gin & tonic and I got 2 for $10 (because their credit card minimum is $10). Hey, not complaining about that at all! 

The beers are also generous portions and my friends enjoyed theirs. We came on a Thursday early evening and it wasn't too crowded although the bar was definitely lively. It wasn't too loud either so you could have a conversation without screaming at each other.

The only thing is that the space is a little small so I'm sure it could get stuffy on days/times that are more popular for drinking. Definitely an amazing happy hour spot though. I can't wait to come back!
author: Christine W.

description:
Good custom drinks. Local-bar feel. Crowded! Loud! 
Good bartenders.
Not a lot of seating.
A small upstairs area where you might find some extra seats.
Very pub-like.
I had wine, but I saw some really nice looking custom or mixed cocktails happening.
author: Corey Tess T.

description:
Cool, chill bar near the Embarcadero in the city. This would be a good spot to share drinks with friends or coworkers or a date. Tasty, cold beers.

The bar was packed on a Thursday afternoon.
author: Tony J.

description:
Cheers to a wonderful happy hour at 83 Proof!! Met here with some classmates earlier today to celebrate a birthday. A little surprised to see the place filled to the brim with people (last time I came we were the sole patrons), but it created for a very lively vibe and made me miss working in FiDi. 
The happy hour menu was incredible- we had 9 drinks (4 of which were delicious Washington Apple shooters- perfectly made) rounding out to $60 with tax. Service was quick despite the number of people crowded around the bar. 
Looking forward to coming back soon!
author: Roma R.

description:
A wall of booze is an boozaholic's dream, they can stare at the wall like a Henri Matisse masterpiece.

These booze technicians can make anything you ask for.  Anything and everything booze related.  Since I'm not good at making up delicious cocktails, I copied fellow yelp tips and ordered the basil blueberry gimlete.  And it was perfect!

Cool vibe, good mix of people, comfortable environment.
author: Jenny T.

description: Cozy place for after work drinks. Service is only at the bar. There's a second floor loft that oversees the main floor. This floor would be best for larger groups. Otherwise there are small tables and bar space in the main level. Good selection of wine, but vast selection of spirits and butters for cocktails. Ambiance is warm with a urban rustic vibe. Very centrally located especially if you work close to trans bay terminal.
author: Bella L.

description:
A low-key bar with mature crowd. You won't be seeing much hipster here and I kind of like that. 

What a like about this bar:

1) Helpful bartender with great suggestions and knowledge about his liqueur. 

2) Well-made cocktail drinks.

3) Great selection of whiskey.

4) Bar stool that actually have a back so I don't slouch (it's important to have good posture!).

5) Very chill vibe.

I hope you give 83 Proof a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description: I love this place. It gets packed right after work though then dies down around 7PM. The libations are great, bartenders/staff are amazing, and the overall vibe & decor is nice.
author: Manny C.

description:
A solid cocktail bar in SOMA that looks to be very popular with the after-work crowd.  My friend graciously introduced me to not only the place, but one of the awesome owners as well.

While my Manhattan was finely executed, I was left a bit perplexed by one of the bartender's take on an Old Pal.  He described the cocktail as it's traditionally made - rye, dry vermouth, campari.  Yet he made it with bourbon...usually fine as the two are often interchanged, but the final product was sadly watered down even from the very first sip.

In terms of atmosphere, definitely try and find a spot upstairs as the main bar is very busy and noisy enough to almost have to shout to have a conversation.

For the atmosphere and price point, I have to be completely honest and say that there are better options in the area.
author: Eric F.

description:
Really cheap drinks! The place is a bit crowded and loud for me, but I would definitely come back.

I ordered two vodka cranberries. It was decent tasting.
author: Kimberly D.

description: I came here twice and both times on a Friday night it is PACKED!  Everyone in the FiDi goes here after work, everyone looks like they're in their usual business attire.  Crowded as hell, but all I care about is getting served.  The bartenders were good, but didn't give the best service.  There's an upstairs that overlooks the downstairs bar, which is cool. This is a great place to meet up with friends, grab a drink and hit up another spot.
author: KB B.

description: 83 Proof is a great choice for an after-work cocktail.  Happy hour offers a more than a few boozy libations to help quench that midweek thirst.  They specialize in dark liquor, but you'll find pretty much whatever you want after a quick glance at their well stocked shelves.  Don't order a vodka soda or gin and tonic here; venture outside your comfort zone and try one of the house specialty cocktails.  If nothing on the menu appeals to you ask one of the friendly bartenders to make you something to your liking.
author: Jeff H.

description: Only came here for beer. Decent selection of alcoholic beverages. Gets really busy right around rush hour, with people in suits coming straight from work for a drink or two before heading to the East Bay and other areas they call home. Can get pretty loud.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Went to 83 Proof for a happy hour social. It's a great place to go after work and grab a drink or watch a little bit of a game. The atmosphere can get crowded and noisy, but what good bar in SF doesn't? Their service was awesome and the bartenders know what they're doing. They have an awesome selection of liquor and good draft beers on tap. 

They had an upstairs area for our social event that had couches and fit about 25 of us standing which was fine. It was a good find and I'll definitely stop in again if I'm in the area.
author: Ryan O.

description: nice little (literally) cocktail bar in SoMa. been here a few times now, and although it can be really crowded after work, the bartenders really move things along, make eye contact to let you know you're on their mind, and best of all, make awesome drinks. there's a huge variety of bourbons and 1/2 dozen or so beers on tap. pro tip, if they have more than a few ryes on hand, they're serious about cocktails
author: Bob U.

description:
Made a quick stop at 83 Proof for a drink before heading over to an event. I met up my friends on Friday, September 16th around 5:45pm. The bar was super packed, but my friends got there first and managed to stake some standing room by the bar for our group of four.

Since I was the last one to get there, my friends just ordered a round of drinks, so I had a Manhattan waiting for me. It was nicely balanced and not too sweet. Not sure why type of liquor they used, but I enjoyed it. One of my friends got an old fashioned and seemed to like it.

Nice place for a quick happy hour, but I prefer a more low key bar. It was so packed in here, that I felt uncomfortable. People kept bumping into us while trying to get to the restroom, meet up their friends, etc. There were several times where I almost spilled my drink. Overall, good drinks, but I wouldn't stay for more than a round.
author: Elena N.

description:
I hate it when I watch movies where the genie grants three wishes.  The fictitious characters always wish for stupid things, like "I wish my teacher would not show up for school today", or "I wish my dog didn't run away".  I'm there yelling at the screen "wish for unlimited wishes, dammit"!!!

My wishes are simple:  good company, good drinks, good atmosphere.  83 Proof fits this bill.  Thanks to the bartender, I found my new economy go to Scotch, Springbank 12 Cask Strength.  It's scary, the more places I go to, the more favorites I find.  Bartenders are also knowledgeable, just tell them your flavor profile, they'll mix up something for you.

All I wish were for more places like 83 Proof...and unlimited wishes.
author: Ron L.

description: This is my go-to place for happy hour. I've been here a few times. After 7pm starts to fall into quiet hours in bars in SF, which is unusual compared to NYC. But come on, this is family-oriented SF :-)
author: Isabelle L.

description:
In a Ferrari or Tesla, switching four lanes, with the top down screaming out "Money ain't a thing!" 

83 Proof is where you can chill with a cocktail and just hang out. We rolled into this place and never felt intimidated by the crowd or bartenders. Everyone was into their own business with an extensive cocktail and beer selection. 

I've had this place bookmarked because of the infamous "Basil Gimlet." Now I know you're thinking "basil in a cocktail?" Yes! Think of it as a light gin inspired cocktail with a basil leaf to naturally sweeten the drink. I ordered one and was completely satisfied because it didn't leave that heavy feeling taste but rather a clean refreshing essence because of the fresh basil leaf. Would I order it again? Definitely! My friend's Bourbon was smooth as ice. The wall of liquor bottles was impressive and showed that only the best was served here. 

The bar style tables were closer to the front where more comfortable seating were located in the back and upstairs. They have a balcony with a perfect view of the downstairs. In the middle of the room were two beautiful chandeliers which dimly lit the room. 

One thing I really appreciate of this bar is the lack of judgement. The bartenders were friendly and attentive but most guests kept to their parties. Nobody was trying to be better than anyone else. We hung out chatting and enjoyed the atmosphere.

They started yelling "last call" at 11:30. So be prepared to order your drinks at least 30 minutes before they close.

Another top place to hang out where nobody cares who you are.
author: Santi T.

description:
I've been coming here for a couple after-work meet-ups and I am liking the casual atmosphere; it's not a pretentious place at all. 

While I know it can be hard to manage with your boss, I would recommend a pre-5pm drink, as this place is much less busy at that time. Anyone in the mood to meet up tonight ;-) ?
author: Uli B.

description: Decent beer selection. Good mix for cocktails. Prices are a bit high for the area, especially after 8p when the work crowd dwindles down. Bathrooms leave a lot to be desired.
author: Kevin K.

description:
one of my favorite bars in the fidi area! the only downside is it gets REALLY packed after 5pm on work days. so if you're able to skip out of work early, highly recommend coming here at 4pm for your apres work refreshment. or do what i do and come out for a couple drinks before returning to work :)

it is one of my favorites because it is not pretentious, drinks are actually affordable considering the area (gasp! under $10 for a cocktail?!), and if you come early or late enough you can definitely grab a table downstairs or couch upstairs to hang out.
author: Yiwen S.

description:
My husband and I threw a pre-wedding happy hour at 83 Proof, and it was wonderful! When we were dating we would always stop here for drinks because it was close to Bart & Muni--so we were excited to throw a party at a place that was so important to our relationship.

We emailed to reserve the mezzanine area, and the 83 Proof team was really helpful and responsive. They offered us a list of caterers they'd worked with before, and set up a table for our snacks. They also arranged to have chilled champagne for our toast, and quickly had 30 glasses set up for our guests. Everyone had an amazing time!

Thank you so much for making our day special!
author: Steph M.

description:
Can't believe I haven't reviewed this place.  Been here tons of times, but it has definitely been a while.

Gets crowded fast as others have mentioned.  But good happy hour prices (haven't been in a while, so I don't want to misquote) chill casual environment and TVs with sports will keep a place packed in the fidi.  Recipe for success!

There is an upstairs area that is pretty chill to hang out if you are with a group.

Lots of beers on tap.  I remember coming here and getting pints of Lagunitas IPA for $4 and that is LEGIT!

Well drinks are also pretty cheap here, I think they used to be $5.

I might stop by today and watch some of the Rockets/Spurs game before heading to the Giants game.

Bathrooms are always clean.

Bartenders have always been cool.

Check it out.

Save me a seat!
author: Ty C.

description:
Conveniently close to BART so it gets pretty packed with people just leaving work. They have a decent beer selection on tap. This bar is definitely a lot smaller than you'd like it to be considering it gets a lot of visitors.

Bartenders are friendly, quick and don't mind making a recommendation. Also pretty attentive for a packed bar considering they will freely ask you if you need anything rather than you waving your hands forever for some attention.
author: Arezou A.

description: A great cozy, clean, and friendly neighborhood bar!  There is a live piano player every Tuesday night which is a treat.  One of my friend met her boyfriend here on a random night and i think he is going to be her future husband.  I wonder if the same luck will apply to me if I keep coming here?
author: Melanie N.

description:
We came here for happy hour after work on a Friday. It was really crowded but it was expected for any happy hour place in FiDi. The drinks were cheap and the bartenders were friendly so I didn't mind the crowd. This might not be a good place for larger crowds because of the small walk space and the large crowd in there for happy hour!
There were groups crowding the bar area which made it difficult to put orders in. If you're able to get close to the bar, the bartenders are attentive and get to you pretty quickly!
The first round we got 2 cranberry vodkas for $4 each! However the second round, we got 2 orange juice vodkas and they came out to be $5 each. 
I'm not sure why we got charged different prices for the different well drinks. I wish they had a menu or sign that says how much the drinks are. I couldn't find anything on their website either. It seems like they have some inconsistencies, but the drinks are a good deal at $4-5 nonetheless.
author: Emily L.

description:
TL;DR - Whaaaaa, this place is cool!

83 proof is one of those places that is so close to me that I sometimes end up going in sweats and a hoodie (hey don't judge)

The bartenders are always friendly and welcoming. The prices are great. Yes, it does get SUPER crowded on thursdays and fridays. However, it offers some good people watching.

The rotating tap is also amazing when I'm not in a hard liquor kinda mood.

Yup, you'll definitely find me here in my sweats.
author: Crystal Z.

description: I work around the area, so I've come by this bar a few times to get a drink. Space wise, it's not bad, but it gets crowded FAST (popular choice?). You wanna do happy hour on a Friday at 6 PM? Go somewhere else. I doubt you can get your foot in the door. Due to lack of space and difficult seating situations (be prepared to stand and drink), this isn't one of my favorite bars to visit. But definitely not a bad choice if you can squeeze in. They have a huge selection of drinks! My personal fave is a good mule - Moscow, Kentucky, Mexican, you name it. And 83 Proof makes a pretty good one. If you don't know what to get, the bartender's here are always pretty helpful. This bar is definitely meant for the Financial Area. You won't find your average 21 year old hipster hanging around here. More of a mature crowd for sure, and you'll blend in more if you're a suit or techie.
author: Rebecca L.

description:
Nice place to hangout, Tuesday happen hours, beers on tap for $5 only.
Drake 555 was awesome.
author: Prakash V.

description: Came here for a work happy hour. Nice bar. We sat by the open window and it had an outdoor vibe, because the window that is pretty much floor to ceiling opens the whole way. It was good, and I think they had a happy hour?
author: Marie D.

description: Packed after work hour, great friendly staff and lovely place. Nothing against 83 proof but I couldn't consume my drink  fast enough to get out of this place as fast as possible.  Will not come back by myself because felt really out of place being alone with no one to talk to since everyone is within a group.  Even if I want to focus myself with stuff, the conversation noise is deadening to my ears as everyone is shouting to be heard.
author: Aloha M.

description: This place was really cool. Very low key and the mixologist knew their stuff. The bartenders were all welcoming and courteous to everyone who walked in.
author: Daisy S.

description: Marc with a "C" is by far the best bartender. We stopped in for a shot and his charisma and charm had us here for 2 hours. Absolutely amazing service and great drinks. 110% recommend. Prices are fair and you'll have a blast bonding with these bartenders!
author: Kris W.

description: I met up with a friend here for happy hour and it was crazy crowded on a Thursday at 5:30pm. We were barely able to manage even moving around because it was so jam packed with people. There's great atmosphere and it's definitely a popular spot. It took a good 10 minutes to get a bartender to order our drinks. Then we stood around for another 15 minutes until we found two bar stools. I love the open window to the outside here. Great spot, but way too crowded for my comfort.
author: Cindy Z.

description: I want to like this place, but it's so full of stuck up bartenders who want to make it as "hipster" as possible thinking they are in the Mission or something. I hate places who think they can just choose to serve those who 'they' think is cool or whatnot. Your location is in SOMA; just deal with it. That's my opinion.
author: Toby C.

description:
Came here for a drink after work, it was packed and quite loud.  I would not suggest this place if you are trying to have a conversation unless you are lucky enough to grab a seat.  After waiting a while and stalking people at the bar, was able to finally snag a bar stool.  I don't think I've ever been happier to not have to stand against the wall.
 
I actually had a spritzer w/ white wine and seltzer.  They put a twist of lemon peel which was a bit odd. 
 
They do have a huge flat screen TV in the front of the bar so if you ever want to watch the game here, it would be a good after work spot.
author: Kimberly L.

description:
Went to a sponsored event at 83 Proof and came away really impressed! Our group got to take over the upstairs lounge that overlooks the rest of the bar, and while it got kind of stuffy up there, the added AC unit helped a lot. The interior here is really dark but comfortable- peep the huge bottle selection on the wall and be amazed. I wouldn't say it's a non-casual place, but I was in the minority of the crowd by not wearing typical office attire.

Service was better than I could have imagined. The place was pretty packed at 6, but the bartenders were very efficient and attentive. They were also helpful when people wanted drink suggestions, creating interesting and actually good cocktails on the fly based on taste preferences. Happy hour well drinks are only $4 and a complete steal for the area; the prices actually became a challenge for us because there was a minimum $250 tab upon reserving the lounge. Eventually we got there, so I guess it's a good problem to have. We also got to bring in our own food and there was space enough upstairs for several platters, so everything worked out perfectly.

I don't work in this area so I don't know how often I'd be around to visit 83 Proof, but I had a great experience here and would totally recommend it to those in the Financial District or SoMA!
author: Brennan L.

description: Awesome place Mixologist are awesome and make a hell of a drink! Great vibe and laid back scene.
author: Alex B.

description:
Gin Dominatrix. Get it. 

Anyone who knows me knows I probably wouldn't order a drink with this name. Its weird and not fruity enough. But get this, it's gin, blackberry, and basil with an egg white foam. At that point I was like sign me up! Bartenders were great at this spot as he was happy to recommend a drink and my friend and I ended up with this fun cocktail. The crowd is a bit older and a bit more serious in a tinier spot (as few skinny tables and chairs with a small upstairs part) but come here for the drinks alone. Cheers!
author: Tammy T.

description: Cool happy hour spot. Met a friend here the other day and they don't seem to have a cocktail menu, you just tell them what you like and they make you a fancy cocktail...fine by me! I had a delicious whisky something something. They do have a beer menu though (and i'm guessing wine too?) This place was packed!
author: Ilana B.

description:
Basil, the fragrant herb also known as St Joseph's Wort of the great family Lamiaceae (meaning: mint) is the root of all things good at 83 Proof, a non-descript, too-easy-to-miss hipster bar in the heart of San Francisco's Financial District. Not many people know of St Joseph, the oft-neglected husband of the immaculate Mary who of course needs no introduction. So, 83 Proof, in the heartbeat of a city known for its embrace of all people, has offered to throw the man a bone or specifically, the best St Joseph's Wort -- okay, Basil -- Gimlet this side of the Jordan River or Mississippi.

I mean, it's just pretty darn good. Not too sweet, not too dry but the perfect blend of flavour and viscosity for a tasty treat post-work or mid-first date. Allagash? Sure, they've got it. Martinis? Yeah, they can shake 'em. French 75? Ummm, I don't know what that is but it sounds classy.  But forget that.  Instead, imagine a slightly creamy, nicely chilled concoction of an opaque laurel green. A sea of yum tranquility... alcohol below, a fragrant leaf floating above like a boat (life raft? inner tube?) ready to take you to Flavour Bay.

Give ol' Joe some love. He did help raise Jesus, you know.

Try it.  It'll become your next favorite drink.  

Signed,
The Lamiaceae's (we send our regards)
author: Dan K.

description: The decor is beautiful yet casual, the cocktails were strong and creative, and the good vibes were flowing. handcraft punch on tap and to-go! This is a major game changer - you can even bring the party home if you wanted to.
author: Matt V.

description: Mack the bartender and his boss/cohort are super nice! Great bar with awesome drinks. Try the grapefruit liquor :)
author: Melanie O.

description:
I didn't get a chance to taste the cocktails when I stopped by, but the place was bustling with a good energy at 6:30pm on a Monday, which is fairly impressive. As others have echoed, it's a lot of the FiDi tech bro types, which may or may not be your thang - but the staff is pretty attentive and they had Nikka Coffey Grain Whisky so i was a happy camper. 

the noise level is pretty intense, so be prepared to try and find a quiet nook - or better yet, sneak upstairs to get a little relief. all in all, a convenient spot to meet up with a couple of buddies, but maybe not a place i'd linger for too long, if only for the somewhat cramped atmosphere.
author: Vicki L.

description:
83 Proof's low key space is dramatically anchored with a wall of alcohol. 

Everybody say it with me: "Oh hello, gorgeous bottles of alcohol!"

300 bottles of social lubricant, mostly dominated by whiskey. I'm a gin girl through and through, they've got quite the selection of the premium stuff. There isn't a cocktail menu to be found (there's only a beer list on the wall) so come with an open mind and a thirst for adventure. Tell the barman what your preferences are and surely he'll craft you a balanced cocktail and at a price of less than $10! (I had a delicious Corpse Reviver #2)

Weekdays are deafening in here due to the financial district crowd. Speaking of which, most are men, so ladies if you and your girlfriend are standing up in your heels holding your drinks, you don't need to breathe down on someone's back to get seats, they'll just be graciously offered to you ;-)

Love the vibe here and it's not an aggressive scene even with the after work crowd. I'll be seeing you soon! That wall of alcohol left a lasting impression on me.
author: Janice C.

description: Trust the bartender. I requested a whiskey lemonade and ended up with the most amazing concoction of bourbon, ginger liqueur and agave.
author: Tiffeny Y.

description:
While this place has tasty drinks, the ambiance gets 3 stars. This is definitely a post-works drink place. 

I've come here twice late night, and it's always dead quiet... which could be a plus on a quiet evening with your SO -- but if you're looking to rage with good drinks, stay in the mission and hit up Bond for some good gimlets. 


Net net: 
- good post-work
- too quiet for rage nights
- perfect for late night quiet date
author: Kristie C.

description: Great bar!  The bartenders are very nice and make fabulous cocktails!  The upstairs sitting area is also very cute! Definitely check it out!
author: Jay M.

description:
Basil gimlet 10/10! They also have a good selection of beers ranging from $6-8 (reg prices).

Good casual happy hour spot for small groups in SOMA, but it's SUPER loud inside. Like I almost couldn't handle the loudness, but most places are like that, right?
author: Annie C.

description: One of the better cocktail bars in FiDi. Warning though, no food! The bartenders are quick and prices are reasonable. I found the space to be a bit boring.
author: Laurisha C.

description:
I met a former co-worker here for a couple of drinks to catch up - on a tuesday night. It was PACKED!

I was really concerned that it would takle forever to get drinks, as I was on a tight schedule to meet people for dinner. Wrong, The bartender was RIGHT ON, in spite of the crowd, he got me, got me drinks, kept tabs open, and closed me out at the end. He was in the zone, and my wait was very acceptable for all activities.

Drinks were superb, except standard downtown SF pricing, crowd in 20s and 30s.

Enjoy
author: Massimo M.

description:
It's crazy how 1 bad experience could ruin a bunch of previously good experiences and change one's impression of an establishment.

I started my Wednesday night over at 83 Proof which is usually a solid bar. The typical crowd is in their late 20s to late 30s of professionals from the financial district. There's 2 TV's to watch ball games (or whatever) and a well stocked bar with an excellent whiskey selection (almost entirely from America). 

I've come here several times in the past and had good experiences until now. Typically, the bartenders are pretty personable and well skilled. Unfortunately, this time I was served by a bartender that practically treated me like I was in a dive bar. Not that there's anything wrong with dives but we, as patrons, pay a premium to go to nicer bars with better service.

First off, this dude gave me some attitude when I couldn't hear what he was saying (it's pretty loud inside). Secondly, he scoffed a little at my typical one-off drink- Sazerac, half cognac, half rye. I've never been rude to a bartender before but he was kind of pushing it. I mean.. I'm ordering a solid whiskey drink with a unique twist. Don't knock it til you try it bruh. 

My reasoning behind giving this usually 4 establishment 2 stars is that I could go to one of the other dozen bars plus in the area. Until I cool off on this place, you can catch me at Michael Mina's, Pabu, Novela, Local Edition, Sutter Station, Rickhouse, Patriot House, Cafe Terminus, Sens, Natoma Cabana, Louie's, RN74 and Steph's just to name a few places.
author: Chris W.

description:
Renaming it to 1,2,3 Poof!...Would have been more fun and clever!  However, it wouldn't quite match the speakeasy vibe to this bar place! 

They specialize in cocktail drinks and bf ordered the French 75 for me because I wanted something zesty and had a sour punch to it, which that drink did!

They serve up wine, bubblies and beer.  

The ambiance is dimly lit and of wooden decor.  They have an upstairs, mini lounge area for some seclusion from the main base floor.  

Bartenders and staff is spot on - a great bar addition to the FiDi!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
This place is super annoying to find and not in the cool speakeasy way. You just have to count up (or down) the numbers on the adjacent buildings. On the other hand, I hope this keeps this place less crowded because I would actually come back here again. There is some bar seating, seating for twos along one wall of the bar, and upstairs seating too. 

My friend and I came here during happy hour. We figured there was happy hour, even though it was not advertised anywhere. I wish they had signs or menus or something. We just had to ask the bartenders. Speaking of which, the bartenders on this particular day neglected the sides of their bar and only focused in front of them, not even acknowledging their other customers. It took forever to get a drink even when the bar was not very busy, but the bartenders were pretty nice. I was slightly annoyed, but 83 Proof does have a decent selection of beers, wines, and spirits.

Happy hour prices are amazing and I would definitely come back for those. $2 off draft beers! Chill after-work vibe. Just your average FiDi bar but still a good place to hang out.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
The basil gimlet. Get it. ASAP.

I came here after a Friday of legal work, and 83 Proof was perfect for that. Indeed, for any work for that matter. This is not a place for a quiet drink to reflect on the last week; this is a place to meet with friends and chatter about what you're doing this weekend. 

As for some logistics, get off BART at the Embarcadero, and you'll be there in 3 minutes. I made it that fast in stilettos. The service is fast and friendly. There are plenty of places to stand and sit. A great casual, not really dive-y vibe--highly recommend for happy hour.

This place gets a solid 4 star--which is open to being adjusted upward.
author: Carolina G.

description:
Didn't spend a lot of time here, as we had some time to kill and wanted a quick drink. This seems to be a local spot and it was packed at around 6:30 or so. I mean packed! Like you  could hardly move or hear someone even if they yelled in your ear. Still, there drink selection is amazing. 

The gf got some sort of berry drink and it was top notch. They must have used some special alien alcohol for this one as it was fantastic. My drink was good as well. While, not cheap, it is cheaper than most of the bars that serve these types of specialty drinks. If you like you're drink in an environment which is really loud and rowdy, then sign up for this place. Only qualm I had.
author: Benny H.

description:
I came here with a couple of friends after work on a Friday. I was reading some of these reviews and noticed that one of the main concern was finding this place. Honestly, we just guessed when we saw a bar with a lot of people inside and assumed it was 83 Proof.

The place was rather small with an upstairs space to hang around. Unfortunately, there was an event going on so we couldn't go upstairs.

I got a mint mojito and I would say that it was decent. Our bartenders were fine during the first 30 minutes but when we were closing the tab, it took them a while to get my friend's card back and almost thought they lost it.

Would I come back here again? Maybe...
author: Aj C.

description:
AFTER WORK SPOT
(5 stars)

As much as I like to be as far as possible from FiDi after I've clocked out, I don't mind walking around the corner to grab a well crafted cocktail! First timer here and it will not be my last. 

Great service, great bar, great drink.

My teammates all settled for beers and I settled for a nice fancy "fufu" cocktail to close up the week. I ordered "something fruity" and the bartender asked me several questions to narrow down my vague request. I was handed a beautiful drink, very much up my alley, called GIN DOMINATRIX (minus the pepper) garnished with a basil. Ohmy! Purple drink, classy look, fresh fruit taste, and refreshing. It was a nice way to wrap the end of the week with my cool coworkers. No work, just cheers and laughing. I need that.

Jaba approved. Until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description:
Can you give a place zero stars I would. Bartenders were probably the biggest dbags I have ever come across. And I'm from Jersey. Saying something. 

Terrible service, unclean, and couldn't make a drink right to save their life. This place is a joke. Don't even pass by, just avoid.
author: Cal E.

description: Pretty chill vibe..I wandered in here on a welm cuz I liked the name.  I enjoed the Basil Gimlet, it's a great refreshing drink if you like the taste of Basil! The bartenders are very cool. Crowd is too. I recommend the Happy Hour, you can get a good buzz on some yummy drinks at a decent price!
author: Keesha F.

description:
Hands down the BEST whiskey/scotch/gin/vodka/mezcal bar in the area. The staff is hella cool and can take on the sometimes challenging FiDi crowd with ease. It's my go to spot for ANY new delicious bourbons that I want to try. They even let you bring in some grub if you are hungry. :)  

LOVE LOVE LOVE this spot. Come on Tuesday nights for some piano fun.
author: Jessica M.

description:
I like this hidden gem. It attracts a lot of working people since it is right in the middle of major workplaces. 

Pretty small but a good size to have a small to medium size group happy hour. 

Prices are fair. $10 for wine/champagne and ~$5 for beer. 

Recommend it!
author: Hiral P.

description:
Pros: Decent bar, reasonable drink selection, very lively happy hour spot.

Cons:  Low IQ of bar staff....poor judgement on their behalf.

 I came with a group of 6 coworkers and grabbed an empty table on the 1st floor after a small group had clearly left and left behind empty drinks . We were told to move because the previous group, who were apparently "regulars", had left to take a smoke break and would be back at any moment.

One of the bartenders was very adamant about us moving and annoyed by my group trying to sit at the table, the manager, who was sharper and more accomodating, moved us upstairs and brought chairs for us. 

Turns out the "regulars" never came back.....which seemed obvious to me and my party given the empty glasses. 

Bottom line: If you have "reserved tables" than that's one thing, otherwise don't offer 2nd class service to a group of new patrons who will buy lots of drinks and maybe even become regulars. Too many other bars to ever come back to this poorly managed saloon.

Had this not happened I would say this spot would be worth revisiting but given the poor judgement and low IQ of the bar staff I would say nah....next work related happy hour will be elsewhere.
author: Ben I.

description: Great place for Happy Hour after work. Gets crowded as it's on the smaller side. Snag the bench seat in the front where the window opens up. The bartender with all the tattoos on his arms is top notch even on a crowded night he was super quick with the pours and even took the time to slide me some samples when my go to keg was tapped out.
author: Ry B.

description: Came here with a group after dinner. Quiet atmosphere and friendly bartenders. That were excited to make us cocktails. That was fun. Reasonably priced and a good time.
author: J. Karim A.

description:
Here's the 411 on 83 Point:
Time visited: ~5pm on a Tuesday night

Drinks - Decently priced for a downtown bar, drinks range from $8-$12 during happy hour, fast and friendly bar tenders, overall pretty yummy drinks

Atmosphere - Older crowd of working professionals 35+ (definitely felt like a youngin here), mellow, not too loud, small seating area and people don't really go in and out...they definitely linger for a bit, hard to get seating for this reason

Interior - small, but very trendy set up with great light and non-stuffy feel 

I'd come back for a drink or two if in the area, definitely not my favorite bar in FiDi but not a terrible bar.
author: Stefany Z.

description: Great service, cocktails good but nothing special. Happy hour is 2$ off and it ends at 7 pm
author: Neil P.

description: Great whiskey selection, probably one of the most extensive in San Francisco.  The bar section can get cramped, but there's a small upstairs seating area as well.  Prices are on the high side.
author: A C.

description: Friday night cocktails. No food available to snack on and the crowd is very very young techie. The cocktails were pretty good.
author: Tina C.

description:
Today I was met with the kind of bartender that you see in movies. My friend and I approached the Friday HH busy bar a bit apprehensive. We were shyly looking for a cocktail menu, but the gentleman tending bar met us with a smile through the crowd. We asked for a menu and he lifted his arms and said, "I'm your cocktail menu!! What are you looking for."

This sounds cliché, but he was exactly what I wanted out of a bartender. He was friendly, but not TOO friendly. He listened to what we liked, asked questions to make sure he was creating a cocktail that would please, and he pushed us out of our comfort zone. The two cocktails that he made were quite possibly the best I've had in the city... and just to be clear, I've lived here 13 years and I like my whiskey.

83 Proof is a great after-work-hours bar with friendly staff. They have 2 to 4-top tables and a lot of bar seats. The bathrooms are clean. They take cash and card.  And most importantly, ALL of the staff is friendly, hardworking, and knowledgeable.
author: Katie V.

description:
Decent drinks at fair prices, but really shitty service.

You're a bar. A bar on Saturday night. How the F*** does it take 45 minutes to get a drink? It's not just me, EVERYONE said they waited that long.

You're a bartender. This is your job. You're a professional. Why the F*** do you give your customers attitude for ordering drinks? I ordered multiple drinks for my group (because you took FOREVER to get to me) and you were super rude and gruffly told me that you can't memorize it. I don't know, I see plenty of bartenders calmly, cooly, and kindly take a much larger drink order just fine. No need to be a d*** to your customers for ordering drinks.. AT A BAR!
author: Kazu O.

description: I really enjoy the ambience of this bar, good place to grab drinks and talk to people without having to yell over loud music. Tons of beer selections and the bartender was really attentive and quick on making drinks too. Best part is it's pretty affordable- I order a cider, cab, and a Jameson on the rocks for $21.00. I highly recommend this place for happy hour.
author: Joy-Alonica B.

description: Too crowded for my liking with the after-work crowd on weekdays. Wait for when the crowd dissipates a bit or bar hop elsewhere.
author: Yad L.

description:
I am kind of a huge fan of this place despite it's awkward position and severe lack of everything else nearby. 

This place definitely lives up to its name, 83 proof is full of amazing whiskeys, rums, and all kinds of other liquors that I care slightly less about than the first two. I love that the bartenders are very knowledgable and definitely know all of the liquor they have on the shelves. They can make great recommendations, great drinks as well as help you do a progression, an almost whiskey tasting if you will if you so desire.

The location is a little weird, there is a large bar, comfy seats and lots of standing room but I can't imagine this place getting insanely crowded at any one point.

In general, I'm a big fan of places that can create drinks because the bartenders know more than just what is on the menu. When they realize that you're a serious [insert liquor name here] connoisseur they don't give you that "did you look at our menu" crap and just make you something interesting.
author: Lorrie M.

description:
Oooh, ooooooh! Your typical lowkey "financial district" bar so expect SF pricing for your draaanks.

Bartenders can definitely make a solid Grey Hound. Would recommend for a smaller group happy hour.
author: Jo L.

description: My favorite bar in  Soma!!! I work a few streets down so I come here after work often. All the bartenders are super friendly especially nick!! He makes the best drinks!! I always tell them to surprise me and they think of something  awesome! If your looking for a unique drink that you will love come here!
author: Leah P.

description:
Good selection of beers, during happy hour there was a pianist playing modern songs. Right when we closed the tab, he approached us asking us for a song for him to play.

Nice place, I'd come back.
author: Ricardo C.

description:
Wonderful bar in the financial district of SF :)

It's located on First street and it could be easily missed if you weren't looking for it. There is no big signs, just a window and a door that gives you the view of the bar. It's small and cozy. It has a feel of a speak easy and I really like that. Seems like a great place to relax after work. The lighting is a bit dim, it has an orange glow to it which gives the place a sort of warm and cozy feel. There are two floors, the first floor consist of a standing area and the bar with table seating and the second floor serves as an additional seating area with couches. The second floor is very small, it allows you to overlook the entire bar which is nice (: 

I was here for a friend's party. He had booked the entire bar for a private event and it was a ton of fun. The bartenders are very friendly and helpful. They were pretty on point with drink recommendations if you didn't know what to order. Their various cocktails tasted pretty good. They're really well known for the basil gimlet which kind of reminds me of a mojito. They had a whisky cocktail that I thought was pretty good too.

It was a great bar, and I'm glad my friend decided to have his event here because I wouldn't have gotten to try it if he didn't.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Used to head to 83 Proof regularly back in my *more* lush days, aka being closer to 21 than I currently am, and popped in on Friday after work with some girlfriends. The bar was packed with the typical after work crowd, which made getting drinks tough, but we succeeded anyway. 

They were *sadly* out of Fireball, so we opted for Jameson shots, pineapple backs, with a Lagunitas to follow. I got the first round for my gal pal and me, $22 which is not too bad. Our other friends tried the oft raved about Basil Gimlet, which was our second round. Very good! I used to have a major crush on Mr. Gimlet, and had to start making them at home with cheap gin in an attempt to save some of my sheckles. I watched the barkeep craft this beauty, and it was awesome. From muddling the fresh basil, to adding just the right amount of lemon juice, plenty of vodka, and a bruised basil leaf as garnish, it was frothy, tart, and got the job done. 

We had trouble finding a spot to sit, like many of the other patrons, so we went upstairs to sweat it out for a while. The GM / owner should see about installing a vent to make it cooler up there, it was like sauna. Felt a little like I was in a can of sardines because of how packed it was, but that can be fun once in a while, right?
author: Crystal C.

description:
YUMMY GIMLET! 
also, $4 beer :) 
Came here for happyhour around 4 and the bar is very dark inside.  It's probably better to come around 6 so that the lighting inside starts to show.  It got crowded around 5 and by the time we left people were waiting for our seats.  This place only serves alcohol and no food. 

My gimlet was delicious.  Barely tasted any vodka and the lime juice was refreshing!
author: Kristin C.

description:
You know what's worse than being rejected by a cute girl at a bar like 83 Proof?

Getting rejected by the bartender.

Thanks to my experience from Coffee Meets Bagel, I'm accustomed to getting turned down by gals. But nothing prepared me for a rejection at 83 Proof. What does it mean when a bartender, whose purpose is to make me a drink, refuses to even acknowledge me? 

a new low.

Is it cause I smell?
Hell naw, son. I be mooching off those free cologne samples at Macy's all day.

Do I look cheapity cheap?
Don't look now but I carry six black cards.
My Spalding is cement cause I ball so hard.
#RapGame #Freestyle

Am I.... ugly?
Hahaha, don't play *brush hair back*

Well, the only reasonable explanation left is that the bartender is a JERK. A jerk who would rather clean his 3 empty glasses than to take my order. A jerk who ignored my girlfriend's friendly request for a Hibiki. A jerk who turned away from my buddy's assertive plead for a Saturday night drink.

Don't front, jerk-hipster-bartender. Y'all weren't even all that busy. Would it kill you to pour a drink for a customer who's not as hipster as your beard? News flash, jerk. If you and all yo friends at Dolores all be rocking a beard with a fedora and cuffed pants, then you're really just MAINSTREAM in disguise.
(WARNING: Calling a hipster 'mainstream' is equivalent to pouring water on the Witch of Oz. Only do so in extreme circumstances)

Damn it, now I'm mad. Cause I really want to try all those awesome drinks from 83 Proof. Stupid hipster bartender.
author: Ringo M.

description:
Definitely a popular happy hour destination for people working in the area, the bar packed to the brim on Friday after work and only started to turn down after 7pm. $4 drafts, $4 wells & I think it ends at 7pm. Friendly bartenders, & hardly any wait time while ordering drinks.

There's a decent amount of space on the first floor, with the backroom being more open but most people were standing, there's not a whole lot of seating room. The bar itself has a nice wood finish to it but it's the massive liquor selection that's worth noting. The liquor emphasis is on whiskey but they carry all the local artisan liquor as well. Get your gin with St. Georges! Decent draft selection too, noticed a few beers from San Diego so it might be ever changing.
author: Steven C.

description: Discovered this place yesterday and was very impressed. The HH price is great and the service is even better.. especially with how packed it was. We really enjoyed talking with the bartender, Nick!
author: Danielle C.

description:
So, my previous review was removed because it contained "incorrect business info." I tried to come here during their stated Yelp business hours, but they were closed for a private event. This is what happened, but it apparently violates Yelp policy to punish a business for their Yelp info being incorrect. That actually seems fair, in general, because these mistakes happen. Except that 83 Proof's Yelp hours match their website, so they're not incorrect on Yelp. And neither their Facebook page nor their Twitter mentioned this closure. 

Fine, maybe that review wasn't fair and Yelp was within their rights to remove it, so I'll leave a less emotional, more balanced review in hopes that it'll be allowed to stand:

First off, I've been here before and the bartenders are great. So great that I've brought at least 15 people here who'd never heard of it, and all of them loved it. My favorite part of coming here is that you can chat with a bartender about what you like, and they'll make a very thoughtful suggestion. It's nice if you don't know your way around a cocktail bar. Then they'll make the drink, and make it very well. The atmosphere is nice too.

Now that I've been fair and said what is good, I'll express annoyance at a business practice of theirs: closing for private events. This bar will be closed sometimes because they rent themselves out for private events. Obviously this is their prerogative, but I, personally, don't want to patronize a business that does this because I don't want to have to check their Facebook and Twitter every time I plan to visit. Other people may not mind, but this annoys me. It annoys me enough that I'll probably choose other bars in the future. 

So, hopefully this review will be allowed to stand since all I'm doing is complaining about a business practice, rather than complaining about their hours not matching their Yelp page.
author: Nick A.

description: Most amazing liquor selection. I'm a rum guy and the crew here knows their rum. And everything else. Great space - beautiful bar buildout. Incredibly knowledgeable and friendly staff.
author: Jay L.

description:
The drinks were fair, and chatting up the bartender revealed that his grumpiness was probably due to a long day at work--but that doesn't excuse how overwhelmingly rude he was towards my friends when we first arrived. While some of us were rather inebriated and took a fair second to decide what we wanted, the bartender made comments like "7 of you and only 3 have ordered drinks?" "hurry up hurry up" and "this is a bar, you're going to come here and not order anything?"

3 stars because I've come here before, and I like the vibe of a small, more intimate setting. The bartender was very nice when I talked to him individually, and grabbed me a glass of water before I even asked. And $4 beer during happy hour is worth the return trip.
author: Nicole C.

description:
Met a professional friend here for happy hour today at 5p.  It was pretty empty when we arrived but was quite packed by the time we left around 7p.  My friend had beer, but I ordered a gimlet, and the bartender suggested I order the basil gimlet.  I'm not sure what type of gin he used, but the drink was really nice - tasty, balanced and not too sweet.  In fact, I had to have another.  

I found the place refreshingly unpretentious and the service attentive and friendly, even as it got busier and busier.  Definitely will check 83 Proof out again.
author: Kimberly Q.

description: Best time to go is 8-9 PM on a Saturday. This bar is a gem for weekends. We went after seeing a movie at the Metreon, and easily got seats at the bar.  Since it was early, the bartender Mark was able to be really creative, and would ask questions create unique cocktails for us. He made me a drink with vodka, apricot bitters, lime and honey. It was fantastic.  We ended up staying for a few hours, and the place never got insanely overly crowded which I loved. It was an ace bar, for extremely reasonable prices given the attention and detail that went into our drinks.
author: Kristen T.

description: This place was awesome !! Made the best drinks ever !! Next time we are in SF we are definitely going back. Customer service was also outstanding !! This place will not disappoint !
author: Arlene C.

description:
Another great bar a few blocks from my place.
Been here a few times after work. Excellent bartenders, relaxing vibe.
Upstairs gets a little stuffy, but if you get there during happy hour, it's pretty packed. But, hey, it's in the FiDi.
author: Amy O.

description:
I came here on a Friday night after dinner around 9pm a while back and it was basically empty. I'm not sure if it was an off night or if we just came at a really weird time since I know it gets packed during happy hour. 

There were two bartenders and both were very chill and pretty knowledgeable. They simply asked if we were feeling like having "strong & boozy" or "light & citrus-y" drinks and off they went! The drinks were well made and the "strong & boozy" were quite strong indeed. 

I plan on going back soon to check out what other cocktails they come up with for sure.
author: Liza X.

description:
From the look of it, 83 Proof is just another FiDi bar watering hole for the after work crowd. But upon closer inspection, it isn't just that, it offers a little more, and can be a later night drop in joint, especially if you like creative drinks and personal service. 

They have a huge collection of spirits on the wall behind the bar. If it isn't too crowded and crazy, you can talk to the bartenders and tell them what kind of things you like as far as taste, and then they will concoct a special drink to match your taste. 

So it is sort of like Omakase Sushi meets FiDi Spirits Mixologist. Like in Omakase sushi, you trust the sushi chef to prepare something delectable, and the same goes here. The bartenders are very knowledgable and customize your drink.

This is great for the SF drinking crowd of today, many of which are self proclaimed foodies who desire a personalized custom experience with their food and their drinks, and because the trend is you have to try special drink concoctions like you have to try specially prepared dishes. Only difference here is there isn't necessarily  a Pris Fixed tasting menu here like your foodie chic resto. Maybe that is the next trend?

I found that this trend is popular especially with the young ladies, so that they have ample fodder to share on FB to their friends to show they have discerning taste and know how to get around town and have a good time. And of course, where the ladies go, the men will follow, so this place should keep doing well, despite being inauspicious from the street in signage and detail. 

83 proof is known by the Dot Com techy types that now populate a large part of FiDi and who replaced the Insurance and Financial suits in many places, so the vibe is a little more casual then 25 years ago when 3 piece Suits and 3 martini expense account lunches predominated, especially the later in the evening you drop in. 

They are well known for their Basil Gimlet, but don't stop there on your Social Lubrication Safari. 

Try an Omakase with the sushi chef, er I mean, Personalized Spirit with your Spirits Mixologist.
author: Wanugee N.

description:
There was a software issue with emails getting through to the staff. 
Once Vernica contacted us she has been nothing but professional and helpful with planning our event. She gave me her personal number to contact her in case there was an email issue again. I can't wait to meet her and thank her for making this event possible.
author: Ellie T.

description:
Ok. Just best place in S.F. to have a drink. You just come in, and believe me, don't ask for a mojito. Just ask for something LIKE a mojito. You will have a marvelous drink. The bartender will take what you love, and make you the perfect drink for you. And they are good for that!
The best thing about that it's cheap! Like 10$ the cocktail!
Just try this place!!
author: Alexis L.

description:
Decent spot for a quick drink. Watch out though, this place gets SUPER packed!!! The drinks overall are rather good, but I simply cannot get into the whole standing room only, super loud, super packed bar scene. And when I say this place gets loud, I mean real loud....you can barely hear the person standing next to you even if they're yelling. 

Their drinks are rather delicious though! They also have a vast array of drinks so you can find just about anything. The bartenders are also pretty friendly and attentive. 

I've been here on several occasions and have had mixed experiences. I went around 2 pm once to grab some wine with some co-workers and it was actually rather nice. Not crowded and most of all not loud so I would highly recommend going during off-peak hours in order to truly be able to enjoy your experience. 

Tips:
-If you want to be able to hear the person you're with and not be elbowed every three seconds go before 4 pm in order to avoid losing your voice from yelling over everyone.
-You virtually can't go wrong with drinks, so don't be afraid to try something new!
author: Sami F.

description:
Solid happy hour with terrific service! $4 draft beers and other well drinks - hard pressed to find a better deal than this in FiDi.

If you're looking for an after work spot this is it! Bartenders are attentive and friendly. They dim the lights early on so it feels more upscale than it really is. Fun atmosphere that's noisy but not too loud so still good for conversation. 

Only complaint is the seating area gets crowded really easily. Upper floor lounge is available for private parties if you're looking for a space. If not, show up around 5pm and be ready to stand back to back with coworkers, friends and cheerful strangers.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Does know what a black manhattan is.... They used the wrong Gin for a different martini. It's cute and small inside... so many other great bars in SF to choose from. #lastresort
author: Jenna P.

description:
83 Proof's slogan is "If you've got the time, we've got the everything." And It's a pretty fair statement. 

+ They've got friendly barkeeps that know how to make a mean cocktail. 
+ They've got a cocktail list you can choose from or you can just give them a liquor and they'll make something.
+ They rarely have a wait.
+ The prices are reasonable for the area ($9-$12 per drink.)
+ They have an intimate upstairs area that can hold a group of about 15 fairly well.

In fact the only think they don't have is food, but who needs to eat when you're drinking this well?
author: Tiffany N.

description:
83 Proof is one of a litany of solid cocktail bars/lounges nestled down in to SOMA. It offers up a dandy combination of tasty craft cocktails and various other drinks in a decently lounge-y setting. 

The cocktailers here are plenty nice and willing to work with you to find a drink you'll like, pull off a dealer's choice, or make a solid off of their regular menu. I didn't sense any of the pretentious attitude I caught at another notable nearby bar, which is always a welcome relief. Drink prices run right along with the standard SOMA cocktail prices - around $9-$12/each, which is totally fine for a solid cocktail made with good hooch and an experienced hand. 

This bar has been in the rotation on my last few visits to SF, and I totally see it staying heavy in the mix the next time I'm back. I totally enjoy this spot.
author: Don B.

description: A great selection of beer, wine and almost every type of drink you can think of. Nice bartenders and chill Atmo.
author: Matthew P.

description: Friendly staff. Food is ok but expected from a place that is primarily a bar.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
I went here a few weeks back with a group from work before it really got busy (3-6), and that is the time to come!  The bartenders have time to create a new drink for you based on your alcohol preferences, and the drinks they make are astonishingly good.  

Upstairs is cozier and less crowded than the main level, so try to get up there if its busy.  Nobody was even up there, and it kind of felt reserved but its NOT.  Note, don't go in hoodies or t-shirts, most of the people there are at least in polos.

Great drinks, great bartenders, great atmosphere
author: Matt U.

description: Really cool little bar. San Francisco is pretty expensive but not this place. Cocktails are very tasty and not expensive at all. Bartenders are very friendly and nice too. I also loved the fact that the music wasn't blasting and i could have a normal conversation with friends without yelling at each other.
author: Gabi K.

description:
On our bar hopping tour of the Soma area we wound up at 83 Proof. The space is narrow but they have a nice second level area and some seating down below as well. Their selection of hard liqueurs are well rounded and a decent variety of beers on draft. 

They have 2 bathrooms, 1 is for both Women and Men and the other is just women. Thought I throw that out as an extra perk for the ladies. 

Overall Thoughts

I don't have anything negative to say since we weren't there for too long but based off my first impressions I enjoyed the atmosphere and could see myself coming back
author: Eddie W.

description: Drinks were not bad, however the service is lacking.  We came here on a saturday night for a friend's bday. They has reserved the space so I would think 83 proof would be prepared for a large party.  Sadly there were two bartenders and it took on average 30-45 just to order drinks.  When were were finally up to order the bartender said they couldn't handle more than 2 drinks at once (of course with attitude).  Wish they had a bar upstairs then the downstairs area wouldn't get so crowded.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Great atmosphere and San Francisco ambiance. It gets crowded after work so try to get here early. The bartenders are amazing and know how to concoct anything!
author: Linda H.

description:
Why haven't I written a review about this place yet? HMm hard to notice on one of the busiest streets in SF. It's direction is towards the bay bridge. With excellently crafted cocktails, a professional staff and a swanky yet casual atmosphere. Small venue but perfect for an after work drink =) 

Ps. If work crowds aren't in your immediate bag of tricks, don't bother coming here.

Hours of operation: M-Tuesday 2p-12am
Wed-Thur-2p-2a
Fri-12p-2a
Sat-8p-2a
author: Kathy V.

description: 2 off draft beers for happy hour! Turns out to be like 4$ a pint. Pretty cheap. However it is harder to find because it doesn't have any protruding signs. I was lucky to get seating with my group because we went around 5pm but we could have been left standing
author: Georgia T.

description: Great place for post-work drinks with the coworkers. Small general area and I think they had an upstairs section as well. Gin and tonic was made to a good proportion and the bartenders were friendly. Loved the vibe too. Just a bit narrow of a place for my liking but I'll be back.
author: Ryan J.

description:
Sure. What the heck do I know about a bar when I'm not an imbiber? Well, here's my one cents' worth.

You have a nice little lofty area in the back for you and your pals. We jammed a dozen+ people up there and it was coze. Nice place if you can get it. Downstairs they're slinging drinks along the long bar and making friends with you as you sit and sip.

It's got one of those dimly lit vibes, and it wasn't so screaming loud so you couldn't have a conversation. But it ain't a quiet little place, either. I shouted for an hour or so and then got out.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Great place to hangout after work. Great drinks, great bar, and the staff are hip. I recommend their happy hour $4.00 drinks.
author: Steve A.

description:
Proof point.

What has changed in seven years: 2007 somehow became 2014

What has not changed in seven years: Less than $20 for a two excellent cocktails (Hot Toddy and Old Fashioned) made by a very friendly bartender.

What was discovered on a second visit that took way too long to make happen: An upstairs area perfect for conversation and relaxation.

All proof it's still a five star spot.
author: Jason B.

description:
Who shows up at a bar but doesn't drink booze? 

*raises hand*

Although I had volunteered myself last night to be the DD, I still appreciate super cool bartenders and good drinks.

Thanks for taking my card last night instead of my friend's, he had already paid for dinner.

Thanks for being super attentive to our drink needs (We wanted a bitter cocktail but ended up with old fashioneds but the bartender making our drinks was a super sweetheart, THANK YOU!) AND helping me out when I felt like a divorced child (my friends were arguing, but it was all out of love)

You guys are dope.

Coming back to try this basil gimlet people keep raving about but I think I might just sit down and sip Jameson for a night or two.
author: Susy C.

description: What a gem! Great bar, plenty of seating, not too loud so you can still have a conversation.  Very friendly and knowledgeable bartenders who made good recommendations, large selection of beverages, and perfectly mixed cocktails.  I had something that was a twist on the basil gimlet...delish!  The ambiance was fantastic - classy and modern at the same time. I will definitely be coming back again soon!
author: Jaching H.

description:
A long overdue update - I reserved the upstairs for a birthday party last year, and it worked out super well. The only slight downside which is not controllable is that it was in the midst of a SF heatwave (yes, it exists!) so the upstairs was actually quite hot and there's no AC. They had a big fan for us, but it was still pretty warm. 

Also, there was a wedding party on the main floor, so we didn't feel too comfortable hanging out downstairs until later in the evening when both groups had pretty much combined in a haze of boozy good times. 

I worked with Veronica and she was super nice. There was a deposit/minimum for the upstairs but we easily met it with a group of ~30 people. Veronica was also there, and made sure all was taken care of. This is a great spot to reserve for an event - either the smaller space upstairs or a larger event for downstairs or the entire space.
author: Veronica H.

description: Can get a little crowded, but what good bar doesn't during happy hour on a Thursday or Friday? Drinks are strong and bartenders are great!
author: Manogi M.

description:
Came here after work with a friend around 7.  Well, it was just after 7, but it wasn't our first time there, so we weren't sure whether happy hour had ended.

The bartender was really sweet.  She let us buy beer at happy hour price anyway :)  The place was crowded, but it didn't seem like anyone had a problem getting a drink.  Although the place looks intimidating at first because everyone's dressed up, the people we met were friendly.  The crowd was younger than at other FiDi / SoMa places I've been to.  I live near happy hour places that cater to 45+ year old execs, so this was a MUCH better change.  Much less pretentious.

Bartenders seemed like they knew what they were doing as far as drinks go, too.  I will go as far to say that these bartenders seemed like a better mixologist than the one I had at Bourbon & Branch.

Coming back! So close to my work.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
This was the first bar I came to when I moved into the city. 4 years later... hands down, one of my favorite bars! Bartenders are awesome (Hi Mark) and know their drinks. 

It can get crowded real fast (sometimes a bit of a sausage fest) but casual happy hour spot great to go after work. I would expect to stand unless you can get a table or a seat at the bar. 


Highly recommend dropping by.... even if it's for a quick beer!
author: Becky K.

description: Great hidden spot. Lucked upon on it when heading for a different bar and spent the entire evening there. Fantastic prices for the city and fun vibe. There is an upstairs lounge area that was empty (on a Friday night) and was the perfect spot to take over. Bartenders were really friendly and helpful, and it never seemed to get too crowded. Will definitely come back.
author: Leslie F.

description:
I came in here to celebrate Mardi Gras with a couple of friends recently and it was the perfect location to meet downtown in between all of our hectic workdays. 

Drinks are well made and stiff. The bartender was attentive and friendly.

Check out the second floor, it's nice and intimate.
author: Rajiv S.

description:
Cool spot in SoMa to grab a drink. Came here on a Friday night and it wasn't too crowded, so it was fairly easy to order a drink and find a table. I like the front area where it's basically open to the outside so there's fresh air and not so stuffy unlike other places. Very laid back vibe with good people and good drinks. The back has a loft upstairs that fits more people. Bartenders are nice and keep the drinks flowing. It's not overly loud where you can't have a conversation but it's not quiet either. 

Good selection of whiskey but can make a variety of drinks if you're into that. GF ordered a gimlet and it was actually really good.  I'll definitely be coming back here!
author: Andrew S.

description: Came here twice. First time on a Tuesday and I really liked it. Wasn't too busy and the bartenders were able to suggest some interesting drinks. Came back again on a Friday and I was treated terribly just for trying to order. Got 3 few rounds and each time the bartenders seemed to be making it my problem for trying to order. Do not recommend and I won't be back.
author: Robert P.

description:
Love this bar! It's intimate with a low key crowd.
The service has always been really quick, and the drinks have always been really tasty and creative.
author: Stella H.

description: This place gets annoyingly crowded, but a crowd is telling, right? Five stars for the skilled bartenders. Despite how busy they are, they somehow seem able to keep track of who walked up to the bar next to order drinks. I love that. Also, these are bartenders who you can give one specific request to, such as "make me something with Tito's", and you will receive a concoction that will exceed your expectations. And I mean cocktails that aren't even on their menus. My friends have also asked them for one to two specific requirements, and the bartenders consistently deliver. Not only that, but you can see the smiles on their faces when they get the liberty to showcase their skills. Yay for their talent and service.
author: Liv L.

description:
Chill place with bespoke drinks. Bartender will make you whatever you like or invent something on the fly. Their most popular drink is the basil gimlet, which is nice and refreshing.

Service is good and was quick when I was there.
author: Katrina L.

description:
This is a really cool place to just hang out and chill. The atmosphere is really laid back, and it's usually not that crowded as long as you avoid the after work people. They should be out by around 9pm. Upon entering, I've had little trouble finding a spot a the bar or grabbing a table. 

The bartenders here are absolutely fantastic. I remember the first time I came here and asked for a drink menu, one of the bartenders pointed to his head and replied, "It's right here." I described to him the kind of drinks I like, and then he worked his magic and served me something really tasty. I appreciate that they put in the extra effort to make drinks based your preferences, as everyone has a different palate. 

I also enjoy their vast selection of whiskey. I always make it a point to try a different whiskey whenever I come, and I love how they always have a recommendation based on other whiskeys I like. The bartenders are very knowledgeable so don't hesitate to ask about anything they have on the shelves. If you're not feeling adventurous, they'll likely have your favorite whiskey in stock so take a seat and enjoy a glass.
author: Nei N.

description:
Great small place, when you just want to stop by and grab a drink or 2+.  happy hr is frm noon to 7pm M-F can get really crowded around 5pm 

cheap drinks too.
author: Isa W.

description: A coworker and I went here for Happy Hour last week. It was a cozy, intimate setting, the bartenders were super nice, and they make a delicious Old Fashioned. We'll definitely be going back!
author: Kristen D.

description:
Great spot for a cocktail, especially if you're a whiskey fan. I'm personally not, but after asking the bartender why she pulled cherry jam and maple syrup out of the fridge for a cocktail, she offered my friend and me a little taste of the whiskey sour she made with it. Delicious.

It was a little crowded when I arrived, but the crowd was energetic and well-mannered. Will definitely be back to try a few other drinks.
author: Andrew M.

description:
This place is a madhouse on Fridays for happy hour. You literally have to push and shove your way to the bar. I arrived around 7pm and everyone was drunk already.

Drinks are decent, if not inconsistent. First martini was fantastic, second one sucked. Just depends on the bartender, I guess.

Probably won't come back unless I'm in the area. Too many finance bros up in this joint.
author: Tiffany W.

description: Mediocre cocktail bar. Bartenders use lots of stock ingredients, as opposed to fresh ones found at most legit cocktail bars.
author: Per L.

description:
Friendly bartenders, decent selections... It's just been done before... Not saying that I wouldn't go here again next time I'm in SF, but I don't think I'd seek it out... The draft lines seemed fairly regular, liquor selections were OK, but nothing special...

Maybe I've just been spoiled by the places I do seek out, saw the high reviews, and expected more...
author: Josh D.

description: I've been known to step into this bar from time to time for a quick Basil Gimlet or two and have had great experiences previously. However yesterday we went in and the bartender was just the rudest person ever (yesterday he was wearing an SF Giants hat and had tattoos on his arms). Even me and the stranger standing at the bar next to me chatted "Geez! What's wrong with this guy?". The man next to me pointed at me to order first but the bartender just walked away. Then when he came back he said that's why he didn't serve us because the guy pointed to me to order (being a gentleman) but apparently that split second was enough for the bartender to walk away. It was literally in the .5 second time that the guy said "she was here first" that the bartender thought NOPE and walked off, so rude. Then when he came back, he barked "ORDER...I NEED ORDERS, SPEAK!" so I said my order QUICK and then he asked for the order for the guy next to me but he walked off mid sentence while the guy was still ordering. Brought back half of what the guy actually ordered then brought my drinks last. He was the most unfriendly bartender I've ever experienced. Unfortunately I'm not too keen on coming back to 83 Proof. Don't think my coworkers who were standing behind me are interested in this place anymore either after seeing how awful this bartender was to people.
author: R P.

description:
I came by 83 Proof with some co-workers after a long Wednesday work day. It was hump day, so that called for a happy hour.

We had around 6+ people throughout the night and there were spots all over that accommodated us. We got  beers and drinks throughout the night, and I didn't see a specific happy hour menu, but they gave us some sort of deal. They charged me $12 dollars for 3 beers that were listed at $6 dollars a piece. Works for me.

This joint has a nice vibe overall with affordable drinks. The only gripe I have is that is too loud for my liking. I was struggling to hear all my coworkers and after I left, my ears were ringing like I just left a concert. They have an upstairs area, so maybe i'll check that out next time.
author: David C.

description: Good prices. Super flat brut rose. sad face. Definitely gets crowded, so get here before 5pm for a seat.  The upstairs portion has seats or about 15-20 and is super dark. Definitely gets a little toasty in this little cove.
author: Alice Z.

description: It's super easy to walk by this spot and never even notice the door- it's simply marked with "83" and no other real signs. I've been coming here for years, and it's definitely worth a trip. The bartenders are knowledgable and will concoct a drink with flavors you like if you give them a good description. There's also a pretty extensive scotch list for those interested. Only pitfall is that it's pretty loud and can be difficult to really chat here.
author: Vinitha R.

description: Good place to hangout after work.  Me and my girlfriends arrived around 5pm.  We were lucky to get the bench in front of the window with a nice view of the street and people passing by.  They have a pretty big selection of alcohol and the ambiance is great.  Definitely a cool spot to have happy hour.
author: Rachel L.

description:
My new favorite straight bar (sorry since I'm gay, my preferences need to be clearly categorized). They make the best French 75 ever and the bartender is very nice and friendly and recommends great cocktails (I decided to be adventurous tonight).
Will come back so very soon
author: Alan T.

description: Loved this place! The bartenders really put time and effort into making the drinks exactly as they should be. It's a small, intimate bar with great ambience. There was a piano player which was a nice touch. I got the the basil gimlet which was great and my husband got a manhattan...too strong for me, but he liked it.
author: Elana K.

description: Great place for winding down with colleagues and co-workers from a long (or short) day's work. The bartenders are great and sometimes quite imaginative, if given the chance to mix you a surprise concoction of their own designs.
author: Chris C.

description:
I've come here on Fridays with friends after work, so naturally it gets REALLY FULL. Tons of people milling around means you have to weasel your way to get to the bar to order. Best thing to do would be to have one person to order for the group.

The drinks here are small and the crowd is usually Deloitte/business folks on Friday nights.
author: Katherine S.

description:
Post dinner, we needed some proper fuel in terms of alcohol since I only partake in one glass of wine with dinner. I'm often in this neighborhood and always looking for good bars. I pulled up yelp and was surprised to have never found this spot before. 

After walking in and noticing no sign outside, and a nice dark interior I was taken aback by the selection of whiskey especially bourbon, this was a winner. We started off with a couple beers, they have some good options on tap. I had some type of tasty Pilsner, but I forget the brand. 

While we were putting back our second beer I noticed the bartender making some very interesting bourbon based concoction, and began asking questions about it. It had a name, which eludes me, but it had some type of blood orange liquor, bitters, something else bitter, and bourbon with a lemon peel in it. It was an interesting and tasty cocktail. These guys are true mixologists and whiskey lovers, just explain what you like and they will craft something interesting you will enjoy.

A real gem for this area!
author: Jonah K.
