description: A great place for good cocktails and to hang with friends. No loud or obnoxious music so you can just have a drink and still talk to friends. Very comfortable place with good patrons. There isn't a cocktail menu but they know all the classic drinks.
author: Darany T.

description:
I'm spoiled to have this place within a few minutes walking distance from my work. Their red wine selection is always spot on and it's only $7 a glass!

The decor, lighting, price, people, drink quality, and location make this place the perfect spot for a quick drink after work. I also appreciate how it's out of the way just enough to filter out tourists.

My only qualm is that it's a little loud but I don't mind yelling at the end of the day I guess. Exercises the vocal chords or somethin'.

The ratio of men to women here is around 10:1
author: Kathy S.

description:
The most amazing mojito of my life! The bar tenders were amazing and friendly which is hard to find I'm this city. Plus, my first drink was free! 

It was busy enough to be fun but not overwhelming full so that it's annoying
author: Jacqueline M.

description: If you're a big fan of whiskey then go here.  This place is ALWAYS packed during happy hour. It's small but intimate. I've had their Old Fashion, really good.
author: Liz D.

description: There are few times I can go into a bar on a Friday night and actually get a drink. Came here with a friend after work and fell in love. Wasn't too crowded, and the bartender actually had a conversation with us! He crafted our drinks according to our tastes and surprised us with whatever he felt like whipping up. He also gave a background on what was in the drinks and why he chose the ingredients. I really enjoyed that this was a complete experience, and not the typical weekend rush trying to turn out well drinks as fast as possible. Very seldom are you able to get to know your bartender and I really appreciated that about this place. Definitely coming back!
author: Jonathan B.

description:
Great value for beer!  Very wide selection of scotch at reasonable prices.  The place gets busy after work and it's loud enough where it becomes hard to talk.

AJ, Mark and the staff are all awesome.
author: Anand A.

description:
This was a really nice find for happy hour in the financial district/SOMA. Some co-workers had been recommending that I try this place so I finally got around to it and it was a treat! I asked the bartender to make me something a little sweet and a little sour and he put on a show; he was also one of the nicest bartenders I've met. He made a delicious drink with blueberries, mint, rum and a few other ingredients. I wish I had asked the name because I would definitely want to order it again. 

I did come to this place on a Friday after work so it was pretty crowded and tough to find a seat, but that's what it's like with most places in the city so I can't complain much. A good place to sit and chat with a drink, you just need to be willing to wait a while to get a table.
author: Malika R.

description: Great drinks and friendly bartenders, need I say more? One of our friends rented the place out for a private party and we all had a good time munching on appetizers and trying out the drinks of the night. The basil gimlet with gin was a hit and had a strong kick to it! Drinks took a bit of time to come out, but I did appreciate the extra time and care that went into preparing each drink to make sure  they were all up to par. Would definitely come back again!
author: Kim D.

description:
Update: It's getting a fourth star, because I tried them again, many more times (I moved to an office building right here) when they were less busy, and the bartenders are great.  Just avoid them during the height of happy hour.  

Drinks aren't that expensive -- $10 for a well made cocktail.  I was really happy with them the last few times I've been here.
author: Zachary R.

description: There are many places in city but this is now one of my favorite places in SF for cocktails. Their signature drink basil gin certainly good but you should ask the bar tender to make throw something with bourbon if you like. Tried Manhattan with a twist and also smokey and spiced which too good.
author: Hemal K.

description:
I was sold when I had a sip of their basil gimlet. They also introduced me to a beer called Celis White which was sooo good, haven't seen too many bars carrying this beer. Can't remember the HH deals but drinks were relatively cheap.

Good bartenders, great drinks, and a perfect spot to come for happy hour after a long work day. This place gets really packed so don't expect to be able to find a seat.
author: Angela K.

description:
I love this place! They don't really have a displayed cocktail menu, although I think they had an "unofficial" one that all the bartenders know.

The three times I've been there, the bartenders have all been very knowledgable about drinks and very helpful with recommendations! They have a cocktail called "Black Heart" or something, which is a beer cocktail with crushed strawberries. Delicious! Seriously one of my favorite drinks ever.

Not sure how good this place would be if its busy though, because the bartenders probably have less attention to give you. However I definitely recommend this place. Just tell the bartender what kind of drinks you like, and they'll make something you're guaranteed to like!
author: Wynn C.

description: Nice ambiance but bartender was just rude last night and pouring weak drinks for $9 a drink. Worse bartender ever.
author: Lauren P.

description:
This isnt my favorite FiDi watering hole.  But its A-OK.   Its really close to my place of business so i'll give it that.  One of the groups here frequent the heck outta this place.   Not me though.  

OK so this place gets packed and LOUD quick.  They usually have two bartenders but sometimes its really hard to get their attention.  Thats kind of frustrating.  If i come here its because i REALLY need a darn drink and you know, i hates to wait.  Grr. 
The other thing is that they don't carry Stoli (SIGH!) they have Ketel One (and Hangar One).  Which of course is ok I guess but its no substitute for Stoli. 

As per the current trend this place packs whiskeys, bourbons and ryes. Oh. yeah and tequilas.  I hear they have good beers on tap.
author: .Vanessa G.

description: AWESOME place to go if you're a scotch/whiskey aficionado! The bartenders here know their stuff, and can give you recommendations based on what you like. They also have some limited edition bottles here, so you can sample something new. There is also plenty of seating around the bar as well as tables along the wall for small groups to sit at. This is a great place to sit down and catch up with friends, since you can actually hear the other person talking. I will definitely be back in the future for more whiskey/scotch! Another perk is that there was plenty of street parking available when I came on a Thursday night.
author: Amy D.

description:
First time at this bar and met up with a friend after work during the MLB Playoffs.

The venue is small, but the drinks were on point. The mixologist made every drink a tasty delight.

Too bad the Giants lost the game, but it was a win for 83 proof.

I've visited several times since. :-)
author: Marc M.

description:
Went straight from SFO with my bestie for some much needed drinks!

First two rounds were the basil gimlets, which btw were DIVINE!!! Third and fourth round were the Hef's. 

Come early if you can to get a seat, because it can get pretty crowded!!
author: Veronica R.

description: Had a glass of red wine and my friend a glass of white. After we both sipped our wines... we realized we had made a bad choice in our drinks.
author: LuisD M.

description: Good for small group happy hour. Typical loud and crowded. Drinks were good, but know what you want as there's no menu and it's hard to hear bartender recommendations.
author: Jaime F.

description:
Since I am anal and do not take negative/positive feedback lightly---I like to check myself so I don't wreck myself (yes, cheesy) hahaha...,excessively.., (swear no OCD)...anyway, haven't seen the douche from my original post; however, have visited at various times with a various number of people. Everyone, aside from the douche (who no one can honestly identify), are attentive, friendly and warm. Have absolutely nothing but respect for
Ownership/management. It is a very well run bar with attentive and respectful owners/bartenders. I enjoy myself immensely here.
author: Ayesha A.

description:
First impression: a good vibe. Simple, unassuming atmosphere. Very warm and welcoming bartenders. People laughing and enjoying themselves. 

Our bartender steered each of us to a custom cocktail with our preferred spirit (Gin? Bourbon? Rum?) with flavor profile (Citrusy? Dark, rich?) and a kindly gut check (Spice OK? Egg white?). We loved this attention and got excited to try something new. 

I noticed our bartender laboring over the proportion of bitters in one drink, carefully second-guessing and testing the mix. I appreciated the care he put into it. 

The drinks? Fantastic. Each attractive and colorful, super well-balanced, bright, and really flavorful. Can't wait to return for another.
author: Jeremy B.

description:
Met up with a friend here on a Sat night and it was really quiet. I just had a beer on tap which was pretty good (forgot the name of it) but was recommended by the friendly Bartender.  Great causal/hip spot if you looking to grab a drink before dinner or going somewhere else after.

I can see this place being the spot on happy hr during the weekdays
author: DVS A.

description: Even though my choice of drinks is boring vodka/soda, once in a while I can appreciate some creativity on bartender's part, especially when the sugar is limited. Honestly, I cannot remember the creation's name but the taste was awesome. Good vibe, busy place, nice crowd - what else do you need from a quick grab a drink place. Will def come back!
author: Viola B.

description:
In the mood for a creative cocktails? 83 Proof is your place! Upon walking in, I saw the bartender making a delicious fresh fruit cocktail concoction. When I asked him what it was, he said he had just created it on the fly. This is my kind of drink! I decided to put my cocktail faith in him and asked him to make me one  of his creations. The drink was delicious! It was fresh squeezed fruit with a hint of carbonation and went down very nicely. 

The bar has little frills. It's a narrow bar on the first floor and then the second floor has an intimate sitting area that's good for a small group or about 10-15 people. Everything about this bar is calm, cool and collected and if I lived in SF, it would definitely be on my rotation.
author: Lindsey D.

description:
Hump day happy hour yesterday brought us to this bar. I wish I had read the reviews beforehand because I missed the basil gilmet! Sad face. Oh well, next time.

Hard to beat $4 well drinks, friendly bartenders, and casual non-sketchy crowd. The one downside was that it got so noisy it was really hard to hear each other. 

$10 card minimum so bring cash or know your debit card usage rights and be prepared to argue about it.
author: Rachel E.

description:
If you ever want to feel like you know nothing about alcohol, come here.

Walk in and you see pretty much every single hard liquor that was ever invented on the face of this EARTH. I wanted to just go to the bartender and pay him to just name everything for me. Seriously. Ridiculous. So much liquor.

I ordered a basil gimlet. Heard they were good here, and everyone is right! Very smooth and the flavor was awesome. One of the best I've had.

All that would warrant 4 stars, but the 5th star comes from the atmosphere. One of the guys working there started jamming on the piano, and he was really good! It really made for a great mood that was very cozy and upscale at the same time. I would love to come here again!
author: Jade R.

description:
One of my favorite bars to go to for happy hour after work. Although this place defintely gets  packed, they make delicious (perfect balance between alcohol and flavor) cocktails for a decent price. (7 to 8 bucks per cocktail)

The bartenders are all friendly, attentive, and fast (as they can get depending on the crowd).  They're also pretty good with being consistent on their drinks. (meaning- not one of those bars where one bartender is good and the other one sucks) 


My favorites here would be the mint mojito, gimlet, and cucumber gimlet.
author: Ada C.

description:
900th review goes to one of my favorite bars in the city.

I've been here twice on the last couple weeks (hilariously on the same night), and I would have visited a third time had it not been closed for a private event. 

There are only two bartenders, and the one I got both times was friendly and mixed up two really good drinks after giving him some preferences. I can't recall the names, but the second was a whiskey with some lemon juice, bitters, and an orange peel.

The place wasn't packed either time, so I was able to find seating at the bar both times.
author: David L.

description:
I've only been here once, but I sort of love it.

If I were into bourbon, scotch, or whiskey, I would be in paradise. But sipping my gin & tonic during the happiest of all happy hours, life was still damn good. We got there at around 3:30, but the place was packed by 6.

The ambiance is great (complete with a piano!). If I worked in the city, this would totally be my bar.
author: Caroline W.

description:
The concept is simple: tell the bartender what you like in a drink and they'll customize a drink just for you. It's a little difficult to find if you don't know where to look since the sign isn't the most obvious. In fact, the only reason why I found it was because there just happened to be people smoking outside. 

The inside is dark (this is good if you want to look prettier than you really are and it will help disguise your true drunken state) and the crowd is loud and lively. A great spot to kick off the weekend, to meet up with your friends, to troll for women, or all of the above.
author: Diana Y.

description: The anonymity of this little whiskey bar was excellent. They had a huge selection of different spirits, and the bartender, Zach, was very informative and educational and we got to try lots of things we'd not heard of before. Definitely come back!! Go early Sat evening - no crowds or rush, and lots of personal attention
author: Ralph P.

description:
Came here 2 Fridays ago for Happy Hour while catching up with a friend.  

The place is nestled right off Market Street and while the place isn't too big, the place was busy and filled with people getting ready to start the weekend.  

The establishment offers well-prepared drinks and I saw a lot of various 'whiskeys' that they offered.  I didn't venture that night into anything beyond beers, so, I'll have to be back soon.
author: Edward L.

description:
This is definitely a great bar with nice bartenders, good cocktails, nice vibe and decor. Major after work crowd. Gets a bit packed, but generally has seating on the 2nd floor.

The only hiccup is that it's really loud so if you're looking for a place to have a convo, this isn't the place.
author: Nadine H.

description:
My friend's grad program rented out this bar for an event and it was a really nice chill place for all of us to hang out.

Props to the bartenders who, despite probably getting close to zero tips all night, really took their time still making every single wonderful drink and really talking to you to figure out what kind of cocktail you wanted if you weren't sure. My ginger/ whiskey cocktail was excellent, and they make a GREAT basil gimlet!
author: Ziyan C.

description:
I requested "something spicy, not sweet" from two different bartenders and got two kickass drinks.  The second won me immediately when he asked if egg whites were OK.  *swoon* He then handed me hands down one of the most perfectly spiced, savory drinks I've ever had. 

Crowd is mostly SOMA douches, but after happy hour it clears out. Perfect for a small group of friends to catch up.
author: Dagmar H.

description:
Went here on a Friday night after dinner for some drinks. The place was busy but we were able to find seating almost right away. I was very impressed with the bottle selection, the bar was extensive.

Even though they seemed to have everything I couldn't make a decision to save my life. I gave a brief description of the types of drinks I like to the bartender, who was very patient with me, and she whipped up two of the best martinis!
 
One of the people in our group was very happy to discover they had a whiskey he can never find anywhere but really enjoys. I definitely thought the price was spot on for the drinks. 

 The ambiance was laid back and I would feel comfortable coming here under a variety of pretenses. I would definitely suggest a stop in here if you are in the area or just want to go somewhere that might carry your specialty drink!
author: Tuesday C.

description:
Simple, classy, and all too delicious.
The bartenders are knowledgable and will impress you if you let them.

Need I say more?

This place is a winner.
author: Alissa A.

description:
This is a rating for Happy Hour.  Came here with a few friends from work at around 5:00pm on a Friday.  The place was fairly packed, and super hot!  SF definitely doesn't have any AC, so you can't blame 83 Proof, but boy, was it boiling in there.

Ordered a few beers, which were tasty.  Didn't take long to be served by the bartender.  Overall, we all had a lot of fun at 83 Proof, but the temperature made it tough to chill on a beverage in there!  I'll definitely come back on a cooler day.
author: Andrew H.

description:
I have been to so many bars in my drinking days and have decided there are 3 things that make a great bar: 1. Chill lax atmosphere 2. Great beer, wine and liquor selection and 3. Amazing bartenders! I can say that I've never met better bar tenders that know their craft! Ordered a manhattan, best in America, ordered an old fashion, insanely perfect, then asked the bar tendered to pick a perfect local beer mixed of lager/wheat and he picked 2 that could not have fit the bill any better. 
We literally stumbled upon the bar off the streets, took us a good 30 minutes to figure out the name since it looks like an address by the door, and couldn't have made a better decision!
author: Autumn R.

description: Went there  on a Tuesday  night for drinks. There were only 15 or 20 people and the bar was not crowded and the drinks were awesome. We had a great time and would love to come back. It's a great place for getting drinks in a fun environment and the bartender sounded pretty cool as well
author: A S.

description:
I've been here twice.

First time, I came here once for happy hour. WAY too crowded for my liking. Also, there is no food. 

Second time, I came here on a Friday night. It was very chill. The bartender was nice, but not too energetic. The raspberry gimlet is delicious!
author: Margaret R.

description:
83 Proof offers an impressive selection of bourbons. The bartenders here really know their stuff. They served me a new favorite of Rock Hill Farms, based on an old favorite of Basil Hayden's. 

Renting out the bar is a good deal if you can bring in the people. A friend held a birthday party here on a Saturday night from 8-11pm for just a bar tab guarantee, without a charge up front. 

In this excellent, friendly group of people, almost none of whom I knew, folks came and went but the crowd stayed strong until just before close. 

It's also a great happy hour place: cozy but not crowded, and lively due to its noisy acoustics. Superior bartending is the secret.
author: Mike H.

description: A great spot for tech happy hour!
author: Antonio G.

description: Bartender will craft an original cocktail based on your tastes and likes!! Really solid place!!
author: Nasty N.

description:
Financial District hot spot! 

I really like this place, mainly because of the awesome bartenders and their amazing alcoholic creations! They ask what you like and feel like having and bring you back exactly that. And if you don't know what you're in the mood for, they do make great recommendations. I caught their names.. but forgot them.. too many delicious drinks perhaps. I promise I'll get them the next time!
author: Daisy D.

description:
whoooooowhee. I love me some whiskey, but I also love me some good whiskey edumacation. 

You see those whiskey tours and tastings that cost upwards of 100+ bucks? Or the fancy speakeasies that say they care deeply about the alcohol they're serving? Phooey. They're a little bougie and a little pretentious dont you think?

 Look no further than this place. Before you buy your whiskey, the bartenders take it upon themselves to edumacate you on the history, the different kinds, the evolution of whiskey and where it is now. What's nice is that they genuinely care about what they're serving and are very willing to have a conversation with you about what to look for in a good whiskey/bourbon/scotch. 

I tried some old american whiskeys, some japanese whiskeys, new age whiskeys, and some irish ones as well. Bring a notepad if you would like to remember some of the lessons because as the end of the tasting, I don't know how much you might be able to keep with you.
author: Jenny C.

description:
I've been to several large, private parties here. I can not give 83 Proof enough praise. The bar itself is beautiful, not themed or overly ornate. Just a well put together, neutral space. There's a relaxed area upstairs that overlooks the entire bar and several high top tables and chairs donwstairs. 

The only complaint I've ever had is that they sometimes underestimate the staff needed for large groups.
author: Amy L.

description: Super lively, loud and full. BUT, we had a really good experience getting drinks. I was being indecisive and the bartender made me something called a Bleeding Heart? Or Black Heart? Poisoned Heart? Or some kind of heart? It was dark, had stout and a few other delicious things in it and I'm pretty sure there was some strawberry involved. Whatever it was, it was delicious. Especially if you can snag a seat (I'll fight you for it), this is a great after-work spot.
author: Kristina K.

description:
Nice spot convenient to financial district.  Bit tight, at 4:30 there were no seats available and by 6 it was shoulder to shoulder. But the bartenders were good, quick, very pleasant.  

I ordered a rye on the rocks and watched the bartender measure out exactly one shot.  On my second round - after the bar was much more crowded - he free handed the pour which is what I would expect from a good cocktail bar.
author: Jay E.

description:
Really enjoyed this place. Live piano player in the corner reminded me of an old-timey saloon.  Nice bartenders, and a nice crowd - seemed like a lot of regulars/locals.  Good beer on tap and bottle (Think Boont Amber, Port Brewing IPA and other local/west coast brews). Good prices.

Was there around 9 on Tuesday and had no trouble getting a couple spots at the bar.  One small-ish TV in the corner showing the Giants game (though not many were paying any attention).

I'll definitely be going back.
author: Nathan G.

description:
This is one of the more classier bars I've been to in the city. It has an upstairs area that overlooks the bottom. I heard that you can rent out the whole bar as long your party spends a certain minimum amount or else you would need to cover the difference.

We drove here from my work, so there's a lot of parking on Mission that's really close to here. However, please don't drink and drive if you come here. 

Inside is dim but not super dark. It's a good place to catch up and talk with people. The bar section had a decent amount of alcohol. I only had Bulleit and Coke for $8 but it was good and I could taste the bourbon in it.
author: Paul U.

description:
What a great bar! Somewhat of a challenge finding it since their sign isn't very big, so unfortunately my group and I passed it while looking for it, but noticed quickly and came back. As we walked in (all of our first time there) we really liked the ambiance, the bar was busy but there was plenty of room to stand, sit, and the bar was easily accessible. Just what we were looking for!

The bartender was extremely friendly, made us some tasty beverages, and even talked to us for a little bit since we mentioned we were all relatively new to the area. They also have a wheelchair accessible bar counter at the end of the bar, which was really awesome considering our friend was in one. They have a full bar, great beer on tap, and I would highly recommend trying out their blackberry whiskey sour. Unique and delicious! We had a great time, bartenders were awesome, prices are appropriate, and we'll be back again! Thanks 83!
author: Akvile D.

description:
So there I was on a Bart train, on my way to meet a friend for drinks...  83 Proof was just a 3 minute walk from Embarcadero station, super convenient.  The few tables were taken, so we sat at the bar.  The space was charming and intimate.  I liked that the music was loud enough to hear, but not too loud to talk over.  Good lighting, good crowd, a nice comfortable feel.

The gimlet was tasty, and there was a great collection of scotch and whiskey.  Our bartender was friendly and knowledgeable.  This guy was a pro...a bit later into the night, he approached with a big pink box, silently opened the lid...Kara's Cupcakes!  Yeah, I was excited.  

Nice chill spot for evening drinks.  Doesn't seem like there's much else in the neighborhood going on in the evening, so it's a little isolated.  But if you're in the area, this is a great choice.
author: Heidi S.

description:
I've been here a few times and it's always an evening well spent --  confirmed last time I was here by the fact that the piano player did a rendition Karma Police.  Bold.  Very Bold.  I've never hit it on the weekend, but on weeknights it's a solid place to grab a casual drink -- they have an obscene collection of fancy spirits, and although the bartenders are not remarkably helpful, they are friendly and perhaps I've never asked the proper questions?

You're able to hear the person across the table from you fairly well -- and it's dark enough that if they're a little busted, you'll never know the difference -- in other words, not a bad place for a first-ish date.
author: Rachel N.

description:
We stumbled in here in the midst of a long, dark night: full of chatter and vinegar and more than a little libation, 83 Proof has long been a known commodity amongst my pals that count themselves part of the Bay Area set: easy, accommodating, with a quick pour regularly on the make, or a cold one at the ready if you're nearby and thirsty.

They weren't busy when we popped in, and that was just as well: my gang was leaning into the dying of this particular night and ready for a room full of conversation -- in the end, our drinks were readily found, the pours steady, the tab reasonable. What 83 Proof may lack by way of frills (if that's even what you're after), they more than make up for in familiarity. Bottoms up.
author: Kevin N.

description: Great place for HH drinks and specials. I've been here a few times and the drinks are on point and the bartenders have great cocktail knowledge. I'll defiantly be coming back
author: J S.

description: Had some excellent draft beers and a fancy basil gimlet here recently. The bartenders were all really friendly which is a welcome change! Not too crowded at 5pm on a Thursday, but I think it usually gets busy after 6pm. Good after work spot.  Ask for a custom cocktail!
author: Natasha F.

description:
Another Kristina A. win indeed!

Solid bar. Very easy to miss. Especially if you're already not sober - which is what happened to me the first time i tried to find this place. 

The selection here is great.

The service is top notch. 

And when the space is not impacted by a huge party - this is the place to be.
author: Oleg H.

description: This has got to be the best cocktail bar ever. I visited it with my friends last weekend and had a lovely night there. Matthew there makes some AMAZING drinks. I got him to mix me a few rum drinks and he whipped up some magic every time! He seems to read minds and my wife also lucked into some wizard cocktails... Hands down the best bartender I've ever come across, and I've been to my fair share of pubs the world over ...
author: Sankar N.

description: Awesome bar! Great bartenders who make wonderful drinks, both classics and a little of their own stuff.  Very knowledgeable, and will offer up ideas and suggestions if you don't know what you want or if you want to try something outside your comfort zone.  Love this place.  So maybe don't come here, so I can actually sit down and enjoy it.
author: T. G.

description:
We had an insane amount of fairly pricey wine.  My date for the night was lovely and had the staff turning cartwheels for him.  They happily did everything he asked and more.  They kept the wine flowing and brought us a complimentary dessert.

We shared 3 or 4 things.  It seemed to me that the portions were small.  I tend to eat a little at a time (although often) and we finished every dish.

We had a pasta dish, duck, and 2 salads I believe.  Loved them all.

The place was hoping and the crowd was fairly thick but you could still have a great conversation over the music and the people.  

I liked this place a lot.
author: Stacey C.

description: Really crowded after work BUT friendly bartenders and a good selection of draft beers.
author: Nisha R.

description:
I've heard a lot about 83 proof but when I tried to go once or twice, it was always too crowded. Last night for NYE, around 11, it was surprisingly sparse so my friends and I popped in for one last drink before midnight.

The good: The drinks are pretty darn well made. My basil gimlet was the perfect blend of basil flavor and gin- and even though I usually am not a gin drinker, it was dangerously easy to gulp it down. It was also relatively brightly lit with comfortable places to sit and stand- a very welcoming, come in and drink for awhile kind of vibe.

The bad: The crowd was definitely more 30's and up, not looking to party and just to chill. Also, I can see how the focus is on the drinks and not on the decor; no hipstery pretentious ambiance here, but maybe that's a good thing.

Overall: Seems like the drinks here are pretty top notch, and it's a good casual bard to grab happy hour at.
author: Jackie T.

description:
They are known for their basil gimlet, so definitely get that when you come here!

The bar is typical, nothing too out of the ordinary. I just think the space isn't designed very well at 83 Proof, especially for the amount of people they try to accommodate..it's hot/stuffy.

Nice place to come w some friends, but don't expect too much....just come for a good conversation over their basil gimlet and you'll be set!
author: Veronica S.

description:
I'd highly recommend this place for SOMA nightcaps, even if you have to go several blocks out of your way to get here.

I stopped by after dinner near the Embarcadero.  The bartenders were mixing up all sorts of concoctions for the patrons at the bar.  My partner and I grabbed a nearby table, which unfortunately put us at a disadvantage when I went over to the bar and had to communicate what we wanted over the other patrons.

Fortunately, a quick scan of Yelp reviews (required, given that there is no drink menu) turned up the basil gimlet, which was absolutely delicious.  I followed up by asking for the bartender to prep a bourbon-based drink.  He originally suggested that he was going to make a Manhattan, but brought back an Old Fashion that knocked my socks off.

The drinks are expensive -- we paid $9.00 for each cocktail, but the liquor and garnishes are top-notch.  Even the cherries in the Old Fashion were candied and delicious.
author: Bill H.

description: Great bar in SOMA, with lots of whiskey and well made cocktails. I've gone here for happy hour after work, and the place can be a bit crowded so it might take a minute or two to get a bartender's attention, but cool spot nonetheless.
author: Vitaliy D.

description:
After some light (for us, anyway) Friday drinking at the office, I wandered off with Akvile H and her husband in search of a bar close to BART, and on the way to my next set of drinking buddies. Our search led us to 83 Proof, a dive bar of the classier and nicer variety (while not an upscale lounge by any means, the only thing that really drove the dive bar element home was the smell of urinal cake that pervaded the bar).

A little less busy than I would have expected on a Friday night (though perhaps normal around 10pm), we were able to easily make our way up to the bartender, order our drinks, and even chat with him a bit. While the other two stuck with beer, I was undecided on what to order, and was given the suggestion of a (muddled) blackberry whiskey sour, which turned out to be a unique and tasty drink. As another plus, while they'd run out that day, they do carry Templeton rye, easily one of my favorite ryes to date (and rather hard to find).
author: Johnny W.

description: 83 Proof which is located at 83, 1st St. How clever! This is a cool little bar which I would recommend. The drinks were fairly priced. They have an upstairs area where there are some couches. I wish they had food to line the tummy before getting some liquor in it but the only thing they had was trail mix. They also need to reduce the volume of the music a little bit so the patrons can have a conversation.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Our office's personal "watering" hole.  A tremendous and possibly the best selection of bourbon and scotch in the city.  The staff is well educated and very accommodating....

Best time is from 4-7 pm and then after 9 pm...Wed and Thursday nights are my favorite here.
author: Shekhar P.

description: I wouldn't have expected a bar to be located where this one is. I drove past the location so many times without ever noticing it. That said, the drinks are well made at a reasonable price. Also, it wasn't overly crowded on the Friday night that my friends I went, so it was easy to grab a table or a place at the bar.
author: Rodney G.

description: Nothing special.  Barkeeps were friendly.  Drinks were ok -- no specials.  Gotta figure out a different place to go next time.  Nothing seems to last very long in the finance district.
author: Rod '.

description: Nick simply sucks. I broke my glass by dropping it. He told me to leave! What the he'll Only drunk people drop their glasses ?! Isn't a human allowed to do that ? There is reason it's called an accident !!! What a prick! I used to love that place. Loved the pianist and used to hang out with my friends! We are so not going back
author: Gina C.

description:
One of my favorite bars in SoMa. Decor, ambiance, and of course, the drinks are perfect. Located at, aptly, 83 First, it's a nice place to have a couple drinks on a Friday night. The bartenders are mixologist and will welcome any "surprise me" requests. First time I went, I simply picked a liquor and asked the bartender to surprise me. What resulted was a drink so unique I doubt I will ever have a chance to try again.

Place is kinda small so it's not a place for large groups. Good for dates. Haven't tried the food.
author: Hac P.

description:
Came here for a birthday party pre-dinner meetup and by 7pm, the place was pretty packed.  There was no bouncer as mentioned in previous reviews which was nice because I did have to run in and out of the place to take calls.  Also, a draft beer was only $5.  Not bad at all.  I wish they had a sign or something because I parked around the street looking for signage and I did a full circle until I realized that it was sitting right next to me.  

I stayed mostly in the front area near the door as the inside tables and upstairs area were already occupied.  The volume in the room can get really loud but it makes for excellent atmosphere.  There were a few TVs scattered around but not to the point of sports bar overkill.  Parking is street and usually pretty decent to find after 6pm and the meters become free.
author: Ben H L.

description: 83 proof is a cool little bar that you can easily miss if you aren't looking for it.  Their basil gimlet is super tasty and the whole bar has this dim, relaxed, 1950s feel to it.  It does get busy after 10pm so if you want to get a drink and relax, go at 6 or 7pm.
author: Yue L.

description:
Solid. Brilliant drinks. Experienced mixologists.

A friend in SF loves this place, so we'd come here from time to time. I learned about Rye Whiskey here, and learned I have a lot to learn.

We also came here for a few birthday (or otherwise) parties / friends' get-togethers - in both the upstairs area, and the downstairs bar. 

Friendly atmosphere. Chill ambiance. Warm decor. Friendly staff. 

A true gem in an unexpected block of town.
author: Sally M.

description:
Great interior and awesome bar. I really like their melon ball! Several other solid drinks! Came here on multiple occasions - with co-workers and with friends. Relatively quiet and uncrowded (so you don't have to shout to have a conversation)
A hole in the wall (and pretty hard to find on the first try) but an awesome bar!

Part of me doesn't really want to share this place because I don't want it to get crowded- but solid drinks (check), friendly service (check), and great interior (check) one of my favorites I've got to share!!
author: Food E.

description:
All the drinks I tried here were very tasty.  You can just tell the bartenders what kind of drinks you like and what kind of liquor and they'll whip up something tasty for you.  A delicious drink AND I, the ultimate decision-phobe, don't even have to pick something from a menu?  Say it ain't so.  The standouts, for me, were the "whiskey snap", which the bartender concocted after I told her I wanted a whiskey drink, and the strawberry basil gimlet.

It's pretty chill on weekends because of the location, so it's a nice place to go if you just want some delicious drinks and good conversation with friends, without having to bust someone's ear drums.
author: jon y.

description:
I dig this place. They make good, fancy cocktails, and the bartenders are pretty attentive and like to talk to customers (rather than pretending not to see you standing there waving money in their face). The atmosphere was not so crowded for a Friday night, but it was also fairly early, around 7-9pm. I don't know how crowded it gets later on in the evenings. 

I had a Tokyo Tea, which was delicious, green, and just what I needed to cap off a not-so-great workweek. The bartender noticed that my other two barmates had ordered one, so he gave me an extra lemon and two bonus maraschinos (I presume it was so we could tell the drinks apart?). I love bonus fruit in my drink, I'll be honest.

The basil gimlet was served in an upright glass with a basil leaf on top. It was well mixed, not too ginny, and also not sweet. Just how I like it. 

I would come back here at a moment's notice. Yum.
author: Angeline P.

description:
I wanted to find a bar near work that is close by with good happy hour specials and found this place after reading one reviewer on Yelp mentioned that they make my favorite drink which is the gimlet. Since, this is our first time at this bar and not knowing how it would turn out, we were thinking one or two drinks then be on our way home. Boy were we wrong....let me tell you, this place does not disappoint. After ordering the gimlet, I asked the bartender to whip me up something special. I don't like the usual drinks on the menu, so my bartender made us a couple of his special drinks. It was very unique, different...like a party in my mouth..lol. In other words, they were all good. My friend and I had 4 drinks different drinks each before we decided to part with this bar... :-(

Definitely a bar that I would recommend and will come again and again.
author: Lynnda T.

description:
Came here strictly on a fluke after the Giants parade yesterday. After much fuss trying to find it (its has NO sign outside) we came into a very neat looking bar. They had the Giants ceremony on and piped t through some speakers so everyone could hear. It was pretty neat but I kinda wish they had another TV at the other end of the bar. If I didn't have my glasses I would have been screwed.

The bartenders were really cool, mostly because of the following. For the first time in my life, I brought my mom to a BAR. I was hilarious to watch her scowl...so I took apropriate action. 

I told the bartender "I need a cosmo. Make it fruity but strong."  LOL and boy did it work! She was singin along to Tony Bennett 10 mintues later. Thank you 83 Proof.
author: Kevin D.

description:
Great bar and good mix of people. 

This place is a great after work spot with affordable drinks and a great atmosphere. Everyone seems friendly and the staff is always accommodating. The one problem I see at this place is that it can get a bit too loud to the point where you can't hear the person right in front of you. Also, it can get way to crowded in there since the space between the wall and the bar is pretty narrow. I haven't been here at night so I'm not sure how the atmosphere gets but the happy hour menu is great and the prices are reasonable. The location is great and the crowd I want to say consist of only the work peeps. If you work in the area I recommend coming here because it may turn out to be your new go to. 

All in all, I recommend this place because everyone in the bar seems to enjoy it!
author: Javier G.

description:
This is a great little unpretentious bar. I get that their gimmick is to design you a drink based on the taste you describe wanting, and that's all lovely. What I think is really special about 83 Proof, is that the bartenders' helpfulness doesn't just extend to creative cocktails. They have a great selection of whiskeys, and last time I asked the bartender for "an inexpensive whiskey that is interesting". He delivered exactly that, and without wrinkling his nose or trying to upsell me. It's a good little spot, when it's not so crowded that it's 90 degrees in there.

I don't understand the ebb and flow of the crowd there. Sometimes it's packed and 30 minutes later it's empty. If you walk by and it looks like doin' too much, stop by again in a while.
author: Jacqueline W.

description:
Most places don't stock more Bourbon than my bar at home. So right off the bat, I liked this place.

We arrived around 9:00pm last Saturday night. The place only had two other customers. By the time we left after 11:00pm, it was busier, but they still had plenty of room including an empty upstairs seating lounge that overlooks the bar.

There isn't a cocktail, but the emphasis is for the mixologists to make custom tailored drinks. Typical of improvised drinks, some worked while others didn't. Regardless the price came to less that $10 a drink so it's not like you're paying a perfected cocktail price.

83 Proof is located on 83 First Street. That's easy to remember. It's also located in SoMa because it's "south of Market Street". It's also south of Fremont Street. So it's also in SoFre. And don't I wish this place was "so free".
author: Brian U.

description: There is an extensive selection of alcohol here and the bartenders are unbelievably knowledgeable and personable. The happy hour prices are great and the bartenders can make pretty much anything you can think of.
author: Rebecca J.

description:
Why I've never written a review for this spot until now, is beyond me. 

Rolled in tonight after dinner at Quince for some post foodie meal blissful cocktails. It's my birthday (St.Patty's) so I was trying to avoid the shit out of the Irish Bank type scene. 83 Proof was an EXCELLENT choice. No drunken morons, quite a few hot ladies decorating the spot, and the most fabulously beautiful and charming Megan (sp?) serving us drinks. Didn't get out of control - stuck to a martini, a nice Green Flash IPA and some delicious Tequila (yes, you CAN mix booze if you're a professional). 

83 Proof has a rather awesome liquor selection, and when you have a 6'1", statuesque, gorgeous woman, who's seemingly extremely nice serving you drinks, whilst the Ramones, Iggy & The Stooges, Adam & The Ants, etc. are playing on the stereo - life just isn't that bad.

During Happy Hour, 83 Proof can get a little wacky - and these's definitely a little bit of FiDi douchebag quotient - but with an excellent staff (the guys who work there are super cool too), and great booze, with no pretentiousness, it's a recipe for a good time. And even better for weekend shenanigans from what I can tell.

p.s. Megan - sorry if this post embarrasses you - but your warm smile and friendly demeanor really let the night end on a good note and I had to sing your praises. Your coworker whose name I didn't get, deserves some kudos as well - you ladies sling a mean drink with no 'tude. Thanks again!!
author: Marco M.

description: Intertesting crowd, great selection of whiskey. Small and cozy. Gets really busy after work. With a tech/ banker crowd (mostly tech).
author: Shadi N.

description:
For my 199th Review, I'd like to tell you about my love affair with 83 Proof. 

It started earlier this year, being so close to my work - we arranged a happy hour get together. The interior is very attractive, with shelves and shelves of liquor neatly arranged - you caught my eye. Since then I've been coming back for more, I bring people so they also know how good you are.

The after work crowd seems to love you too. I've been here when it's crowded and I've been there later when the 9 to 5'ers have had enough. Despite the crowd the bathrooms stay clean, we can tell you care.

The dim interior and candles on tables surrounding the room, set the mood for great cocktails and conversation.

Although they dont have a printed cocktail menu, the bartenders are mix masters with great taste. I asked them to make me something good and was given a basil vodka gimlet that was very pleasing. 

I've had others, but I keep going back for more to the one that treats me right and keeps me satisfied.
author: Rebekah T.

description: Super solid happy hour place - bustling, yes, but you can still chat. Much preferred to Rickhouse. Good deals!
author: Andrew K.

description:
Looooove. Best drinks ever. They know how to make real, original beverages.

I will never have a drink as good as my drinks here.
author: Kelle E.

description: I have been there for a few times. Nice Happy Hour deal, the crowd are mostly late 20s to mid 30s, Nice atmosphere and ambient during the afterwork hours. The bartenders are friendly and they have some interesting cocktails options. Would definitely go back.
author: Eunice S.

description: We decided in this bar last night after dinner by a recommendation from our server, and we are glad we did. It was a Tuesday night so we were looking for something open late and low key. 83 Proof was perfect. There was probably 20 people in the bar, but still plenty of seating. I ordered my a dirty Kettle One Martini for the fiancée, and asked the bartender what his whiskey options were. They had 250 types of whiskeys! I tried two different whiskeys which were both delicious, and will probably stop by again before we leave SF to try a few more!
author: Jason M.

description: Two words:  Basil Gimlet.  That's all I drink when I come here.  They are excellent and taste so good!
author: Chris L.

description: This place is amazing! Marc the bartender is very experienced, he can make any cocktail imaginable, and they have a nice selection of cocktails on their menu. My sister and I went at the beginning of the week so the atmosphere was very relaxed but obviously expected bigger towards the end of the week.
author: Kimeka S.

description:
Came out here on a Thursday afternoon with a friend just enjoying the sights and sounds of the city. I would have never thought to have found this place within the vicinity that we were in but the bar went unnoticed to my gal as she has been here before.

When you walk in you feel as if you fairly stepped back in time. It is indeed a nice joint with an upstairs area that I noticed as I took my seat at the bar. Good atmosphere and heres the best part,  good bartenders and even great drinks. 

So for myself, I'm undecided when it comes to choosing a drink and lo and behold I didn't know what I wanted. (After all, I was trying to be good. . .) Hmmmmm....maybe something light to start off with. The sweet gal behind the counter suggested something with grapefruit and so sure...Whipped up the concoction and I was set!! Took my first sip and I was sold. Not bad. I was done... I had to workout that evening anyway....

Yeah right... My friends pressured me into getting another drink or two and here I go again being undecided so at this point I was willing to try anything and let me tell you the different drinks I had that afternoon were quite pleasing to my palate (I don't know about yours, but that is for you to decide...) with just the right amount of sweet, sours and that kick of alcohol that everyone is looking for.

Overall, a fabulous bar with good people, a great atmosphere and most of all innovative drinks. I'd come back again if I were in town!!
author: Michelle M.

description: They have good French75 here. There is also extra upstairs space which is nice. The service is quick (although the night I came there was a wedding rehearsal or something). Overall they make good drink at nice location, not too lousy like other bars nearby financial district.
author: Phuong P.

description:
I always enjoy a nice old fashioned and 83 Proof is the place to get the best in the city. I've been heading to 83 Proof for a few years now and I used to go every Friday after work. It's never overly crowded and the bartenders are fantastic. They make excellent and strong cocktails and are always friendly. 

All the drinks are reasonably priced and the whiskey selection is out of this world. In addition to their fantastic old fashioned cocktail, I always have an Old Speckled Hen beer with an Old Potrero. 

Overall a great place to grab a stiff, hand crafted cocktail at a reasonable price.
author: Matt J.

description: This is definitely one of my favorite bars that I've visited in San Francisco. I went by Thursday night around 8, and it was easy to get a seat at the bar, though it did get a bit more crowded by 9. The bartenders were what made they experience; they were friendly, responsive, and full of recommendations. I had a basil gimlet and something similar made with lemon, honey, and gin. Both were phenomenal. They actually don't have a cocktail menu but make you something based on your preferences. I will definitely return, thanks for such a fun time!
author: Sydney L.

description: Love this place!! Best basil gimlet ever!
author: M E.

description:
I started off my morning pricing boob jobs. I mean, if I ever come back to 83 Proof a nice rack and a vagina are the only things that are gonna help me get a damn beer in under 10 minutes. What? I could skip the procedures and just not come back? Well I guess that could work too.. *cancels newly booked surgeries*

Seriously you broseph bartenders, I know you saw me. You walked over twice to shuffle around some dirty glasses, then went right back to the same two giggly chicks. They had drinks already. Which they were drinking. You can get me a beer and THEN go back to flexing your biceps oh so obviously while crossing your arms across your chest. Or maybe some slicked back hair, a striped button up shirt, and some BMW car keys conveniently placed on the bar for all to see might work?

Damn shame too, I really liked the whole setup. Dimly lit, very nice lounge feel upstairs looking down on the bar. Decent beer selection too once I got one. Finally, thank the lord and his unicorns a third bartender or possibly manager showed up and I gave him the "what the fuck dude" look and he jumped into action and was quite polite. Too bad I'd been standing there forever already.

I could possibly be back some day if people make me come here, I'm just going to ask a female sidekick to snag the drinks. Sorry, I just get sick of getting blown off by dude bartenders simply because I have a penis.
author: Justin N.

description:
I love this place! The drinks are reasonable, the bartenders are awesome and it's close to everyone's office in the FiDi. 

Just get there early because it tends to get PACKED just as work lets out.
author: Shachi B.

description:
Two words, Basil gimlet. Changed my life. 

I'm pretty sure they mash a little heaven up into that drink because it was one of the most amazing taste experiences of my life. 

Thinking it was a fluke, I ordered another. The second was just as delicious though!

The only reason I can't give it five stars is because it is super crowded, but that's understandable given the deliciousness that awaits.
author: Jessica M.

description: Had the best Sunday here! Zach made us the best drinks n taught me so much about all different alcohols! Looking forward to coming back again soon!!!
author: Jenessa L.

description:
The only reason why I came here and heard of this place for the first time is thanks to Ligaya T.!  All of us drove from the Berkeley Marina with out prom dresses on to go to the DYL after-party at 83 Proof.  We luckily found parking nearby the bar pretty quickly which is rare in the city!  

What I remember from my short stay there:
Dimmed lighting.. a long and narrow bar that goes deep down the venue...A small upstairs area that is more fit for private parties or table service.. I am not sure if they do table service but it is fit for it.. All the yelpers were in that area which made it easy to mingle!  It overlooked the rest of the bar.  I got to bond with Ligaya T., which made my night!, and Ruggy also!  It was a nice intimate time with all the east bay and sf yelpers.  A different change which I can get used to!  I wish i lived up there now!  

Good for a chill night with few friends but don't expect much out of this place if you are looking for a bougie night out in the city!
author: Kathy D.

description: Great little spot good for a happy hour after work or a fairly laid back night out downtown/soma. Cool atmosphere makes it feel kinda local but at the same time trendy. I have driven past this hundreds of times but never noticed it...will definitely be back
author: Derek S.

description:
I like this little bar. I think it is fairly new, and the location is great. Chill vibe, and decent prices.

Stopped in on a Friday night, and it was a little busy, but not overly so. Drinks were good, bartenders were attentive. Simple, uncluttered service and space.
author: Wes T.

description:
Fun happy hour spot! 

Friendly bartenders that will keep you liquored up and a good noise level to be social but not having-to-yell kind of loud. 

A lot of the people sitting at the bar had their eyes glued to the television in the corner that was showing football highlights from the weekend. 

Went around 6pm and didn't have any trouble finding seats as a lot of people were shuffling in and out. It would be hard to seat a whole group though, so it's better for people who wouldn't mind standing if necessary.

Nice spot, i would check it out again!
author: Suejung S.

description: Brought some guys from work here. I'd been raving about the handmade drinks...very dissapointed to say my blueberry lemondrop was sans real blueberries. The guy used flavored vodka. :/
author: Jen B.

description:
Nice happy hour vibe going on here.  

I really like this place.  Semi-chill-professional crowd, friendly bartenders, good service.  Boy does it get packed; it seems like people were spilling out that front window.  Well despite the fact that it was jam packed and loud, drinks were a-flowin'!  Me likes.  

It was a little weird though...after happy hour slowed down, so did the bartenders.  We waited and waited and waited and finally bounced.

Nice after-work spot where I can actually find parking ;)  Will definitely return.
author: Angella S.

description: Small and casual but hip and cool without looking like a sleazy dirty dive bar. The crowd is always fun, usually professionals in late 20s to 30s. The happy hour deal is unbeatable. I always get to meet cool people here and it's plenty safe for a gal like me. Bartenders are quick, friendly and know how to make the drinks right (not cheap on putting in extra liquor). Love the somewhat rustic ambience!
author: Del S.

description: The best happy hour! Can get crowded so come early on the weekdays. That Moscow mule though...
author: Stephanie A.

description: Just minutes away from work, so that was a plus. The place was very small but great ambiance. Arrived around 5:30 and it was already getting crowded. Sat at the bar and ordered a few cocktails.  I didn't know what I wanted , but knew Whiskey was the way to go. Therefore, I asked the bartender and he simply asked a few questions and made me a drink. Okay, I forgot the name but it was some kind of Whiskey cocktail mix between old fashion and Manhanttan. Then I wanted to try something else, the second drink was not too bad. Had a smokey taste to it, not sure if it was my favorite.
author: Nhung T.

description:
***Good***
Bartenders are cool. Location is discrete and the bar is fun. Would suggestion going here any other time but happy hour.

***Bad***
Happy hour is packed. Bar isn't huge.

***Recommendation***
Bartender's choice
author: Nick K.

description:
83 Proof gets Crowded (I actually wanted it in all caps but that seems a bit too melodramatic). You have to walk through the narrow hallway to make it upstairs. Make it through the crowd and head up those stairs, it is worth it. There's more lounging space and it is slightly more quiet. Try the basil gimlet. Drinks aren't necessarily strong, but they certainly are tasty. Bartenders, like reported, are friendly.

If you're in the area and don't mind getting your elbows bumped, check out 83Proof.
author: Rosa L.

description: I can always appreciate a bar that has bartenders who know the diffrences in their alcohol... Proof 83 is one of them. It has the theme of speak easy drinks. Just tell them the base and enjoy your company... You don't have to worry if you'll like your drink b/c you will!!!
author: Sam H.

description:
Almost a speakeasy type of place. In the sense that in the day, you wouldn't know it was there. How can I say this with confidence? Because I work around the corner and didn't know it was there.

Upon entering it looks pretty small, but it goes pretty far back and there is an upstairs seating area. Thursday nights are really crowded, but if you can snag a table, its a good chance for good drinks and people watching.
author: Analisa S.

description:
I'm going to leave this review to be updated because I had a good time here but I could't thoroughly enjoy my whisky here.

 First off: I asked the bartender for recommendations on whisky and he asked what I like. Being new to whisky I didn't really know how to respond without sounding like a complete idiot. I really could have figured it out if I had some sort of menu but apparently at a whisky bar they don't have a whisky menu because they change so much. hmm. O well. 

He ended up giving me a whisky that I was not so keen over but also had me try a rye that was great. I definitely want to like this place so I'll give it another try. Kudos for the bartender for trying to help.
author: Ezequiel R.

description:
We trolled in on a birthday night and I had no idea this place existed.

A pretty good little bar I'd say.  Good selection of spirits and beers on tap.

I like the long bar extending from one end to the other with plenty of stools for everyone to hang.  The spirits shelf is pretty solid.

Good bartenders as well, who were prompt to place your order and with a smile.

I'll have to swing by again sometime soon.  Recommended.
author: Patrick K.

description: Super easy going bar that's great for groups. They have an upper floor as well for more lounging.
author: Penny C.

description:
Five Stars.  Why five stars?  Have you seen that wall of alcohol?

Clean, upscale-kind of place, while still being a relaxed bar without the pretentious feel amongst the crowd.  Granted, we made up a good majority of the crowd on this Saturday night, but regardless, the place has got a good feel to it.  The balcony above is a nice cozy sort of spot, but I especially like the decor of the whole place...very modern and somewhat reminiscent of drinking in someone's house.  Where they would charge you for their alcohol...

Friendly bartenders, a wide variety of alcohol and beer on hand, and apparently a great spot for happy hours and their Basil Gin gimlet.  The only knock I could really think of is that with only two bartenders this night, the wait for a drink dragged a bit.  But even then, the drinks made up for it.
author: Mike L.

description: I came here on a saturday night expecting a busy crowd, but surprisingly it was very empty.  The layout is pretty simple, a large bar and tables.  I like the upstairs lounge area because the seats are very comfy and it feels more private.  The drinks are good, tried both the mojito and cucumber martini.  Both were on the sweet side, but still very tasty and plenty of liquor.  A nice chill and laid back bar if you are ever in the area and need a drink!
author: Terence N.

description:
What a wonderful find - thanks again to Yelp! 83 Proof is an excellent bar...and that's all it is. I mean that as a compliment - we wanted a good drink at a real bar, and that's exactly what we got. They are exceptionally well stocked and the mixologists are friendly, knowledgeable, and make outstanding drinks. The Manhattan they served was literally the best we've ever had, and thanks again to proprietor Chris Barry for suggesting the perfect single-cask Bourbon for me. He also had the class to serve it in a tulip glass with ice water back...including an eyedropper that allowed me to mix exactly the right amount of water.

The prices were perfectly reasonable, the atmosphere was welcoming and friendly, and the drinks were outstanding. We are looking forward to going again.

Highly recommended.
author: Steve M.

description: This place is great. Try basil gimlet and you won't be disappointed. Manhattan is good too. The place is crazy busy in the evening on weekdays, but weekends are fine. The bartenders here are really friendly and suggest some awesome drinks!
author: Gaurav S.

description: A great watering hole. Not a lot of draft beer selection but a well priced drinkers bar.  Friendly staff and clean.
author: Robert J.

description: A friend reserved the entire bar to celebrate a birthday party. It was nice to have the place all to ourselves. They had a dj that played hip-hop music all night. The bartenders were nice and made some great cocktails. If you do not know what kind of drink you want to order, they can make suggestions and create a cocktail on the spot depending on your likes. I tried a Poke in the Hive which has egg whites and honey. It was surprisingly good. This was a nice and classy venue tucked away in the financial district.
author: Frances V.

description:
This place is friggin hard to find. That or I'm a girl and am directionally challenged...that could be it.

Met my boo here for an after work drink. Super crowded with suits and those who you want to get away from in the office after 6pm. The bartenders are super friendly. They have all kinds of beers and girly cocktails. Great place to let your hair down.
author: Katie Anne N.

description: I like this place, reminds me a little of Rickhouse. The bartenders are really cool and are great at making suggestions if you are not sure what you want. Cocktails are specialties here, so don't go for a beer or classic well mixer, have them whip you up something really tasty. I like the upstairs lounge area, usually you have to reserve it but if you have a big enough group & its open, you can usually sort of commandeer it.
author: Jen S.

description:
Super loud, super crowed- it's just fine to get a drink or 2 to start out your night.
I've walked past the entrance countless times and never even knew it was there.
Fun place to watch the game if you want to be in an exciting group environment.
author: Edi B.

description: This place is awesome. Come in and ask for the cocktail menu...yeah don't have one. The super nice bartender will ask what kind of drink you are feeling like or go from the flavors you like. Next thing you know, a beautifully crafted cocktail appears. Got to love it when the bartender has a brain and knows his alcohol. Definitely will be back.
author: Logan M.

description:
SHappy hour 2-7pm, $3 draft beers, $1 off well drinks.  There was a piano player jamming loud enough to hear over the conversation on a tuesday night at 5:00pm.  Thanks to yelp I found you guys!  

Mike, one of the bartenders, was very cool and quick on the refills and happy to rap a bit between customers and refills.  If you haven't been here and are looking, you may walk right on by so either listen to the noise as you walk by on 1st st towards mission or use your GPS.  No sign out front simply #83 above the door.  Upstairs was also hoppin.  

Best Happy Hour I have found in this area for cheap drinks and cool atmosphere.  Will def be back!
author: Mark T.

description: Good place for after work drinks. Not a ton of space but a fun vibe.
author: Terry D.

description:
Bartenders and music are two key things that can make or break a bar.

A warm smile from the person that will quickly serve you a killer drink, while bumpin tunes echo around you, is what separates the good bars from the great bars.

83 Proof's staff, and constantly diverse music - propel it into a solid five star standing.

I like to stick to their adapted Gin Fizz (meaning no egg whites) with lots of lime. It provides a sharp buzz, without the strong bite of most drinks, while still being refreshing. This drink, coupled with their beautiful interior, crafted from soft homey and elegant woods, and their blindingly well stocked bar, is the perfect backdrop for hanging out with some close friends, or co-workers on an electric San Francisco night.

Though the bar can get crowded and the space is slightly narrow, as are most San Francisco bars, try to sneak in early, so you take advantage of the chic overlooking balcony area above.
author: Jessica T.

description: Our friends held a private event at this little bar and it was great. Though having over 80 guests attend with only 2 bartenders, our thirsty group spent most of the night waiting for drinks. Would recommend for small gatherings. They have an upstairs area, but doesn't hold that big of a group. Basil gimlet did not disappoint! Delicious as others have mentioned on yelp. Also got a Moscow mule :) no copper mugs but a nice strong drink! Will return for future events or just a night out.
author: Janice A.

description:
It's the closest bar to my office ... and probably the "classiest".  As much as I enjoy the taverns/pubs around me, it's sometimes nice to grab a drink at a bar that offers creative and tasty cocktails.  I really like the decor ... dim, warm colored walls, long wooden bar, some high wooden tables and a small upstairs section with additional seating (couch and some armchairs).

After work, this place is extremely crowded and loud.  I'm usually snaking my way to the bar and then standing the rest of the time.
author: Dina H.

description: The bartender was a master of his craft. Helpful and very friendly, offering good suggestions to help you figure out what you're after.
author: James B.

description:
I got really drunk here. The mezzanine is good for making out "discreetly" and that's about all I remember.

So, yes Yelp, 4 stars! Yay! I AM a fan!
author: Jillian M.

description: Skilled, knowledgeable and friendly staff not afraid to mix something based on a vague description.  A great place to go to if you never know what to order at bars.
author: Lex D.

description:
Loud and crowded.  One star is for the friendly and skilled bartenders.  One more star for being fairly priced with a good selection of beers and other booze.  

Most people go here for an afterwork drink.  It is convenient for those working in the FiDi/SOMA, however, this place is narrow and gets packed quickly.  It is impossible to carry on a conversation.  If you can get one of the handful of tables, do it.  Otherwise you will be shoved around as people try to worm their way up to the bar.  With so many bars within a 3 block radius, there are better options.
author: Mackenzie O.

description:
I walked in to 83 Proof making sure the bouncer knew who I was whenever I would step out, because I have luggage and trying to get my damn ID out of there takes time and effort = both of which I don't have. Luckily, he knew who I was by the end of the night (Hi Michael!!).

When I changed clothes, I asked my friend Aaron, who was wonderful enough to grace me with his presence that evening as my arm candy, if what I was wearing was slutty enough. 

Aaron: "Yes."
Me: "Success!"

We rode the bus over from the Panhandle and that was interesting. We get there and try to make our way through the crowd (difficult) and manage to score us some drinks by the absolutely gorgeous bartender Sky. *sigh* Those tattoos and the face with that body...ok I'm distracting myself. 

ANYWAYS I ended up drinking way too much that night. Here is what I can remember before whisking Janney away to Power Exchange:

-Showing everyone my Make Me Yelp underwears.
-Being spanked by Janney
-Inappropriately hugging Keane and a number of other yelpers.
-Meeting Ethan and Nadja and some other cool peeps
-Camera flashes going off
-Me almost falling down the stairs
-Me sitting on Patrick M's lap making sure he told me everything I needed to know about Japan and why I would do well there, then asking him to get me a drink and leaving before he could get it to me (SORRY!!! I'll make it up to you!!)
-Begging Janney to come with me to PE...and succeeding!
-Telling someone I loved them...I don't remember who it was but could you remind me so I can tell you again?
-Grabbing Crystal L's boobs. 
-Squealing
-Scoring a free hoodie from the bouncer who now has my number and won't stop hitting on me...grrreeeaaatttttt :block:

If anyone else remembers what happened that night, feel free to add onto this. For the sake of my dignity. Now where's that trash can I threw it in?
author: Jaime L.

description:
I like this happy hour spot. Not sure why, but I think it's like a cool pair of shoes. They are pretty uncomfortable and impractical, but still have enough of an allure that you keep on wearing them...

Well let's start with why not 83 Proof? Hmm well very little seating, often packed, usually takes a while to get drinks, very loud. 

But true to those damn good looking shoes, it's got some benefits that keep me coming back... like a nice mix of people (not too hipster, not too Marina, juuuuust right). Reasonably cool space, oh and it's only a few blocks from my office.

So if the shoe fits...
author: Jeremy S.

description:
My friend held a private party here for his birthday and it was pretty nice. My college friends and I basically had a mini reunion. :) The place is pretty small and narrow though, so don't expect space to be dancing (my friend said there would be). It did take us awhile to get ahold of the bartender and they were constantly making drinks for everyone, so maybe they could have had more bartenders? The drinks here are pretty good though! My friend ordered something similar to a Alabama Amaretto (I think that's what she said- it gets rather noisy in there) and it was really good! I wish I knew what it was. The place isn't super well lit, it has a bit of a dim, orange-brown cast, but it's not hard to navigate your way at all. There's a second floor where there's couches and you can look over the balcony onto the first floor. The railing didn't seem particularly study though. And there's two bathrooms on the first floor, one co-ed, and one just for the ladies.

Tip: There's no fee to rent the place, you just have to meet the bar minimum (which we did!).
author: Ivy L.

description:
If you're a single girl, 83 Proof is the place to be during happy hour on a Friday night.  Lots of guys and lots of booze to rev-up your weekend!  

It gets mighty crowded and it's sometimes hard to get the bartenders' attention, but the drinks are good, service is chill and you seem to hardly hear the music, allowing you to hear the sound of your own voice.  

The place itself is cute.  A great, big wall of alcohol, a tall, lofty ceiling with an upstairs area and cozy lighting makes for a great bar.  

I like!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Bah! I missed the basil gimlet. Ah well, I'll be back thanks to the Yelp tips.

83 Proof was great. We went for post-work cocktails with a big crew and gradually took over the mezzanine - definitely go early to snag it - best spot in the house. Downstairs seemed a little crowded, and I'm sure it's even more packed on weekends. All of the drinks were fantastic and the bartenders took great care of us - even trekking up and down the stairs multiple times to clean up and restock drinks!  

Note: drinks are strong. Seriously.
author: Gretchen S.

description:
Nice decor.
Not too bad between Sundays and Wednesdays.
That's the good part.

Now for the bad part.

The drink prices are... unreasonable in my view.

30$ for a pour of 18yo Macallan.
 - I know the retail price. Like Remy, Macallan suffers from being a
   bit over popular with the expected effect on price and quality.
   I also know at least one bar in downtown SF that charges $18/pour.

25$ for a 10yo Japanese single malt.
 - I also realise that Japanese whisky is hard to get in the US, but if
   I can manage having some 15 and 18 year old bottles (no, not Yama) 
   at home, I figure a full-time bar can swing it, somehow. 

Midnight closing time on the days that I go out. I've been informed by the
owner(?) that this is a limitation of their liquor license, and I can sympathise,
but in the end - it still means I can't go there late on quiet evening. 
 

I've toned the review way down after messages to/from the owner. He had
some excellent points, but after all is said and done, I still can't come here
late on a Monday/Tuesday night, and have a glass of good whisky at what
I consider to be a reasonable price.
author: Max R.

description:
Quite possibly my favorite bar in the City! 

I love the HUGE wall of alcohol varieties they have to offer. Mmmmmmm was right on my gin martini. Strong and good. 

Second (and third and forth) on the cute bartender! 

Mezzanine proves that hot air does rise. 

And to the person who stole Megan D's car keys and money from the mezzanine (don't leave your purses unattended, ladies), may you die with a nitric acid enema.
author: Kenny L.

description:
I just got the whole "Chelsea, I want to let you know depression and alcoholism runs in our family, so watch the drinking" talk the other day, and I know my mom stalks me on Yelp, so here goes another review for a bar.

Low key but classy, that's what 83 Proof is. The spot is incognito and unmarked from the exterior. It's a dim lit, cozy bar and perfect for post-work drinks or a night cap. The bartenders are very nice and fix up a mean cocktail. Mellow, sophisticated and cool. I don't think I'd go out of the way to come here, but I surely would if I was in the area.
author: Chelsea P.

description: I've been meaning to try out this bar for awhile -- super close to campus, doesn't have a sign in the front (bonus points for attempting to be obscure).  It's a fun place for happy hour, definitely will put in my list of places to hit up in the near future.  Great spot.
author: Mel G.

description:
I came here for a Yelp DYL happy hour and had a blast. It was a great little spot. I loved the upstairs area. 

The bartenders, male and female, were good looking and friendly. 

The drinks were not outrageously priced.

This is right down the street from my office so I would definitely come back for a happy hour.
author: Carlos A.

description:
Easy to miss if you dont pay attention.  No signs...doesnt look like a bar from the outside.  LOOK FOR THE NUMBER 83!!!

Walked inside and was like...whoa...pretty cool.  Got a few tables on the side...nice looking bar...LCD TV on the Warriors game.  Bartender was attentive and quickly got my drinking binge going.  Got a huge selection of alcohol all against the wall and had a great time just chatting it up with my friends there.

Don't know how it will be on weekends but for this one time on Wednesday...it was decent.  Might check this place out from time to time.
author: Dave L.

description:
A note to the owners: Please, for the love of all that is bourbon and rye goodness, don't ever let your bartender Marc go!  He is the very reason that we choose your venue in the first place.

We had a birthday party at 83 Proof last Saturday and no one was disappointed.  The venue is beautiful and laid-back, the bartenders were polite, helpful and fun - and the cocktails were magnificent.  Our party was about 25 people, and everyone enjoyed.  

Thank you again for such a great time.  We will definitely be back.
author: Michelle P.

description: Bartenders are friendly and funny and know how to make personalized drinks! Also they have hot water which is always a plus :)
author: Jennifer S.

description:
One of the original cocktail bars in SF before the concept was found on every street corner, and after all these years, still as fun as the first time I went in 2008. 

The decor was very warm and welcoming. Soft lighting, cool clientele, great vibe and a friendly staff. Just about everything you could ask for. 

As many bars of their ilk, they pride themselves on conceptualizing hundreds of different cocktails that are sure to meld with anyones current mood. Sometimes you want something sweet, sometimes you want something salty, sometimes you want something strong...they're sure to steer you in the right direction.

Their assortment of snack mix is notable and includes wasabi peas, almonds, dried seaweed and more. I must have eaten a full eight bowls by myself. YOLO.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
I like their $4 vodka & grapefruit when I come here during happy hour.

I like the piano player who comes in around 5.

I like that 83 was open, welcoming us with open doors after a bunch of us finished our final. (Can you believe that I had to take a final on Mother's Day? My mom did not believe me and I had to furnish proof of the date of my final).

I like their Pinot Noir.

I like that their restrooms are pristine. 

The ONLY thing I don't like is that if I want my water refilled, the bartender or barback won't walk over and hand me my water. Yes, I'm seated at a table right across from the bar but shouting my name out for me to get my water like I'm a dog is not warranted, is it?
author: Vanessa W.

description:
Met an old friend for a HH drink here last Thursday - based on Yelp reviews ;-)
