Will have to give this visit a 3-star. Selection was top shelf, service was solid, drinks well-made... but spare seating, shoulder to shoulder crowd, wait for drinks doesn't offer anything special, besides the walk from 1 Market.
That said, maybe a 4-star visit if it was 3p instead of 5:30p or a Mon-Wednesday. But would definitely give it another shot, since it's also a halfway point to other friends who work in the area.
author: Johnny V.

description:
Aspiring mixologists (and those who just like to imbibe creative cocktails) will appreciate 83 Proof. I happened to pop in last night during WhiskyWeek and there were a number of enticing whisky-filled options on a special menu. 

Expect the bar downstairs to be mobbed in the after work hours. Come early to snag a couch upstairs but be prepared to yell across the table (or snuggle up and whisper in your companion's ear) as the acoustics on the second floor are not super conducive to conversation.
author: Miriam W.

description:
One of the bartenders (I regret not asking for his name now) makes an original cocktail that really brings the noise. It's a variation of another original cocktail he makes (of which I can't remember), and he didn't even have a name for this new one yet. Hmm...this review seems to be getting more useless as I write. 

Either way, great atmosphere, amazing selection of Scotch, Bourbon, and Tequila from what I could see. Plus, they had a taco truck set up right outside, exploiting the post-happy hour appetites of the FiDi society.
author: Joe A.

description:
2 blocks from my work. Great happy hour prices. What more can a working girl ask for?!?

There are no sign at the front with the name of this place, it's right around the corner from the Walgreens on First and Mission. You won't miss it if you go during rush hour. People are always sitting at the lounge area right at the front of the bar.

This bar is a long recentagle with a wall of alcohol/bar on one side and 5 tables on the other. They also have a small balcony on the 2nd floor that have a few tables as well. I've never been in here when it's not crowded- it is always packed house here, even when i get off a little bit before 5! I  envy the FiDi crowd that can get off early and grab the few tables that they have here.

Like everyone else, they can whip up a fancy drink depending on your preference, but they also get offended when you ask for beer such as a blue moon - so don't do it. 

Btw, no food here, just booze. Enjoy!
author: Tenny W.

description: Apparently everyone else loves this place too, and they should. Wonderful establishment with bartenders that give a damn about good drinks. Also, a nice mixture of your typical stereotypes, meaning- it's kind of hard to make a generalization about the feel and the clientele. It's just a cool bar and you can ask for whatever you want and the drinks are incredible and reasonably priced. This is me and my wife's favorite place right now.
author: Jesse L.

description:
'was there for happy hour- it was crowded. Dirty Martini was well made and so was the manhattan- we had a private chef event upstairs- unfortunately i did not go up to see the space (other HH commitments,hehe) but overall besides being too crowded, i liked this place. Good professional crowd. Worth trying different drinks.  Not everyone makes dirty martinis good!..mmm just saying..and i love it when they put 3 (yes 3- not 2, not 1) olives, that makes it a small meal! :) haha.
Good times. iRecommend.
author: C A.

description:
Hard to remember, impossible to forget!

You literally have to have your eyes peeled off to find this place. I met a date here one fine Friday night. The place is dimly lit, which adds to the mystery and excitement of a first date. We grabbed a comfy loungey seat in front of the open airy window. You can actually have a conversation.

Not that it was love at first bite, er I mean sight, but the place was definitely up to par for first time encounters.

Started off with the mojito times 2 then ventured and took up the bartenders recommendation for a "basil gimlet." The drinks are very well mixed and the aftermath, a great buzz.

This bar has an array of specialty signature cocktails. I definitely recommend 83 Proof as it is off the beaten path. Not everyone knows of this bar or has even heard about it. Therefore, you should definitely try it out.
author: Cellina B.

description: Loved this place on a Friday night with the after work crowd. Lots of people there, but service was still fast and it was super easy to get the bartenders attention. Will definitely go again!
author: Brittnee P.

description:
This is my clear favorite bar in San Francisco. The bartenders are way pro - efficient, friendly, and with the skills to make you the perfect cocktail every time and even invent ones on the fly to suit your mood or taste. I usually go with the cucumber gimlet which has become my favorite drink that I just can't get anywhere else as good. 

83 Proof is clean, has a nice, relaxed atmosphere, seating, a private mezzanine area that fits about 20, and has large windows in the front that can be opened for a nice breeze on warm days or evenings. I adore their fantastic liquor and beer selection and that it's kind of in an odd place with a super low profile. I've taken to calling this my spiritual drinking home for a reason.
author: Kristina A.

description:
Well, bring a GPS...or three. Because of the location, it's super isolated on a Saturday night. That, coupled with no signage, makes it kind of tough to locate. However, if you get there around 9pm, you can get some prem-o parking right in front of the bar without having to pay. Score!

The bar itself is quite long and narrow, which could be problematic when it gets crowded and you're trying to get a drink at the bar.  Speaking of which, the bartenders are nice but they definitely need more than two on a Saturday night. The décor has a Havana feel to it and there is a swanky little sitting area upstairs. 

Overall, I'd come back if I was in the area...especially since the drinks are pretty cheap too!
author: Nam N.

description: Was here last night... Fun, friendly bartenders, good crowd... I will definitely go back!
author: Leslie E.

description: Great cocktails and friendly bartenders.  I've been coming here with coworkers and friends for almost ten years now, and always have a good time.
author: Joe H.

description:
I keep trying to think of reasons to not give this place 5* but I really can't think of anything. I mean they've got knowledgeable bartenders, a great whisky selection, good cocktails, reasonable prices, convenient location to work, and a decent amount of room to hang out.

The bartender that's all tatted up (I forget his name) makes a mean Manhattan and is quite knowledgeable about his whiskies. I've had more than a couple conversations with him (when it's not busy, of course) about different ones on the shelf. I believe there are some happy hour specials on beer but I haven't picked up a tab here in some time so I cannot confirm. 


Just go!
author: Farhad M.

description:
To cap off an interesting week (including getting pulled into a dentist office's photoshoot and then dressing up like Batgirl for Dodgeball), a few coworkers and I decided to head over to 83 Proof on Friday after work.

It was packed at 7 PM and there was someone checking IDs at the door (are we at a club??).  It was mostly the after-work crowd, and after we got our drinks ($10 total for a whiskey soda and cran-vodka), we squeezed back through to the front, where they had the windows and door open.  The breeze was nice, but after awhile it got too chilly so someone closed the windows and door.

The place cleared out around 8:30 or so, with only a few people upstairs and sitting at the bar, but around 10 people started coming in again.  When we left around 10:30, it was back to being relatively crowded, though not as packed as it was at 7.

The wall of alcohol (mentioned by Mike L. earlier) is awesome.  People aren't super judgmental.  The place is clean.  The bathrooms are clean (I even put my purse on the floor of the bathroom!).  The drinks are reasonably-priced.  The location is super convenient (a block from BART, across the street from the Transbay Terminal).  What more could you ask for?

Thank you, 83 Proof, for being the dead center point between my work and home.  I'll be seeing you again.  And again.
author: Tori S.

description: Love this bar. Friendly bartenders, reasonably priced drinks, and as Michael D. said, "casual but trendy". Great after work happy hour place.
author: Alison B.

description:
I LOVE the atmosphere here--very classy, stylish, and definitely pass for romantic.  It's definitely the place to come dressed up getting FANCY drinks and have a good time with friends.  We came here for a friend's birthday event and got an upstair big table with couches....super comfy and have lots of privacy but not feel isolated.  Be sure to get there early (around 10 should be ok) or get a table reserved because it got packed later at night.

The bartenders were great at recommending new drinks that I guarantee you've never had anywhere else before.  I ordered some chocolate-flavored drink imagining that it would be nasty but I was soooo wrong.  Their gimlets were very tasty and did not taste like regular blended juices like you'd normally experience at some other bars.  All drinks were reasonably priced (aka not cheap) for a place like this, and definitely strong!!!  At the end of the night (after 2-3 drinks), I was so buzzed...
author: Numrin T.

description:
Nish N. swears by 83 Proof, so we went for a few after-work refreshments the Friday before Christmas.  We showed up at around 5 p.m. and were surprised to find that the place was already packed - not sure if that's typical for a Friday evening, but I'm sure a lot of people were only working half days or leaving the office early.  

The bar is relatively small, but a good layout - the front area was cleared out when we were there with no tables or obstacles (which made it easy to hang out with a big party).  The bar area is a bit narrow, making it tough to get to the restroom.  The money spot at this bar is the upstairs if you can get there early enough to secure it.

The service is pretty fast given how busy the place is, and the drinks are good.  It's a great hang out for the Financial District/SoMa area.
author: Wendy L.

description:
I used to work in the same block as 83 Proof for 5 years but never noticed this place. Probably because it used to look dirty and skeevy. I blame it on the obese homeless guy who's always hanging around in front of the Walgreens next door. Anyway, I only started coming here last year when I was looking for a nearby bar to take a visiting friend. To my surprise, I really like this bar and I've been coming here ever since.

The bartenders are really friendly, even when we request stupid complicated drinks like the famed basil gimlet. We even made requests that would make other bartenders want to kill us such as "something fruity but not sweet", or "something fancy like the basil gimlet but with no gin, or whiskey", or "something with honey". Seriously, other bars would've kicked us out. But this bartender took our requests seriously and even asked for suggestions to name his creation. Too bad I'm not very creative with names and would probably name it something dorky like "hadouken cocktail" or something.

It was pretty packed on a Thursday night, but the crowd cleared up at around 9. They probably went to get dinner. So it was comfortable. I have not been upstairs, but from what I've heard, they have sofas.

Parking is a bitch. Even getting there is a bitch, especially during rush hour. Because everybody is on Mission, trying to get to the freeway. So be warned.

Too bad my work is moving soon. I'm gonna miss this place.
author: Ari C.

description:
Come on Thursdays.  Ask for Michael.  Tell him you want a drink.  Specify ONLY the type of spirit you prefer and something about cocktails you generally like.  You will get something that tastes like quintessence of you.

Also, there were CUTE boys here.  I like eye-candy with my alcohol.
author: Caitlin M.

description: Definitely a great place to visit. Tell the bar tender/ mixologist what kind a drink your looking for then you're all set. They blend up a random mix and life is great again. Enjoy...
author: Clark W.

description: These bartenders are artists, not just mixologists.  Like cracker/caviar, the two compliment each other and exceed expectations.  I've never seen more care put into a gimlet in my life, or a whiskey sour so well put together it was ready for the red carpet. Then to top it off, tell them your preferred spirit and let them surprise you with something they have invented; spirits, spices, essence, and care in every damn drink.  Fun to watch and even more enjoyable to drink.  Cheers to the staff there.
author: JT N.

description: We had a private party here last night (on a Saturday with about 70 people), and I cannot say enough good things about 83 Proof.  From the initial email I sent inquiring about private events to the end of the night last night, the entire experience was awesome.  The minimum to rent out the entire bar all night is reasonable, especially for a Saturday night, and the upstairs area makes a perfect spot for a DJ.  They were fine with us decorating, we brought in a ton of food and a cake, and the bartenders (Mark and A.J.) could not have been cooler.  People kept coming up to me all night saying it was the best party ever.  Plus, street parking on a Saturday in the area is not an issue.  If you're looking for a spot for a private event, 83 Proof is it.
author: J J.

description:
Not sure how I haven't written a review for 83 Proof yet...

It's a relatively small place with great bartenders who know what they're doing and can recommend a great drink if you're unsure of what you're looking for.

The downside to good cocktails is that they tend to take a while to make...be patient.

If you have a relatively large group (15-20 people) I'd try reserving the upstairs area.
author: Ben B.

description:
So I'm still living in 1995 without a smartphone: I didn't have access to Yelp's review highlights, which means I had no way of knowing this place serves a DELICIOUS GIMLET. Instead I had to settle for a standard Firestone Pale Ale. It really would have been nice to have tried their signature drink though...

Besides their drinks, I think I may have been here on an off-night; the place was somewhat empty and everyone looked too old. I was practically as old as the children of the patrons of this place.
author: David H.

description:
Really liked the space here, though the crowd was a little douch-baggy. High ceilings and sexy dim lighting.

This would be a great place to celebrate something, especially if you can grab the tables upstairs. It was rammed on a Saturday night, but our group retreated up there where we had a cocktail waitress serving our needs.

Would like to try it again during the week and get the Miriam and Nish experience (awesome bartenders, and mixology), I didn't get to sample any of their house specialties.
author: Nikki M.

description: Cool venue, great location, but slow service. The worst part, we tried at least 5-6 different scotch brands from bottles they had opened, and we had them all neat. Everyone of them seemed to have been watered down, no joke. Went to another bar after a tried the same brands and it tasted the way it should be. Pretty disappointing.
author: Paul G.

description:
It's got a great atmosphere (sometimes I feel like I'm not dressy enough, especially rolling in with my backpack), but it's hella chill. They have one TV where you can watch the game, but this ain't a sports bar: they keep it classy here.

Drinks are great, bartenders are nice. The upstairs lounge is a plus too.
author: Louis N.

description: Good happy hour, after work spot. My office is just around the corner so I made it here a few times. Space is limited, but friendly staff and pretty good happy hour prices.
author: Jonathan N.

description:
83 poured me some solid classic cocktails for a great after-work meetup and enjoyed meeting some of the friendly energetic crowd.  

However, I couldn't even hear the name of the cute girl I met.  Minus star for your part in this by creating a far too loud atmosphere.  The jet way at Chicago O'Hare has less decibels.  Save the db drag race for Hot Import Nights.
author: Taylor O.

description: If you are here on a Monday, ask for Enrique to make you something with strawberries. What ever it was he was doing... It was exquisite.
author: Ruari H.

description: Convenience is key here. Right by the financial district but nothing to rave about. You have to wait and squeeze up to the bar for happy hour. They really need a wait staff.
author: Jill R.

description:
This is a nice place to go for after-work drinks.  The prices are reasonable and the drinks are good.  Next time I'm here I'll have to try the basil gimlet mentioned in the other reviews.

However, the bar can be hard to spot.  There's no signage out front other than the street numbers, which aren't that big to begin with.  The music can get loud, making conversations difficult.  Also, it can get chilly near the front since they leave the front window open, so bring some layers.
author: Art M.

description: Went here last night for one of my friend's wedding after party. The place was reserved just for the wedding guest so we didn't have to deal with the crowds that the locals spoke of. The bartenders were awesome and I never seen a bartender sample my drink before serving it to me to ensure it was up to par. Definitely top notch bartenders.
author: Jeffrey C.

description:
I've been to 83 Proof both for happy hour and for weekend evening with friends.  

The bartenders here are really friendly, but more importantly, they are  great at what they do.  If you want something different than normal, just let a bartender know what you usually drink and they can make you a delicious and unique concoction.  Last time, I asked if they had Veev (acai liqueur), which they did not have, but he busted out some Absolut Acai and made a simple but tasty Absolut Acai with simple syrup and lime juice. 

My G&T drinking friend asked for something with whisky and got a fantastic muddled blueberry with basil and whisky drink.  Delicious!

The crowd is relaxed and they have a "first come first serve" upstairs area which is great too.  Prices are completely reasonable (2 of those "specialty" cocktails are $17).

I'm a huge fan and will continue to come back here.
author: Naoko M.

description: I met some friends for a drink hoping to find a good spot for a future work event. The bar was perfect. Nice decor. A lovely, intimate (but not too intimate) mezzanine and a great selection of whiskey. Not to mention cute, knowlegeable bartenders. The only real hitch is the bar isn't marked other than the address. Oh well, maybe it keeps out the lookeyloos.
author: Nicole M.

description:
I was "cheating" on my detox and wanted a nice clean drink, you know just a vodka soda, splash of lime.  So I asked the bartender for a vodka recommendation and had a nice chat.  I landed on our local Hanger One, and it was a nice treat.  It's nice to have a bartenders with not just knowledge but opinions.
Sometimes it does get annoying packed here, but when it doesn't it's just a nice after work bar. 
And I heard on Tuesdays they have a piano player, nice.  Will have to check it out.
author: YJ P.

description: Great for happy hour! If you want a place for young professionals 25 to 35 this is it. The crowd is very good-looking. The bartenders are not bartenders they are mixologists. The drinks are so delicious. They are so well made if they are using cheap liquor, which I doubt, you can't taste it at all. Get there early or be prepared to stand.
author: Kazzi F.

description: Something about eating at Benu makes me lose all sense of time management. Meeting the same friend that I did, after the first time there, I showed up almost an hour late (apologies) to a very mellow 83 Proof. Didn't realize at first that their address was 83 also. Guess that makes sense. Bartender made a very solid rye bourbon Manhattan and we chatted about how maybe three times a charm? I don't know how crazy this gets during the weekend but for wed night it's a great laid back place to have a well mixed cocktail and chill.
author: Kim N.

description:
Very cool laid back bar. The entrance is very unassuming- Just the number 83 its as if you are entering a secret society. Once inside oooohh la la a whole wall of alcohol greets you (see photos). I had the sweet tea vodka w/freshly squeezed lemon and it was as if I was in Georgia on a hot summer night. Lordy lordy. 

Yup, it was really good but what made it better was the ambience at this bar. The decor and mood was spot on. Hip/modern/slight moroccan vibe. There is also a small upstairs lounge and that is where my friends and I spent the night. No one else was up there so it was like a private party. 

IDK if it was just because it was Friday of Labor Day weekend but, it wasn't very packed when we were there. 

In closing, if you like FANCY drinks this place has no problem whipping up whatever concoction you come up with. Have fun and make sure you have a DD. ;)
author: Giovanna F.

description:
Everyone needs to try this place. Seriously. 

Came on a Friday after work for happy hour with some friends. The place is very discreet considering that they are located in part of the busiest work areas in San Francisco- I almost walked right by it! 

It is a narrow space, but has a very cozy feeling. I really enjoyed the vibe of the place as well as the crowd that it attracted- mostly young working professionals. We had the pleasure of getting our drinks from a bartender, i think his name was Mark- he was AWESOME. He was more so a mixologist rather than a bartender though, he mixed us some of the most amazing drinks I've had just based on us telling him what we liked. I normally don't like fruity drinks, but he made the most amazing drink for me with raspberry, vodka, egg whites, and some other ingredients that I didn't quite catch. 

Overall a very talented bar staff, and a great place to unwind after a day's work.
author: lauren j.

description: Great beer selection, nice huge open window facing the street. perfect happy hour location, just make sure you get there early (or as early as possible). I wish they would let me play the piano by the bar :(
author: Jay F.

description: Ok but not as great as some others in the area...would be nice if yhey hsd a few more happy hour specials
author: R J.

description:
My regular post-office bar. Awesome selection, great help, nice relaxed interior. I come here for " off-site performance reviews" with my managers. It's definitely a financial district crowd.. and I fit right in with my suit and laptop bag. :) 

It will get crowded early, and given the location, if you're planning on driving, don't.

And there was a dude playing rock / indie pop on the piano. Cool!
author: Dylan ..

description: Veryyyyyy cool bar. I don't remember much about it other than 4 shots of patron were 40$... definitely on the pricy side but hey, it was NYE and everyone was really friendly... (From what I can remember!) I loved the way this bar looked though it had a pretty cool feel to it.
author: Siobhan F.

description:
A serendipitous happening allowed me to venture to 83 proof with a co-worker and his old friend, who happens to work here. I had been hearing about the "special manhattan" that was made, and to be honest, I was sceptic.

A. I love bourbon, neat, no frilly stuff.

B. I drink only bourbon, neat, no frilly stuff.

C. I live for bourbon....

you get the idea.

Well, needless to say, a Manhattan is not favorite thing but I decided "Hey, why not, this is his specialty".

Walking in the door the wall-o-alcohol caught my attention and then I quickly noticed the plethora of specialty Bourbon's that 83 Proof boasts....SCORE!!!

The Manhattan was made, and it was sucked down. Adorned with brandied cherries, this was BY FAR the best Manhattan I have ever had, it should really be called The San Hattan.
author: Natalie B.

description: This little place serves a refreshing blueberry gimlet.  The youngish crowd of bankers and engineers in their 30s makes seating limited.  Didn't make it up to the loft because it was full enough to discourage casual navigation.  Friendly sort of place, talked to some strangers, caught part of the game, not bad.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Expectation matters a lot.  This guy at work has been talking up this place and how cool he thinks it is.  He says he feels like Don Draper on Mad Men when he goes here.  So me and a friend thought we should check it out.  It is pretty close to my work so I could definitely add it to my unwinding spots. 

It was a disappointment right from the beginning.  First, this is a sort of ugly section of 1st Street in a spot of the city that I find a little iffy to begin with. The door is also hard to find (that can be cool if you're going for the hidden club feel, but here it was just annoying). Inside you find a pretty average sort of tiny bar.  The chandelier and the balcony are a nice touch but overall I wasn't sure what this bar was going for.  Dive bar? Cocktail lounge?  I don't know. It got average looking bar down though.

The other thing was that something about the acoustics of this place just felt off too me.  There weren't that many people but it still felt too loud somehow.  

Maybe I expected too much or came on the wrong night or just wasn't into it.

Oh, the drinks were okay though.  I just had a beer because I had to 
work the next day.

It didn't do it for me.  But maybe I will give it another shot on a Friday night and have something with a little more kick, like a Greyhound or a Zombie.  That always makes places more entertaining for me.
author: Nikki K.

description: Dragging my feet after a long flight, this bar delivered on a delicious old fashioned. Almost infinite liquor selection here. Very enjoyable place, although when I was here it was swarming with middle-aged business bros. I left after just the one drink because I couldn't stand the barroom politics. Not the establishment's fault.
author: Chris F.

description:
Just discovered this hole in the wall around the corner from my work!  Literally stumbled upon it.  Cute, friendly bartenders that were making what looked to be fantastic cocktails, though we ordered a couple glasses of champagne.  
Upsides:
- Piano player that rocks out and has his list of songs handwritten for you to choose from.  Don't ask for Elton John or Billy Joel ... but what other 50-something year old man will play Arcade Fire on a run-down piano for you?
- Everyone there is super nice.  Bartenders and patrons alike.  My friend was running late so I sat for about half an hour by myself and never felt awkward (not that I usually would anyway).  Met some great people that work nearby - yay! New lunch buddies.
- Bathrooms are clean.
- They have something for everyone.  Good liquor selection, decent drafts, and above-average wine list.  

Downers:
- Yes, it's tiny.  If you're going for happy hour, get there early to secure seating or be prepared to pack in like sardines.
- I'm sure I had another gripe, but the champagne erased it from my memory.
author: Renee R.

description:
First visit with a friend last Wednesday. Amazing drinks. Don't ask for your regular (boring) drinks and tell the bartenders what you like. They will whip up something incredibly creative and delicious. It was our plan to get just one more drink after dinner, then we ended up having 3+ drinks each. 

I went back with another friend last night and had a round of great drinks again. Definitely my favorite bar so far :)

Some of the drinks I've had here:
- Blueberry basil gimlet -- my favorite
- Something with cucumber. I said eww at first but Marc the bartender said he'd change that for me and he did. Ordered a second one.
- Something with strawberry and egg white. 
- Vodka with grapefruit (and something else)

All very very good. I'm going back again before I leave SF next week :(
author: Joowon A.

description:
While the financial district is a veritable ghost town on most nights, I do love the ample parking.  

83 proof was kind of hard to find but once inside, it was pretty cool.

There was a decent crowd in here and the drinks were stiff.

The bathrooms in here sparked a debate which I have been dying to get the official rules on.

When do you lock the door?  

Obviously when there are multiple stalls, you leave it unlocked since it's a multi-person bathroom.

And conversely, when there is one toilet, it's a single person bathroom so you lock the door.

But what the hell happens when it's a single toilet and a single urinal, RIGHT next to each other without any stalls or barricades?

This one stumped me.  

I choose unlocked - and that turned out to be an awkward few moments.  

Protocol.
author: Archie R.

description: For a Happy Hour near work its ok- I really dislike standing up with drink in hand in a tight space while everyone else hits you with their laptop bags....you get the picture.  The Bartenders are friendly and they do take their time to make great drinks with a smile on their face...this this being said, service can be slow for people at the bar each ordering 5-10 drinks.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Was I impressed by 83 proof? I would have to say not really. It was just a clean, simple looking bar with a pretty diverse crowd which is always a plus for me but it didn't win me over too much. 

I stopped by here for the DYL right after Off Like a Prom Dress YEE. I mingled for a short while, and had a drink then was out pretty quick. 

The drinks were pretty affordable and the bartenders were friendly overall so it gets an a okay from me.
author: Darryl P.

description: Very nice place, a bit too loud for a date in my opinion, and gets really packed. The bartenders are knowledgeable and ask you right away what your drink preferences are, and then fix you up an amazing drink.  Very personalized.  The drinks are super strong, so you can take that how you want it.  It's very hard to find, I was walking up and down the street looking for it so expect to find yourself in front of a bar with no sign, next to Walgreens.
author: Terry K.

description: Anywhere from 4-5 stars. Really good joint. The bartenders can make a very fine drink, especially a good whiskey drink. Good selection of scotch as well. Music is decent, and hasn't been overcrowded the few times I've been there.
author: Matt S.

description:
Typical Financial District / SOMA upscale bar. 83 Proof is a small, two story space with a warm inviting atmosphere and a mellow vibe. It attracts a chill, casual crowd and the place never gets too loud. A relaxing destination to enjoy cocktails over conversation. Staff is friendly and fast - pouring your drinks as soon as you ask. 

So why is this spot especially hot?

MIND BLOWING BAR BATHROOMS. 

Never have I seen such an immaculately clean bar bathroom. Not a messy trash can, broken beer bottle, or spill stain in sight. So nice you'll have to be careful not to stay in the bathroom all night.  

Tired of hovering hopelessly over terrifying toilets?!  Give 83 Proof a chance and you won't think twice before unzipping your pants. Hooray!
author: Caroline J.

description:
Came here on a short pub crawl last night. And yes, we had to pay attention to find this place since I had been forewarned that there were no signs outside to indicate that this was a bar. 

I was very pleased that this place wasn't crowded on a Friday night. I could hear my friends that were sitting across the table. 83 Proof had many European beers on draft and in bottles. Buckthorn Cider. Yay! Glad to have stopped by. It's definitely a more low key place that fits my taste.
author: Diana C.

description:
E-chan and I came here for a special friends' MadMen themed birthday party and it was super cool.

We loved the ambience and drinks which fit quite nicely with our MadMen friends.

Definitely a great bar to go to and chill out with loved ones. I'll be back!
author: Keika L.

description: A little expensive, but the fantastic knowledgeable bar staff makes up for it. Mark, our bartender, wanted to know what bourbon we liked to know what other bourbons fit the same flavor profile. These guys really know their liquors - matching the right profiles and nose to what you're looking for. Outstanding.
author: Jeff G.

description:
I think it is safe to say that when you reflect back upon the past few years and come to the following conclusions you should reevaluate your drinking habits: 

-A bar you didn't think you went to often showcases you in their video of their favorite customers and plays it on a loop during business hours. 
-The last three people you ran into on the bus were bartenders that recognized you before you recognized them. 
-When your coworkers asked what you did on your day off you bring up things like laundry as so not to have to admit you pretty much spent your day off drinking at a half a dozen random places. 
-Half of the people in the photo galleries on the websites of more than a few bars around town contain photos of events you somewhat remember being at. 

The last on the list is a recently discovered photo gallery of an event I helped host at 83 Proof. It was a crowded, hot, sweaty, fancy drink and fine scotch sort of event, at a bar that was able to maintain its classy Fidi ambiance by throwing us degenerates into the mezzanine upstairs (which you can reserve no matter what your drinking habits, and which comes in handy between the hours of 5-8 when this place is so packed you can hardly lift your glass to your mouth). 

If 83 Proof can handle us then they definitely get a thumbs up from me. Just try to show up a little later to avoid the crowds and the 20 minute wait to order a drink. THAT is what I meant by reevaluating your drinking habits, what did you think I meant??!!
author: Drue C.

description:
Cool bar hidden away in SOMA. First impressions walking in is that they have a LOT of liquor along their back wall, which means they can probably make practically anything you want. Bartenders are very friendly and make great recommendations. 

Per Yelp, I went with the basil gimlet and was very happy with it. A tiny bit too sweet for me but basil flavor gives the drink a very unusual twist to its typical counterpart. Also tried the Mai Tai which was pretty harsh. Plus, they used cherry syrup which always reminds me of cough syrup. Wouldn't suggest this. 

In addition, Chipotle was having a promotion and giving out FREE burritos and chips. Definitely helped make my day.

4 stars.
author: Jonathan L.

description: "Casual but trendy" is tough to find in the Financial District, but 83 Proof fits the bill perfectly.  It's a cozy space, and while the Happy Hour crowd is simply unruly, the extensive selection of beer and bourbon should satisfy even the most fickle drinker.  Do yourself a favor and unwind here; leave the tie at the office.
author: Michael D.

description:
This place is a regular happy hour joint for me.  It could be a bit of a scene if you wanted it to, but mostly it's full of people who want to go for a drink after work with their friends.  

What makes this place great is:
$2 cans of Hams
A huge variety of liquor
Bartenders who know how to mix all that liquor

These guys are really great at what they do and will make whatever you throw at them.
author: Bob R.

description:
A nice bar that gives room for plenty of mingling.  I've only been here once for a party, which reserved the entire upstairs, but it definitely had a nice cozy feel throughout the whole bar.  The demographics consisted of a more older, mature crowd than your typical local pub, but the large selection of high spirits and beer offered an easy relevance to any stage in life. 

The bartenders are true connoisseurs of mixed drinks. I'm just your average, friendly, neighborhood long island drinker, but if you're looking to appreciate the art of amalgamated liquids, the mixologists have many aces up their sleeves. Anyone looking to blow some steam, or let loose without getting hoochified or your hair did, check this place out!
author: Dale C.

description: This place is one of my favorite happy hour spots, and feels like a secret card in my deck of bar options even though it can get over-crowded during the typical happy hours. They have a great selection of booze, quality bartenders (although be careful ordering an Old Fashioned if you aren't looking for the syrupy, fruity kind - it's hit or miss depending on the bartender), and an all-around warm atmosphere.
author: Adam S.

description:
Apparently a photo of me had been up on their website and used in their Facebook sidebar for some time now... 

http://83proof.com/photogallery.htm

I can't deny quality advertisement like that.

Friendly staff and a nice space, though it gets a bit too packed for my liking. Not my scene but, if it was, I would be at 83 Proof every night.

Can I get my complimentary drink now? This mug don't come for free...
author: Keane L.

description:
OK...I've been going to this bar for a few years now.  I didn't use to like it - the crowd seemed uptight and it was usually too crowded.

But then...one day...I got super drunk at 83 Proof.  I went in the next day and Scott the bartender didn't even mention what a drunken retard I had been the night before.  To not be made to feel ashamed of my ability to drink way more than your average person could or should is a quality I look for in a bar.

All of the bartenders rock!  Every-single-one!

I rarely drink cocktails here now....because they get me waaaaaay to drunk....but happy hour beers for $3???? Can't beat that!
author: YOLANDA M.

description:
THE.

BEST.

BASIL.

GIMLET.


On the night I went - there was a male and female bartender.  The female bartender made me a Basil Gimlet on my request.
It was quite good.  Not being a Gimlet fan, this says a lot.

For my second drink. I ordered another of the same  - from the male bartender.

Blown away, I marveled at the proverbial bar being raised right before my very eyes.  
That man is not only cute but makes the two words, "Basil Gimlet" just damn HOT.


Try it.
author: Grace K.

description: I like to try to get here a bit on the earlier side as I don't like crowds. Then I try to get in Veronica's section and have her make me a Manhattan. She's the best, as are her drinks.
author: El T.

description:
Yesterday after work I met my friend Dev for a drink at 83 proof, like I had so many times in the past. I sat at the high table she had slung her stuff over to "reserve" for our friends and I looked at her and said, "Why do we like this place?" For a moment, I couldn't figure out why the hell we always ended up here. There are tons of places in the Financial District and for some reason, this was our go-to spot. She couldn't really answer me, but as the evening went on I got my answers in the way of amazing and REASONABLE drinks! 

I am consistently impressed with the quality of their drinks, despite large crowds and lines at the bar. For the first time I tried their raspberry mojito and it was a home run! I ordered two drinks, both with top shelf liquor and it came to $14. I was stunned and then I thought to myself, "Oh yah, this is why I like 83 Proof." And you'll more than likely see me there next week because of it.
author: Julia N.

description: This place is fantastic.  My fiance and I stumbled across this place while celebrating our anniversary in the city.   The bar has a very mellow/cool vibe and is stocked with EVERY type of alcohol imaginable.   The bartender AJ asked us the flavors we like in a beverage and he created a delicious masterpiece.  We had a great time at 83 Proof.  We will definitely go back next time we are in SF.
author: Taryn W.

description:
This is in really close proximity from my office.  As mentioned, it's easy to miss.  While sitting inside you constantly see people who are peeking in with a surprised look on their face.  

The selections here are decent.  They have 3$ happy hour beers, a more than average selection I'd say.  They also bottled beers available.  They have a really great selection of liquor.

It's a rather small place, so as it fills up it gets noisy and hard to talk.

Great find, my place to go now.
author: Justin D.

description:
Came here last night with three friends for happy hour after reading reviews on Yelp.  The place is not particularly well marked but not hard to find if you're looking for it.  It's a big small, there were maybe 4 tables, each with 4 chairs, and then chairs along the bar, but that's it.  It was a good crowd however... not open tables or seats but not so packed that we couldn't move.  All 4 of us got a whiskey with raspberry, which was some elaborate mix of whiskey, fresh raspberries, and maybe lemon juice.  They were pretty delicious, though a bit sweet for my taste.  $32 for 4 drinks.  A table cleared out so we sat down and ordered more drinks, each getting a dirty vodka martini ($28 for 4).  These were super strong.  I ordered a Lagunitas on top of that, and I don't think any of us were sober by the time we left.

Overall, the place was cute.  Seemed like a pretty young crowd, drinks weren't cheap but they weren't horribly expensive either, and they put a good amount of alcohol in them.  Show up early if you want a table, but it's still fun closer to 8:00.
author: Samantha B.

description:
Love this little place! At first glance it looks like another tiny bar in SF, but you walk in and realize that it's clean, friendly and prices are good! Came here for a Yelp after party on Friday and I really liked it! In between Market and Mission right? IDK how I remembered anything that night. Like how we walked all the way to 7-11 with my drink in hand, and then walked back with baguette and cigarettes in hand.

BOTTOM LINE: Bartenders were cool, and the company we met at 83 proof was spectacular. Great people, great venue, I'll do it again!
author: Tisha G.

description: They don't have a cocktail menu-- which I thought was weird until the amazing bartender said it was all in his head. He customized a drink based on our favorite alcohol & flavors! I ended up with a basil gimlet and a gin mule....AWESOME experience. Can't wait to go back and switch things up!
author: Daniela G.

description:
Last night was my second visit to 83 Proof.  I truly enjoy the layout.  It has a large bay window that opens to the street, which is much needed-it tends to get super hot in there.  They also have a balcony on the back looking over the rest of the bar.  The bar is made out of all hardwood and it is pristine.  Out of the SOMA 1st street/2nd street bars I think its one of my favorites since it gets the least crowded, as soon as people catch on it may be the new John Collins.  Smooshed and over-packed.

Otherwise the bartender seemed pretty down to earth, the crowd was friendly and the bathrooms super clean!!!  Nothing too great to report but nothing horrendous either, solid bar.
author: Kristin Marie S.

description:
Finally, a trendy gay bar in the Financial District. 83 Proof is upscale with a homicidal edge. Sausage-fest + 2-buck Heinee's = Happy Hour from Heaven. Tough day at the office? SFW. Head straight to 83 Proof after work and end your day right. Hooking up with lawyers, hotties and drunk jocks has never been this easy! WORD.

The 83P bartenders are ridiculous. Behind the bar. Walking you to your car. They're beyond fun, genuinely friendly, and they know when to pour heavy.

I read somewhere that Monday at 83P is Amateur Porn Star Night. Someone's full of shit. I went four Mondays in a row and only saw Juan Jeremy. The rest of them were professionals.

83 PROOF = DOIN' IT.
author: Fish F.

description:
Meeting up with out-of-town friends is always a delight. It means I get to discover new places, catch up on old times, and drink -- all at the same time.

We arrived at 83 Proof right around 1:30PM and were happily greeted by the only three people in the place; "The Welcoming Committee", as they dubbed themselves. Well, thanks!

Sitting down at the bar, we each ordered from their great selection of beer on tap (including the Newcastle Summer Ale) and began to quench our thirst. A smile crept across my face as the very cute bartender called out the total: "$16". For 4 imports on tap? "I got it."

Then we were off to lunch. A solid happy hour (or any hour) drinking spot can be found inside the inconspicuous entrance to 83 Proof. Enjoy.
author: Donna Z.

description:
Well, for a bar I would have instantly deemed "douchey" upon walking in (is that how you spell "douchey?"), in an otherwise "douchey" part of town, this place is really not bad. 

In fact, the bartender I ordered from was a star. I walked in prime-time, at about 11:00 on a Friday night, and the place was bumpin'. My friends had the upstairs balcony reserved for Christopher K's birthday party. It was DEFINITELY bumpin'. Packed. 

I squeezed my way to the bar, and within 5 minutes the bartender was with me (I ain't that good looking, okay; he was fast). 

But more than that, he didn't flip when I leaned over and got comfortable at the bar, and launched into...

"So, I just woke up from a LOOOOOONG nap. Like the kind where you were in REM sleep, and you woke up when your body REALLY didn't want you to... And I'm REALLY out of it. In fact, I really shouldn't even be here... But I'm doing this for my buddy Chris, you know? Social responsibility... Fuck. Maybe it's Catholic guilt. Whatever. ANYWAY! So, I think the only thing I can really handle in my state right now is an IPA, except you DON'T have Racer 5! (*WHINE*). That is, like, MY BEER. How come you guys don't have Racer 5? Not even in a bottle? I would have thought... ANYWAY! So what's the closest thing you've got? To Racer 5? But NOT anything from Speakeasy. I just... Don't like their beer. Everyone always tries to give me something from Speakeasy when I ask that question, and it just doesn't work. Maybe it's me, but... Anyway, you know? No Speakeasy. Something like Racer 5. Thanks."

There are like A MILLION people waiting to get drinks. Boring holes in my back with their death glares. 

This guy did not even flinch. He smiled, shook his head, listened attentively, climbed a ladder, and came back with a couple recommendations. Which were awesome! I had many beers that night, somehow only spent like $25, got drunk, and no longer felt out of it. 

Or rather, I DID feel out of it. But in a good way.

Unfortunately I can't remember what kind of beer it was that he recommended.

But I CAN remember that this place is not really douchey.
author: Lisa T.

description: Very cool spot, gets crackin after 5pm almost every day. The bartenders are all pretty cool and the prices are somewhat reasonable- they do not serve food here!
author: Chris R.

description:
A couple friends and I threw a party here on a Saturday night last month.  It was a going away party with roughly 125+ people coming in and out between 8pm - 2am. We arrived right before 8 to set everything up. 83 Proof provided us with 2 bartenders for the night and we paid the extra $100 to have a cocktail waitress for the small area upstairs. This ended up being an absolute must as people were waiting for drinks.  

We were able to get a projector and screen at the front and they had no problem with us setting that up. They also gave us a tall table toward the back to put some snacks on. I was appreciative they gave us these options with no problems and were really helpful setting up.

Originally a DJ was provided for the night, but two days before they called and canceled that. It was a little frustrating, but luckily we had a friend that agreed to set up that night and used the upstairs balcony area which was perfect! As long as the minimum is met you don't have to pay anything extra except for a tip if you decide to. So essentially you get the bar and service for free which is great. 

I would highly recommend 83 Proof for any bash you want to throw. The interior is clean, with comfy couches and nice tables along the wall. Great service and not too high of a minimum so its doable with a big group of friends... and what a motley crew we had!
author: Natalie N.

description:
Last night my co worker and I wanted to try a new bar so after we got done with our bar shift at Grand Pu Bah we packed in to our friends car and headed over.

When we first walked in we did know what to expect but what a great space on the edge of the financial district here in SF. We where greeted right away by the two guys behind the bar. We asked for a liquor menu since we noticed a lot of high end independent bottles of spirits. No menu but just ask and they know every bottle by heart.

I am as you know a Whisky lover and I came with the owner and a bartender from the Broken Record. 83 Proof has a great selection of small bottling of many Whiskies, as well as all the other spirits. We had the honer of Meeting Sky the owner and Roberto last night and they treated us great.

I would say the sound system in this bar is one of the best I have heard in the city and this place is lay-ed out very well. Plenty of room for you and your friends and a second floor balcony to watch what is going on.

I will be back!!!!!
author: don h.

description:
This place is hard to notice - I've been working adjacent to this place for the past few years and never noticed it even though I frequent the Walgreens next door during my lunches/ breaks. I likely never noticed it because there's no sign at the entrance and on this day that I strolled in, it was nice out and the front window was open.

Went here for happy hour and I'm so glad I read the yelp reviews first otherwise I would've never known to try the basil gimlet which is soooo delicious. The cucumber gimlet is also good. The drink prices are reasonable for being in the FiDi - I expected to pay at least $10 for a drink like this.

I'll definitely be back for a drink again - only downside is they don't serve any munchies and the music can be a bit loud. I had trouble hearing the person next to me talk.
author: Melissa P.

description:
Plain and simple, I love this place.  They know how to make a good drink, period.  Rye Manhattans, or Makers Manhattans are my poison there, and they are always far superior than any other I've been able to get my paws on.  It doesn't even matter much who makes them, they're always superb.  Mind numbingly delicious, really.  

For a drink after work, this place is tops.  They employees are friendly, and know how to work a bar.  They have hockey on the TV, there's a guy playing current rock tunes on the piano, and if you ask the bartenders nicely they will let you order pizza to be delivered to the bar.  What could be better?  Awesome I tell ya, but don't tell too many, cause it gets busy pretty early as it is.
author: Kelly K.

description:
Came here for happy hour after work.

Place is tiny and it often gets crowded.  Theres a small cute little spot with a couple of seats and a couch upstairs.

Mostly people just getting off of work here bartenders were friendly.  Got a captain and diet ($6), was alright, not too expensive.  LARGE selection of booze on the wall behind the bar.

Cute bartender with the tattoos was also a good plus.  I'd come back here again but I'd try and avoid the large crowds.
author: Kameron K.

description:
My coworkers and I were on a mission to branch out from the 2 bars within stumbling distance from work, so we wandered an additional 3 blocks. 

It must have been a successful happy hour! We missed it by 20 minutes!

Drunks #1 and #2:
Let's just say that #2 was getting more play than the sale peaches at Safeway. We soon found out that the reason was a special anise drink composed mainly of tequila/cinnamon/cherry liquor and "magic" as we were informed by number #1 when he paused from testing the produce for a moment.

Drunk #3:
Apparently I was holding my drink in a way that looked like it needed a clinking because he stumbled up and gave it a go before being apologetically ushered away by his friends. Cheers buddy!

My blueberry lemon drop was quite fancy with muddled blueberries. The bartenders are very talented with what you can come up with because they don't have a drink menu. A definite find and we might have been #4, #5, #6 and #7 when we left!
author: Eli B.

description: Yeah, I like it there, it is small though, second time we were there with several people, we could barely stand, so we went upstairs, standing. A large group left, so it was perfect to be able to sit. Nice happy hour drinks.
author: Yoko S.

description:
Simply put: I love 83 Proof.

I haven't been here in awhile because I've been out of town, but I plan on starting up my weekly tradition as soon as I return.

The location makes it easy to get to, the bartenders are all lovely -- fun, attentive, etc., the selection of wine, beer and liquor is extensive, and it's just damn classy.  I love it here.

If you're in the neighborhood, GO.  You won't be disappointed. :)
author: Seema S.

description:
Sky is a ridiculously beautiful man. 

83 proof is usually packed with the typical after work crowd. Friday nights are usually out of the question. If you're lucky, secure a table. If you're extra lucky or magically delicious, you may secure the upstairs area.

Personally, after a few glasses of wine, I like standing at the bar -- standing at the bar, not staring at the ridiculously good looking bartender/owner with the full sleeve.. Hello.
author: Donna H.

description:
So last saturday....I tried to be a club type girl and go to Roe with friends from work. 

Right when I was about to pay the cover, I suddenly remembered then on most occasions I hate clubs. So I turned to my two male partners in crime and asked them if they were down to leave. Both of their faces lit up and apparently they were also against the club scene. I then used my trusty yelp iPhone app to find 83 Proof. Not going to lie, it was about 11pm and we were all sketched out because all that was around was office buildings and the the area was desolate. Finally I spot the glow of lights coming from 83 Proof and I run across the street. And boy was I shocked as to what I found!!!! 

83 Proof is honestly one of the coolest bars I have ever been to. AMAZING selection at the bar. One of my friends is actually a bartender and he was astonished at both the selection and the care the bartenders had when mixing their drinks. These guys were so gracious and helpful. Also the prices are SOOO LOOWWW for SF. Its crazy, i believe our first round was two tequila shots of some specialty tequila, two gin martinis with some top shelf gin, and a beer. Total bill $40...I was so surprised I almost fell out of my bar stool.

Tip: Order a French 75 and enjoy life!
author: Ashley S.

description:
Chrysantha: "Excuse Mister Bartender, my girlfriend just broke up with her man and my goal tonight is to get her drunk and over... Suggest any drinks?"

Bartender in Cool Black Shirt: "Yeah, then we'd have to use 
something with Tequila."

Chrysantha: "NICE! Just make sure it tastes good so she can't taste the alcohol!"

Bartender in Cool Black Shirt: "Don't worry, do you want it fruity?"

Chrysantha: "Yeah, maybe citrusee..."

Bartender in Cool Black Shirt: "Coming right up (with a smile)."

... 5 minutes later

Chrysantha: "So does this drink have a name?  Because I want to name it Heartbreaker!"

Bartender in Cool Black Shirt: "ah, Heartbreaker! Sounds perfect to me"


AND DAYAMN, that drink was goooood!


He also made me a yummy blueberry mojito, lemon drop, and hurricane!  Great Bar in the heart of SOMA! Mosdefinitely recommended!
author: Chrysantha C.

description:
83 proof is awesome! Patricia P rented out the mezzanine for her "P" themed birthday party and it was a total success.  Her party overtook the entire bar, but it was nice to have the upstairs level to ourselves to dance, lounge on the sofas, and mingle with people.  

I love the atmosphere of this place. It's pretty relaxed / chill and seems to be a big hit for Happy Hour by the SoMa crowd.  I actually want to start coming here on Friday or Saturday nights at it won't be sooo crowded and annoying like most other bars.

The bartenders are super friendly and attentive as well.  The night we came, they had a bartender out sick, but the service was still impeccable and great.  The drinks are strong and cheap too. I;m pretty sure a Greyhound only costs $5. 

Props to Sky, the owner, for keeping things running smoothly for the entire evening.  The birthday party was a huge success, so thank you 83 Proof. Can't wait to come back!!
author: Jenny W.

description:
Hidden among the gray giants of SOMA, 83 Proof brings color to a neighborhood desperately seeking a sense of weekend culture.

I arrived here for Patty P's birthday, and was immediately impressed with the venue. Intimate, but spacious enough to mingle, and the vibe woke you up.

The hardwood floors leave the remnants of a bustling work week energy, but the shining bar and upbeat bartenders bring out the party.

The cocktails ranged in color and twist, each having it's own distinct flavor for life. Multiple beers on tap, so when it came to the river of fun juice, there was plenty to choose from.

The upstairs houses a great room for private parties and a nice balcony to gaze over the patrons below.

83 Proof is a great find in SOMA, and a perfect place to ease the strain of the work day. So when the feet are done walking, and the day is in need of a buzz cool down, make your way here, and press erase on the brain.
author: Mike K.

description:
I'm really digging this bar.  

Older friendly working crowd.  

Cheap drinks.

Lovely place to kick off the weekend.
author: Jenny H.

description:
My commute involves the transbay terminal, so I have to admit that some of the reason that I come here is that it's conveniently located.  But even if it was out of my way, I would still come here.  

The main attractions for me are the bartending skill and sheer numerosity of alcohols.  I've ended up talking to Sky the last couple of times I've been here -- youngish bartender, fully tatooed arms -- and just started telling him to make me something random.  This evening I got a pisco-campari-lime cocktail and a jalepeno-lemon-rum cocktail.   Both were super-interesting and well balanced.  There is no menu and no names for them since they like improvising for what each customer wants.  The decor is classy but understated (in a good way).  There is often a piano player, which is also awesome.

The one problem with 83 proof is its own success: it gets crazy crowded and loud from the FiDi happy hour set.  So not someplace I'd choose Thursday through Saturday, between 5-8pm.  But for other times the crowd seems reasonable and the bar staff has time to do what they do well.
author: Joseph M.

description: I was here with some coworkers after work. The space is long and narrow so it gets crowded and feels crowded rather easily. The service was good considering the large after-work crowd. I was really impressed that when I ordered a sweet tea drink the bartender took on the challenge and made one (delicious!!) even though they don't usually make them. Other places just say they don't make something that that's the end of it.
author: Daisy S.

description:
I don't know why I haven't said anything about this place before. I must have amnesia the next day after I come here! That's it, I get it now. Well, $4 cocktails and $3 drafts will do that to you, you know! But because I only had one drink this time around (yawn) I remember clearly where I've been - 83 Proof. 

Happy Hour starts at the right time! The crowd is typical downtown work-horses trying to forget they are work-horses (I, most definitely, fall into that category). I also find that the best days to be there after work are Wednesdays and Thursdays. Fridays get over-crowded and many special events take place on the Mezzanine level - it gets too loud.

So, before I forget about it again, the recap. This place is very cozy and inviting, albeit being really crowded sometimes. I love the food, the drinks (Basil Gimlet, damn!), the bartender attitude, everything. Come here with friends after work or rent the whole bar (or the Mezzanine) for a private party. 

Bonus: Walgreen's is right at the corner (a minute of crawling) for some Alka-Seltzer and Aspirin.
author: Tatyana S.

description: A friend's going away party consisted of renting out 83 Proof on a Saturday night. It was swank and clean, the crowd was right (maybe because it was mostly Googlers), and I can't rave enough about how it's so easy to find your place in 83 Proof. There are plenty of spaces at the bar, at tables, upstairs on a couch or standing at the top taking in the view from the mezzanine. You can also perch by the big open window next to the door, or on the windowsill on a warm summer night. The drinks were good and the bathrooms were clean. Understated elegance is 83 Proof's middle name.
author: Angie C.

description: This place is amazing! Been here only once and for new years, so this is a pretty late post. From outside it looks like it would be a super expensive bar, but the prices are very reasonable. Its a fairly large place, they have a second story so when we went there for new years it wasn't that stuffy. People were scattered all around the place and we found seating very easily. The bartenders are very friendly and very quick. I order a drink and i get it right away. Overall this might be a place i might go to again for New Years. Maybe a downside is that from what i saw they only had one tv and it wasnt that big, but you dont go there to watch tv, you go there to drink and have fun. The atmosphere is amazing!
author: Avi W.

description:
Thank you so much bad date for exposing me to this lovely little slice of bar heaven!!  So long story short this man who literally keep booking a date and canceling finally graced me with his presence and choose this place to meet.  

If the great valet parking dude didn't tell me where to look I think I may have walked right by, but nestled in between the Walgreen's and some other building is 83 Proof.  As soon as you open the door it feels like you have left the busy financial district and are in a very nice, clean and beautifully designed bar.  It has a balcony (which my bad date was in) and you can overlook the whole bar.  And - as I just realized before reviewing this place my Yelp friend Patricia P. had her b-day party there - sorry Patty I missed the P party...she rented out this balcony area.  Great place to have a happy hour or a party for sure!

The drinks were very good - and strong I might add.  Ah bad dates...thank you thank you for showing me this new spot I will be back here for sure!!  Very nice spot to share a drink or throw a b-day party!  Check this place out for sure!
author: Heidi S.

description:
5 stars ONLY if this is what you're looking for:

Bar
Alcohol
Happy Hour
Fast Bartenders
Lots and lots of People

If you want anything more than this, than 3 stars might be more appropriate.  Expect standing room only.  Expect Heineken to flow freely.  Expect concrete floors.  Expect simplicity.

As for me - need nothing more than what they offer.
author: Susan L.

description: Can't beat the early happy hour prices and casual setting here. Easily becoming one of my fav low key places in the city.
author: Scott C.

description: Pretty standard after-work place, with the usual downtown working crowd (not very young). Happy hour drinks are pretty cheap ($3 drafts, $4 well drinks), and it's a pretty nice looking place, so I'm a fan. Getting a seat can be tough, so be prepared to stand. The bartender was very friendly, so that was a plus.
author: Louis D.

description:
I love this little place.

The bartenders are all really cool...and there's even a drink named after me called "the jasmyne" made by Mark, or Mike...it was too late in the evening to be learning names (had too many Jasmynes by then)...I should have asked upon entry haha...

I like how on warmer evenings they can open the front window and let the inside out and the outside in.  The only caveat...it lets too much cigarette smoke in (especially if you are sitting right there)  Maybe they can ask people to step a little further down the street (speaking of which..aren't you supposed to be a certain number of feet from the entrance?).  

Very nondescript front/area (you could easily walk or drive past this place while looking for it) but once you find it...it's like a little hidden treasure.  It has a lofty upstairs area ...great for small parties with clean bathrooms and tables (along with stools at the bar) for seating.  The decor is naturals and dark woods and the music is lovely.  I would be a "regular" at this bar if I lived/worked near.

Great meetup bar...if there is a DYL here (and I'm gonna recommend it!)...I will DEFINITELY be there!
author: Jass M. B.

description: I have friends who swear by this place but I've always just found it so-so. The bartenders are nice and the drinks are solid but the narrow space gets crowded and makes it hard to move around or get drinks. Still, it's close to home and it's one of the better bars in the area so I find myself coming back from time to time.
author: Cristofer P.

description: Really enjoy this place!! I'm not a huge fan of the bars in this area, but this is a cute spot that seems to be able to hold a ton of people despite it's small space. It's nice and clean and at some point or another you can snag a seat at the bar or a side table to catch up with friends without having to scream too much. What I like best about this place are the drinks -- perfect place if you're looking for a good cocktail. The bartenders are awesome -- they'll whip up different concoctions if you tell them what you like. Or, if you want to be safe, the blueberry basil gimlet has been my favorite -- fruity and fresh, sweet but not too sweet, not syrupy or heavy at all (thanks Yelp! for the rec). The cucumber gimlet is also good and probably a better option if you prefer something less sweet and that packs a little more punch (or my bartender was just more generous with that specific pour). Great experience for happy hours on Thursday and Fridays that I've been here -- would highly recommend checking it out.
author: Shirley L.

description: 83 Proof is the best place for cocktails.  Bartenders are geniuses, prices are reasonable, and the patrons are great.  I love this place!
author: John T.

description:
Great people behind the bar. Know how to run a good busy happy hour. The crowd on the customer side of the bar is a bit thick with with business gudgers, but sometimes if you walk all the way back you can find an empty stool behind a group of beer swilling manager types spouting their tales of sales bravado or whatever the hell it is those in the starched shirts are talking about. If I can get a seat, I'll stick around. 

They did a really nice job with the place.
author: Jason G.

description: Nice place, cool staff, weakish drinks.
author: Missy B.

description: I walk past 83 Proof once or twice every Monday through Friday....and I have been set on going since I started working nearby. Every time I walk past it looks lively and everyone seems like they are having an awesome time with their awesome friends and enjoying awesome drinks. Unfortunately when I finally tried it....it was not so awesome. It's not a bad bar, but looks can be deceiving. I expected much more, but it's just a bar.
author: Christine A.

description:
Look everybody, I made a rare SF appearance. I made an even rarer driving-a-stick-through-SF appearance. Long story.

Pretty sweet set-up. Dim enough to make everyone look good. I may have gone on an off-night; but it didn't seem douchey and meat-marketey. Warriors game was on the tv. Clean bathrooms. Not good for large groups unless you can get the upstairs. I didn't drink last night (hung over) but the bartender was undouchey and he didn't charge me for anything. HOWEVER, now that I saw how close it was to the Transbay bus terminal....I see grown-up drinks from here in the very near future.
author: Zulu Q.

description: Great place to go after work!  One of the best selections of whiskeys I've seen anywhere.  The bartenders are friendly and make excellent cocktails.  The Manhattan and Basil Gimlet were especially great.
author: Vince F.

description:
This is one of my favorite happy hour locations in the financial district for the following reasons:

a) It's not overly expensive.  Can get a decent buzz on without emptying out your wallet.

b) It's less than a block from my office.  SCORE.

c) It doesn't come with the normal, pretentious financial district crowd that seems to frequent the bars in the area (i.e. Americano).

d) On evenings they open up the huge window in the front & my favorite place to perch is right by the window.  Nice breeze, do some people watching, perfect.

e) Great upstairs lounge-y area that (if you're lucky enough to snag a seat) gets you away from the crowds of the downstairs.

Love this place!  And they're having an awesome "Pig & Swig" event this weekend!  I've gots to go.
author: Jenna H.

description:
83 Proof is easily the best thing to be sandwiched between a Wachovia and a Walgreens.  

It's my pick of the week.  I went on a Saturday for a friends birthday and have never had a weekend drinking experience in the FiDi (OK they want to be called "SOMA" but that doesn't happen on 1st Street) that matches this one.  I'm already planning to go back to see what it's like during the week. 

The bar is beautiful. Lot's of cream, gold tones, and dark wood. 

At first i was skeptical.  I arrived before everyone else and the vodka tonic I ordered would be considered pretty weak by Castro Standards.  But as friends started arriving, the bar tenders (and there were two even though Saturday at 1st and Mission was a predictably slow night) really got a chance to shine.  They made the best Manhattans, and were great about asking questions and making recommendations.

AND -- To top it all off, they let us rearrange the tables to accommodate our big group!  Winners!
author: Luke M.

description:
Last night, I spent many an hour at 83 Proof. Now, I don't normally find myself in the FiDi for happy hour. I don't work down there, and I don't like making my way there during rush hour, but last night, my good friend Pam B. was trying to get through a tough day, so I obliged.

It's kind of a random spot. 83 First St. Weird. But it turned into random fun.

So, a bunch of yelpers were there. It was fun shooting the breeze and whatnot for happy hour ($2 Heinekens, although I don't drink that skunky beer). Stellas were $4. Not bad. The downstairs is filled with hot men and their butterface dates. The upstairs is filled with HEAT. Seriously, so ridiculously hot up there. Don't do it unless you're wearing a tube top.

Ran into my ex and another sort of ex's best friend there last night. I never go there, how weird was that! 

Good times, but not worth making the effort unless someone is upset, trying to get over something, and makes a date at 83 Proof.
author: Rachel F.

description:
My new after work happy hour spot if I can get off work early enough to secure a table. Like most jivin' bars in the FiDi, this place is inundated with white collar from 6 to 8PM. Not very suprising considering drinks are dirt cheap during happy hour.

I've also been here on a weekday, later in the night, around 10 PM or so. As the masses begin to leave and the chaos wanes down, it begins to feel more like a winter log cabin. The dim candle lighting creates the image of slender flames licking away from the fireplace.  At this point, a warm sensation begins to emanate from within... must be the whiskey.
author: Edward Y.

description: 83 Proof....AMAZING!  The drinks are unique and as good as it gets.  The basil gimlet is a staple here and it's so light and refreshing.  The staff are extremely friendly and if you don't know what you want to drink...trust me, they'll make you something terrific and pleasing to your palate.  They carry all the good stuff...whiskeys you've never heard of!  I love the modesty of the establishment and how 83 Proof isn't largely plastered in front of the place.  If you're ever close to 1st and Mission, drop by and have 'em make you a drink; you'll be pleased!
author: Janet C.

description:
A-OK is exactly what I felt of this place.

Had the basil gimlet after reading all these bomb reviews- it was good, not the best.  Also felt that happy hour drink prices were not very happy.

I like the crowd- chill vibe amongst good looking young professionals.  Definitely over packed and very tough to maneuver.  I constantly felt like I was in someone's way...

Get there early and stake a corner for a thoroughly happy happy hour.
author: Gabrielle J.

description:
If you have seen my previous reviews, you know that I have a love/hate relationship with tequila.  I love it, I really do, but it makes me a little cranky and frankly really stupid.  I tend to make some of my most heinous decisions while basking in the warm cushy glow of tequila, like hanging up on people for no good reason, crying to strangers, and trying to jump on the back of moving cars.  Seriously.

Last night, when I was waiting FOREVER for Nicole to show up for her office hours (just kidding, I was early), I got a margarita, because it's what sounded good.  It's like a brazilian wax, you forget how much it hurts until you do it over again- such is my relationship with tequila.  Okay, that bartender clearly didn't know that when it comes to my margaritas, anything more than a 1 oz pour will probably be too much for me.  So he poured...and poured...and poured.  I really do respect the fine craftsmanship of my drink (half a glass of tequila, triple sec, 2 lime squeezes and agave nectar, with a float of Grand Marnier), but man that sucker was STRONG.  And it was only $8.  Which may seem expensive to some (cheap asses), but for the amount that went in and the location of the bar, it was extremely reasonable.  Suffice it to say that I switched to some rum lime rickey/fizz thing later, because I wanted to avoid any major embarassment (although I was a champ at the minor).

I love love love the decor of this place, and their booze selection wows even me (when you work at a casino, you see more booze than you ever thought possible).  There were also some really hot guys there who somehow failed to notice my super hot red shoes.  How, I don't know, but when I'm in the mood for some banker love, I'm coming here.

Next time I'm taking over the upstairs, though.  Don't want to leave the poor Angelo all by himself again!
author: Pam S.

description:
3.5 stars rounded up to 4 because of the possibility of maybe catching someone playing the piano.  Which I haven't ever witnessed the last 2 times I have gone to 83 Proof.

Location, Location, Location.  3 things to keep in mind when trying to please Kelly H.  This place is no more than 30 paces from my place of work.  It is hard to find - there is really only an 83 next to the door.  Just perfect in my opinion.  Maybe the best idea I've ever had was last Friday - I talked two co-workers into going here for a 3pm shot and a beer.  After all, it was Friday and LEAP DAY or whatever and needed to be celebrated.  Turns out it is a great idea, but you've got to have everything at work finished and your boss has to have taken off early as well.

Fine selection of Whiskeys, and knowledgeable staff.  Mostly wooded interior which makes for a cozy feel.  The second floor is good if you want to actually talk to someone during a happy hour.  It was empty up there on a Tuesday night - while the main floor was pretty crowded as it is a pretty narrow space.  I think this bar is worth a 3 city-block walk.
author: Kelly H.

description:
This is the type of place I'd like to wander in on a random weeknight not beginning with the letter "F." 

On the random weeknight that DOES begin with the letter "F," 83 Proof is "F"ing packed with the FiDi crowd. I'd have to go with friends to be comfortable in that situation again. Due to the layout of the space, patrons are attached to either the bar [whether ordering drinks or not] or the few tables along the wall. If you're lucky, the upstairs area will be open to take on some of the overflow. The rest of the bar downstairs is a walkway. You'll want to pull your hair out and shout, ~"F"ing H-E-double hockey sticks, get out of my way!~ as you maneuver through the crowds, scoping out an open spot at the bar. Fortunately, once you've attached yourself to the bar and waved a bartender down, they are fast. Fast and friendly. Gotta love that.

And for that one random weeknight that begins with the letter "F," I would like to echo another reviewer in saying that fans [the blowing, mechanical kind] would be appreciated. Way too much body heat in one spot and not enough circulation. It would certainly boost my review from 4 to 4.5 [or 5]. 

It seems to be a good spot for catching a breath mid-week, possibly alone or with a companion. A nice, inconspicuous, spot just steps away from the office. I'll be back soon for the tasty drinks, etc. 

Is it really open from 2pm? Half day, anyone?
author: Tinna H.

description:
It's good that the spray paint is gone, the door is refinished, and the business is open.  

No sign, no problem!  At Friday afternoon happy hour the place was packed.  In the back it was hot and there was no space between the patrons, but in the front, by the open window, it was cooler and there was enough space to move around.  

The room was light, with two Venetian chandeliers hung high overhead.  The bar appeared to have a large selection of Scotch, but I was ordering rum and Coke for $4 a glass.  

Three bartenders were there to handle the high volume, and another person made sure the used glasses got back to the bar in time to keep the juice flowing.  

Speaking of volume, did you know there is a level at which sound becomes physically painful?  Yes, I found my level here.
author: David D.

description:
This is review is dedicated to my good friend Sasha. He has been a fantastic partner in crime through many crazy adventures...... from drunk talks about quantum physics till 3am, drama with psycho Ex'es (his),  karaoke soirees, gin-filled nights at his "penthouse" and a many other random things I will just keep to myself... TODAY is his birthday so HAPPY 30th BIRTHDAY SASHA!

keeping with the whole birthday theme.... 83 Proof is where I spent MY birthday just a few weeks ago. I didn't choose to come here.... but this year I just wanted to do something totally different than last years drunk mess with too many people, too many venues and not enough Miette cupcakes.

Like clockwork it always rains on my birthday and this year was no exception. So I decided I just wanted to do low-key cocktails with the date of my choice. Then as I sat there I thought to myself... why do I have to choose just 1 date? Can't I have 2 dates? Fuck yeah, its my birthday and I will have 2 dates if I want to..... and these were not just any dates, i had HOT dates. Every girls fantasy.
