We rolled in looking glamorous and fabulous. I'm quite certain there was this glow permeating off us like a halo, because we looked just that good. The crowed parted as we walked in mouths opened in awe.... ok maybe not exactly like that but that's how I'm going to remember it because it was my f'ing birthday. Anyway, we gazed around and I liked the look of things. 

the place is still so new they weren't even done with one section up by the front window. I saw the mezzanine area above but opted for the bar stool in the center of the room. of course.

We ordered drinks and the partying began.... Such a fun happy place. Turns out the guy next to us was also celebrating his birthday although he was way past drunk by this point and his girlfriend didn't seem overly happy that he wanted to join my birthday instead of his group 4 stools down. 

One of the best parts of the night was our bartender.... Ah, the dear Sky. Who doesnt' love him? The pretty boy-next-door type and one of the nicest people you'll ever met. turns out Sky is in fact straight because yes, some drunk girl asked. He made me a very special drink which i can only describe as "wildly complicated and potent". he also seemed to have a knack for conversation because later that night I realized he had a whole crowd was around him (us included) just to hear what he would say next. The night went by so fast I was almost sad to leave. Drunk, but a bit down it was over..... until next year that is.

Great new SOMA bar, I can't wait to come back and see what Sky has to say next : )
author: Michelle I.

description:
I like 83 Proof.  The last time I was in here, it was a Friday, and it was crowded and busy, and it was hard to get the bartenders' attention to buy a drink, and I think that gave me a false first impression.  The decor is nice.  The bartenders are super friendly and attentive.  The seating is comfortable (the older I get, the more I care . . .).  The drinks are well made.  Best of all, it's one block from my office.  

It was a 5-star experience drinking and chatting with some of my favorite yelpers on a Monday night, but I'm dinging them one star for not offering Trumer, which is the ultimate beer of choice on my Think Globally Drink Locally program . . .
author: Joe C.

description:
Leave it to Nish N to turn me onto yet another awesome bar in this city. I swear, he is the man, the myth and the legend!

So on my first day in the SF Yelp offices Nishy and Michael E decided to take "the new girl" (can you still be new after almost 2 years with the company?) out for a drink...or 4...and 83 Proof was the spot they chose. When we walked in it was kinda dead seeing as it was just as work was letting out, but within an hour this place got packed with a good variety of afterworkers in need of a little liquid relief.

Mine came in the form of my new fave vodka; Effin Cherry and soda with two limes. Yum!! Refreshing and tasty. I foresee many an afterwork cocktai....I mean, meeting here, yeah yeah, that's the ticket ;)
author: Stephy S.

description:
83 Proof proves to be a winner!

Aside from being just 1/4 block from my office, this place kicks FiDi ass. So I have been here 4 times already and every time their customer service is pretty top notch. 

* Quick bartenders w/ good knowledge of their spirits keep mine pretty high after a grueling day in the office. 
* The balcony overlooks the busy bar below and would be awesome for some people watching. The place has comfy leather couches up there, BUT  you have to be there REAL early on a Friday to snag those. 
* As I haven't drank alcohol in over 60 days, I can't comment on the drinks but they look good. I think my friend ordered a cab for $9. 

I have got two suggestions:
* More female bartenders.....as much as I like the guys there...a little eye candy wouldn't hurt. Hetero eye candy I mean. 
* I don't know if its possible but maybe provider more seating downstairs. The place gets elbow to elbow on a Friday. 

Overall, this is one FiDi bar that I frequent a whole lot....me and my friend will possibly hold a private event in the loft soon.
author: Angelo F.

description: I threw my husband's birthday party here a couple months back and I would definitely do it again.  I reserved the upstairs lounge for our party of 25 or so which was perfect for the amount of guests we had.  I was also able to bring appetizers and cupcakes for everyone.  83 Proof was super friendly, accomodating and the drinks were pouring!  Everything was easy to set up through e-mail with Nika and by the time we arrived, the upstairs was ready for us and a table was setup for the food we brought.  We easily met the bar minimum and everyone just had a grand ole time!  This is a no hassle kind of bar to throw a nice party and it's a great venue.
author: Michelle D.

description:
Years ago, this spot was really sketchy -- we're talking yellow police tape sketchy -- and the space was abandoned for a long time. Today, it's turned into quite the opposite. This spot is shiny and new, with a cool vibe that's great for an after work happy hour or after dinner drinks. 

At around 6pm, the spot was already filling up with FiDites and SOMAns looking to unwind after a long day at the office. Our group took over the mezzanine area, which had plenty of seating and was a great spot to have some more privacy and people watch the crowd below. 

I was pleasantly surprised to see that they serve Yamazaki Whiskey -- I haven't seen any other place in SOMA other than NIHON that has it. Their bar menu is quite eclectic, and their bartenders are great at keeping everyone happily quneched. A great addition to the neighborhood!
author: Connie C.

description: Like this place a lot. Bartenders are super respectful, both to their customers and to the cocktails they serve.
author: dan t.

description:
Because my boyfriend is codependent and all of my friends are enablers, I ended up here way past my bedtime last night. Am I hurting this morning? Surely. Was it worth it? Absolutely. I am in love with Mark the bartender who generously did shots of tequila with me and helped a friend arrange to set up credit drinks for a friend of hers who works in an office above the bar. Talk about service!  

The space is minimalist with a very high ceiling and a long, narrow bar area that seems to stay pretty packed. There's only one restroom for the ladies, but that's not a problem since this is a fairly man-heavy bar (girls, take note!). The crowd is completely un-chodelike and actually very friendly. There's a mezzanine level that I cant' wait to rent out for my engagement party (surprise, honey!). Ok, I'm not actually getting married but I will actually be back here very soon.
author: Autumn K.

description:
I guess we're keeping with the "I'm oblivious" theme because this is another place I didn't know existed, even though I work very close to it. I have walked by it multiple times - and I'm a drunk - so you'd think I'd notice a thing like a bar. Especially since I'm always looking for a place to go after work - not that I go out all the time after work (or even often) - I just want to have a bunch of places to choose from. 

One place to go with my girlfriends if they happen to be around.
One place to go with my coworkers if we're all going out.
One place to go with a coworker if he has dirt to tell me about the others. 
One place to go with a boy I would prefer not to be seen with for some reason or another. 

I need all of these places. And if 83 Proof ever fits one of those needs, I'll go back. But I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. Bartenders were friendly, drinks were ok, crowd was not annoying. 

If you see me in here with a guy - pretend you don't see us, ok?
author: Suge K.

description: Ever since John Colins moved to the Minna St, I've been looking for the replacement; casual - undercover - local bar feeling.  83 Proof it is!  If I was working in the city, I'd prolly be seen here happy houring all the time.
author: Jee C.

description: What a fun spot! Super packed for happy hour, but that's my fave kinda happy hour--poppin'! I had them customize a whiskey sour with fresh muddled blackberry's--and it was goooood! Kinda looked like a milkshake, haha, but it tasted supreme. Very loud, so not the best place to have an intimate conversation, but a fun after work mingling spot for friends and coworkers!
author: Shira O.

description:
*Added to the Grown & Sexy List*
This spot is "schmoove" 
Great for a date or a classy after work cocktail(or two, or three)
Nicole G organized a wonderful happy hour here Monday evening. This is a great location with close proximity to Bart and bus routes. I fell in l.o.v.e. with Jessica T's Gin Fizz and the bartender was kind enough to make the rummy version for me with Oronoco Rum. Yummy!
It's been soooo long since I've been out to a HH,  this was a great way to catch up with old friends. . . .
author: Kia B.

description: Could sitting staring adoringly at all the liquor in their bar. Great bartenders! Amazing drinks! Delicious bourbon concoctions! My dream!
author: Anna R.

description:
I'm guessing this place is called 83 Proof because that's the address....83 1st Street. Walking past this establishment, you can barely tell that its a bar or that its even open to the public. From the outside, it looks like its a closed private event with people just standing inside.

The drinks that we had here were nice and strong. The only drawback is that it gets extremely crowded (or at least it did the Thursday HH that we went). Luckily I was able to swoop on a table from a small group that was just leaving as we were arriving.

I'd come back again but only with a small group of maybe 4 people....and definitely would come out early to get a table.
author: Lester W.

description:
I was dragged to 83 Proof on a little pre-DYL reconnaissance mission with Autumn K., Matt R., Jason K. and Suge.  (Yeah, I name drop.  wha-wha?)  

Collecting intel is a serious business.  It takes a whiskey drink, it takes a sour drink, it takes a cider drink...

Luckily, my cohorts and I are professionals with insatiable gullets and fortified livers.  Bartender Mark is awesome.  He was affable and efficient on both Thursday night and Friday night.  However, the other Thursday night bartender was blind and glacial.  It practically took a choreographed musical number to get ice queen's attention and small talk seemed to physically pain her.  Maybe her cat died...I don't know.

83 Proof felt very Manhattan to me, in a good way that is.   Did I mention the Basil Gimlet?  Uh yeah,  I'll take another and another.  And they have Newcastle on tap- always a good thing.
author: R M.

description:
I'm not sure I wanna come back here. Let me tell you what happened to me.... 

Well, I walk in this place...nice looking bar, very nice decor, just to get a drink with my cousin. Well we go inside and sit at the bar. Unsure about what to drink, the bartender [Sky is his name] suggested that he make something up. He gives us this drink that tastes like a grapefruit juice with a kick [very tasty]. Here is where the problems start.

Two drinks later, I'm slurring my words. I don't like to slur; "S's" shouldn't have spit on them. Then by the 4rd drink, I started talking loud; as if everybody needed to hear my problems over the nice but subtle music being played. Then he hit us with a doozy; a shot of some tequila in a pretty blue bottle [taste like cognac; also tasty]. After that, I lost my ability to walk or think straight! 

So there you have it... in a matter of a little over 2 hours, and for very little money, I lost my speech, my hearing, and my ability to walk and think. 

If you want the same thing to happen to you, head into 83 proof, and you too can leave with the temporary feeling of being a babbling, stuttering, stumbling idiot. I'm going back next week; I LOVE THIS PLACE!!  Look for the address cause there is no sign out front.  Walk in, stumble out.

If I get pulled over, I'm definitely telling the cops I'm handicapped.
author: Wes O.

description:
83 proof can be a tough place to find, there are no outdoor signs.  Very few visual cues other than a large 83 outside the door.  If you didn't know the address of the place and didn't hear the boisterous crowd inside you might just walk past it unknowingly.

That being said there was plenty of parking on 1st Street even on Friday night which is a huge plus.  This makes it terribly convenient to not so subtly have a few drinks in the car from the flask before entering this lovely establishment.

Once inside I was amazed at the huge crowd of people inside, the place was packed (understandable for a Friday night).  The gents had dark slacks with pinstripes, and the ladies (many azns) were dressed all sophisticated.  Juxtapose that with an image of my business-casual-biotech-from-the-north-bay look, I was like a fish out of water.

Luckily for me, I was a bit drunk.. and therefore handsome and charming.  I wandered my way upstairs where a gang-load of yelp people were reveling in this weekly event they call a DYL.  The upstairs loft had a great view of the entire bar, and conjured up mental images of Orson Wells on top of the Ferris wheel in the Third Man.

After gorging myself on some kind of delicious cupcake, and accepting a free drink from Matt H.  I started getting into my rhythm of greyhounds, and cranberry vodkas.

At a point in the night the 4 bartenders became overwhelmed.  I got impatient after waiting 5 minutes for a drink, so I went outside, took 10 steps and was drinking from a flask in the car.  I keeps it real.

When I closed out my tab it came out to 14 dollars (???!).  Don't really know how that happened, but I'll take it.
author: Eric L.

description:
Going to see mfa! Woo!
This place is suprisingly classy.  The outisde really doesn't give you a clue as to what this joint is going to be like. They've got an upstairs with couches and tables and some pretty art on the walls, makes you feel like your in a forest. Downstairs they've got a decent selection of beers and other alcohols. While I was waiting to place my order, I saw the bartender putting together an interesting concoction- some kind of syrup, a shot of something, some juice,  and then a porter.  It looked darn tasty.  I asked him after I placed my order what it was that he was making, "A black heart, "he replied.  I told my friends about it and we all decided to get that as our next drink.  Soooo so good.  You honestly wouldn't need another drink after this, it's packs a silent punch.  If I lived in the city, I would defintiely hit this place up more.  As it is I think I'm going to plan a girls night pub crawl in the city pretty soon and this place is going to be on the list!
author: Colleen M.

description: I love this bar.  I've only been on Friday and Saturday nights, so I can't speak to the happy hour scene.  The bartenders are friendly, attentive, and creative with their cocktails.  I swear I've seen them spend 5 minutes making my drink... 5 minutes tasting and adjusting!  All you have to do is given them the vaguest parameters for a drink (ex. "I want something with whisky and fizz") and off they go!  I've never had a drink that wasn't surprising and tasty.  It's as good as Alembic, and probably better than Rye, but without the crowds.  Woohoo!
author: Charles C.

description:
I LOVE QUARTERSAWN WOOD. You could serve me watered down Boone's Farm and I'd tip like a mafia capo if your floors and bar were constructed from narrow, even grained planks with a nice patina on them.

I like hooks under the bar for my coat and bag, and tilted mirrors along the crown molding so I can look up and see myself in the third person.

Reasonably clean bathrooms and nicely appointed lofts are cool too.

I like friendly bartenders and expansive selections; around 20 bourbons and 30 scotches isn't bad at all.

Mostly though, I like places that are a short walk from my work so that come 5:15, I've already forgotten how miserable and inconsequential my office worker existence is.

This is why I love 83 Proof.
author: matthew r.

description:
My friends and I gathered at 83 Proof to celebrate J's getting fired on his last day of work. He had long hated his gig at X, and was looking forward to getting started at a proper news establishment.  We raised our glasses and cheered his ability to go out in a blaze of glory.

83 Proof was actually the perfect venue for the occasion.  We were able to take over the entire upstairs balcony and party, party, party.  Our bartender was super friendly and attentive (what, in San Francisco?), adding to the overall warm ambience.

Plus, my dirty martini was $5 and had three, yes three, lovely robust green olives.  'Nuff said.
author: Nicole G.

description:
Word on the street is that 83 Proof is a favorite spot for the Yelp crew (Hi Nish! Hi Jeremy!) and I can definitely see why. Our bartender made a mean basil gimlet, second only to the version made at Rye, and was quite friendly. I like friendly people.

As for the layout of the bar, I didn't make it up to the mezzanine but it looks tailor made for some debauchery (and I love me some debauchery) And the crowds that I kept reading about? Maybe it was an off night but we were able to grab some bar stools at 9pm without a problem. 

The only downfall to 83 Proof is that it isn't near my office. Wait, is Yelp hiring? Nish, you've got mail!
author: phil h.

description:
11/07/07 Update:
Went in for a quiet after-work drink yesterday, and the bar was just starting to get busy. Our bartender was attentive and ready to please, offering up some suggestions on what to try. We asked about street legal absinthe and he brought down a bottle for us to sample, on the house! One of the owners, Chris, was there as well, and you could tell he had a genuine passion for being behind the bar. You gotta like that kind of enthusiasm. See you there soon.

----

Original Post (11/05/07):
Another solid-looking addition to the SOMA neighborhood, making this area more of a nightlife destination than an after work after thought.

My colleague and I were on lunch break and happened to walk by when one of the builders (Eli) was putting some of the fiNishing touches on the interior. The place, he told us, is open for business,  but expect the full effect in about a week.

There's a long bar with plenty of side tables, suitable for mingling or meeting up with a few friends. The bar is well appointed and, judging from the breadth of booze on the shelves, ready to cater to the most libationally-savvy. It sounds like they'll be featuring choice cocktails and fresh ingredients, sort of like Bourbon & Branch or Rye.

Eli gave us a quick tour of the upstairs lounge, which offers a great view of the ground floor scene, and will be perfect for that VIP treatment when you need it. 

The whole place has a modern rustic feel to it, and I'm looking forward to the artwork and piano that will make it more so.
author: Nish N.

description:
This place reminds me of Mr. Smith's but smaller, which is good because I like Mr. Smith's and I like intimate venues. Unfortunately, I couldn't enjoy either of these aspects because the place becomes so ungodly crowded on Friday nights. While encased against the wall or caught in the tide human bodies I find myself a little lost. Attempting to catch up with a dozen old friends and acquiant myself two dozen new people left my as dazed as an over excited puppy. Where's my  basket for a nap?

At least in flurry of drink requests, I was able to get my liqour fairly quickly and without attitude (you could learn something here 540 Club.) Since many of my friends speak highly of this place on off peak nights I'll have to come back and see if I like it better then. It's worth a second go around.
author: Keith M.

description:
So I wandered in here yesterday, thinking I was going to see people I sorta kinda know somewhat but I blew it (it helps to pay attention to dates sometimes, heh)...it's alright though, I brought a newspaper with me and kept myself occupied while sipping on a gimlet.

Anyway, my original rating was probably a little inflated, but I'm glad to say it's still deserving of 5 stars.  The bartenders are really friendly and make excellent drinks, and it was relatively quiet with plenty of seating.  Not a bad place to spend a Monday happy hour.
author: Sus... B.

description:
My mojitio was not good.  I don't drink alchol usually, only when a mojitio is around.   I overheard someone else ordering one, and it made me SO happy.   So I ordered one, and my tastebuds were not happy.  Which meant my joy meter wasn't so high since liquor wasn't running thru my veins. 

The decor was nice, clean, sleek.  Bathrooms clean.  Whatever else doesn't matter to me.  As long as I have a good mojitio that really makes my night..  :( 

 I guess thats all I'd like to write about..
author: Alice E.

description: Came here to watch an amazing live acoustic performance by MUSIC for ANIMALS.   Drinks were FAB, bartenders excellent and overall a great sf experience.  As reported, you can tell them what kind of alcohol and flavors you're going for and theyll whip up something truly delicious. Will definitely be here more often.
author: Stefani M.

description: Didn't love it, didn't hate it...  It's got a cool feel to it, lotsa bottles of booze... they make drinks that are good and strong.  The problem  is they need another bartender working there... waited too damn long for my Saphire Martini... one bartender was working his ass off while the other was in second gear and seemed more concerned about his perfectly tossled hair than getting me a god damn drink.  The place is good until it gets too crowded... then its time to split.
author: Tom M.

description:
83 Proof is dope. Super cool bartenders and great top shelf liquor selection. Doesn't get super crowded either. The space is intimate while still accommodating a decent amount of people.

I got into a long conversation with one of the bartenders (maybe the owner?) about what kind of Belgian ale they should have on tap. I suggested Chimay and he was thinking Leffe. I told him I thought it would sell better and it probably would. But now I'm thinking about how I personally like Leffe better than Chimay... wish I hadn't said anything.

Anyway, the place is great and I'll be coming back.
author: Aaron V.

description:
Two words: Basil Gimlet

The last time I was here, I foolishly wasted my time on other drinks like a total newb, but thanks to D. Peezy I was enlightened. We tried the Cucumber Gimlet as well, which was pretty refreshing, but the obvious winner was still the basil. Be prepared for a slight wait though, because everyone and their mommas is ordering these labor intensive bad boys. I guess everyone got the memo because this place was packed on a Wed, and it's not hard to see why.
author: Irene B.

description:
Update: 3/27/2008

I had previously given this place 3 stars (read below) but the last couple of times I've gone it's been less crowded and therefore "more fun". Try to hit this place at off peak hours on a Thursday or Friday and I'm sure you'll have a good time. It's 5pm right now and I'm hoping to head over in a little bit :)

------------------------------

It is so obvious that this area of SOMA was in desperate need of a new happy hour option, this place is always packed for Friday happy hour. I've been here a few times and it is an "ok" place, my friends and I "tried" to go here last Friday but it was literally impossible to get a drink. This bar is going to have a tough time maintaining it's popularity if it doesn't solve the crowd flow problem.

They have a pretty mellow upstairs section and if you're early enough to get one of the tables you'll probably have a good time hanging out for a couple of hours (just remember to order several rounds when you finally manage to get the bartender to take your order).

I'll probably come here on a quiet weekday evening again but am very unlikely to suggest this place for a Friday happy hour again...it's just too stressful to deal with such a crowded place after a busy week.
author: Bryan B.

description:
Great liquor selection!  Wonderful, talented, bartenders!!

 And I am not just saying that because they pour heavy (but that doesn't hurt).

Pleasant environment - though I am not so sure about the wallpaper on the southern wall.......

All in all it is a fantastic addition to the neighborhood!
author: lisa g.

description:
I have an idea: lets do DYL in a narrow hallway with a loft.  Oh wait, Matt H. already thought of that.  (Sorry Matt, I was drankin' some hater-ade today).  I was also missing my wingman (Poochie M.) so mi corazon just wasn't in it.  

Anyways, the crew of 83 Proof did an outstanding job accommodating the Yelpers that came out in full force.  Nice bar, friendly bartenders, and good happy hour drink prices (cuz' this Alkie is on a budget).  If I didn't almost die of heat exhaustion, dehydration, and a pre-existing hangover I might have more to say.
author: Emily X.

description: Okay if cocktails and assertively drunk investment bankers are your thing (not mine). For godssake, Gimme something to look at on the walls when some dude tries to get all 'bro' on me!
author: Joel W.

description:
Haven't been here in years.

Still remember when it was a dive bar.

Good ambiance, bartenders, and drinks.
author: Francis M.

description: $3 pints during happy hour, and it's close to the Financial District.  As long as they keep that drink special, they could spit in my face and I'd come back for more.
author: Juan R.

description:
Apparently this place was "pretty dead" when we went on Friday after work...if it was dead I can't imagine how packed it is on busy nights.  

Even though it was super crowded, this place was really fun.  Good, cheap drinks, and the best part, no minimum charge for using a credit card!

All the other bar patrons were super friendly and definitely willing to help a girl get a drink.  I was trying to squeeze one more drink in before I left, but was afraid that with the line I wouldn't be able to get one in time.  Fortunately this awesome couple at the bar, could tell I needed some help.  They asked me my name and made a point to introduce me as their friend to the bartender.  No more waiting for me, I got my drink right away.  Thanks Darius and Jane, 5 stars for you two!

Come early as this place gets pretty crowded...stay late for the cheap drinks and good company.
author: Katherine C.

description:
This was a perfectly reasonable bar. It was a little cramped, and the drinks were a bit expensive. The upstairs is is fun but it was really really hot the night we were up there. 

If i was in the area again and needed a drink I'd probably come back.
author: Jake R.

description:
Great place to take a date.....if your date's a mime. Christ, TURN DOWN the goddamn music.

Nice space, good location for post-work drinks, nice upstairs area, good staff, good drinks, but seriously, I left here hoarse both times I've been.

The first night was after dinner at Town Hall and the bf and I were two of four patrons, so I thought the bartender was just rocking out. Same problem yesterday at a packed HH, though. I hate being THAT woman. The "we just want someplace quiet so we can talk and catch up" woman. 83 Proof turns me into her. 

And you kids get off my lawn, too.
author: Leah S.

description: Good energy, nice mix of people and strong drinks make it a great place for happy hour.
author: Mimi T.

description: Never got a drink due to terrible understaffing (1 bartender to 40 patrons). Maybe next time.
author: G P.

description: I did a little yelp research before coming here. Noted was to order a basil gimlet and google earth this place b/c its a bit tough to spot at night. The gimlet was lovely and so was my friends manhattan. The bartender was friendly however it took 20 min to get his attention (it was a Friday night, not packed but steady busy and there were 2 of them). I would definitely come back but probably earlier in the night or for HH.
author: Loe B.

description:
I don't have unusually high standards to have a good time at a bar, yet why did it seem so much better at 83 Proof?

Of course your experience will mostly depend on your company - and there was good company. The drinks were delicious and not overpriced. The music was present but hardly too loud, so I could still hear everyone I was talking to.

My bartender was exceedingly nice, meaning prompt and efficient. He was also accommodating - I had only ordered one drink and he closed the tab on my credit card even though it was below the minimum. All without a fuss, nice.

Yep, nothing to complain about at all.
author: Ryan V.

description:
Ducked out of the wind for a pint of beer.  First Street is a long forlorn stretch at happy hour.  Couldn't make my way past the crowd of loud guys in suits and the occasional girl pretending to listen.  A guy could love this if he were 24 and an investment banker, lived in New York, and if it had some green tiffany lamps dimmed don, a maroon carpet, ancient wainscoting, out drunk with six Irish friends from high school.

Wrong crowd, wrong century, wrong continent, so I walked out and waited for my ride in the cold.

Came back a week later to find it mellow, nice music, cool bartenders.  So I'm adding a star.
author: Gil S.

description:
Let's play the math game!  Yay!

If there are about 1,200 square feet in this joint,
and the bar takes up about 300 sq feet
M/W bathrooms and stock room = 64 sq feet each
Stairs = about 48 sq feet
Add in chairs, tables, garbage cans: minus 100 sq feet
And a fat smelly guy standing in the isle that won't move: 10 sq feet.

That leaves 550 square feet for me to share with A BOoGLey-BaJILLioN investment bankers.  How much space does poor Mari C. occupy?








Plus one for having a loft so I can point out bald spots.
author: Mari C.

description:
I told them I'm going to Walgreens. I didn't tell them what looks like the back door of Walgreens actually leads to an amazing bar. 

This is by far one of my favorite places in San Francisco. You know a bar is truly a gem when it meets the needs of several purposes. The first time was for an undergrad related happy hour shindig. 83 proof provided a professional/chic/stylish waterhole minus the ever possible douche factor. On the second occasion, for an insane night of pub crawling, this place was dim, hip and flowing with plenty of reasonably priced beer. Even the meatier of heads with us did not complain. Lastly, for a chill night with friends, it was perfect for relaxing with a glass of wine and audible conversation.

Extra brownie points for the clean, clean bathrooms and chill bartenders (Scottie's a sweetheart). Don't forget to look underneath the bunny if you see him -- ha!
author: Wendy L.

description:
I waited on writing this review because my only (fuzzy) memories included feeling happy and at home here, and being surprised they didn't get upset when me and two friends sang "Deep in the Heart of Texas" at the bar while waiting for our drinks. I went a couple days ago and only have new fuzzy memories to add to my collection - but that's reason enough to give the bar a stellar recommendation.

83 Proof opened when I worked around the corner. A lot of my former co-workers are drink-happy regulars, so they knew and loved us, collectively. They're not open on Sundays, but they opened especially for one guy's 30th birthday bonanza. The drinks are stiff, it's got a quieter upstairs and the bathroom is very, very clean. So don't worry about hiking your good jeans away from a sticky floor, or getting used toilet paper stuck to your shoe. You ladies know what I'm talking about.

The bartender is nice and it has the vibe I generally look for in a bar - a place where you can laugh loudly, talk quietly, or observe the fray, casually perched on a (padded) bar stool sipping your Manhattan. Or your beer. Or both.

Near BART! But not near much else, unless you work near here, hang out at the Transbay Terminal or live in one of those fancy (ugly) new buildings.

I think they do have absinthe, as rumored, but black licorice isn't my bag.
author: Tara R.

description:
I've been here couple of times and its always bustling with people plus its quite small so it seems more so ..An ideal after-work spot to hang out with colleagues. They make really nice cosmos here..My first time here was crazy..I got super drunk and got sick and was quite obnoxious but the owner was exceptionally sweet (I dont remember a thing but got to know later)- Thanks Marc!! I really appreciate you being patient!!!

The drinks are priced quite cheap so as to suit one even better..Music 's really good to boot too.

My only regret: 
They have only pub mix to go with drinks and I HATE pub mix :( but that's okie I can live with it :)
author: Natasha I.

description:
Yeah, it's still 5  stars, but for a good reason.  A few weeks back, my then fiance and I mentioned to bartender Marc that we loved the bar and were hoping we could direct some of our wedding guests there for an unofficial after-party on a Saturday around midnight.  Note we asked him about this the week before the wedding. He immediately checked the calendar, gave us a tentative ok, and gave me the bar manager's contact info to get final a-ok.  The manager responded to my email in less than a day and we were on our way (no cost, just an ok that we could show up and purchase whatever booze we wanted).  Easy peasy, lemon squeezy.  And the 30 or so guests that made it over partied hard and loved the place.

Bonus points -- my girlfriend went in the other day and inquired about the sweet tea vodka when ordering her drink.  Marc asked if she happened to know me.  This is hilarious as I had only met Marc once a little over a month ago.  Awesome memory, man!
author: Deidre B.

description:
Love this place although it's a bit hard to find. I had to do a double take as I passed it up the first time. 

It's great for happy hour and inexpensive too. I went on a Monday and there was a pretty good crowd going on.
author: Milli A.

description:
I had heard tell of 83 Proof and I had passed it's faceless address several times, but never put 2 and 2 together. Not so good for a FiDi worker working on FiDi products at a FiDi corporation. Makes you wonder if I am really in the right trade.

This place could also be having something of an identity crisis too - is it a FiDi yuppie joint or is it a local neighbourhood bar? Looking at the crowd of after-FiDi workers and the extensive collection of delicious tequilas , you would first think it were the former - a yup joint. 

Fortunately (since none of the letters in "yuppie" any longer apply to me!), "the 32" also fits the "neighbourhood bar" description rather well - the staff are bend-over (!) backwards friendly, the beer is super-cold, and the prices are rather reasonable! 

I will be back for more, to be FiDi sure.
author: Kingpin X.

description:
Though it lacks the dark wood decor, this place reminds me a lot of Mr. I think it's because it has the same high ceiling, upstairs lounge set up. In either case I like this place. The service is good and the drinks are reasonably priced. It's got a good crowd. I usually come here a little after happy hour but I hear it gets pretty packed for HH. Which could be a pain to go to since the place is spacious enough when it's decently filled but can be a bit too narrow if it's packed.

Think the best thing I like here is the lighting. The decor is ok, not great but not bad, but what gives this place a good bar feel is the lighting. It's a dark place with chandelier lighting. Which makes this place have a really nice warm tone to it. Anyways, if you're in the area, or even if you aren't, check this place out at some point.
author: Shreya C.

description: Great bar. If you happen to be here when there is a live piano player - it's an even better bar. They make stellar mojito's and various other cocktails. It can get a bit loud in here, however. So if you are looking for a quite place to grab a drink, probably not the right spot.
author: David N.

description:
Okay, so the loss of the Extra Star is only due to the DJ, not the bar itself, but ya know, gotta leave room for improvement too.

Went for a themed B-day party and I have to say, the place itself was really nice! The drinks were how I like em, Fast and Hard (also, how I like my men)... but I digress... 

I plan on going back again, the crowd was really good and being so close to my bus stop, I can get my drink on and not have to drive home haha. 

Bex
author: B W.

description:
Sometimes the obvious becomes well..obvious only after it's staring you right in the face.

Like a cute little bar in an area that basically doesn't have any in a 1/2 mile radius about 3 to 4 blocks from downtown.  This has the bar culture vibe similar to Anu and Rye but is also very appealing to us working stiffs that aren't into the Americano scene every week either.  Funny, this place I thought sat empty for such a long time I thought but when I stepped in - it's obvious it was made for a cute little bar just like this!

Strangely friendly people too - I haven't been chatted up like that by service staff in I don't how long.. Great job!

UPDATE:  Came here to meet for drinks on my birthday and managed to score some seats on the upstairs terrain and the bartenders comped about 30 shots because they knew I was the 'Amanda H' yelper!! haha - Awesome and thank you!!
author: Yelper A.

description: Not bad.  Cool thing about this place is that it is unmarked--no signage.  You have to stumble upon it or have someone point it out to you.  Small space downstairs, with a few tables. Gets crowded fast.  Good beers on tap.  Upstairs mezzanine area provides a nice view of the bar area with room to lounge.  TV downstairs usually tuned to sports.  Suprisingly, a fairly even mix of guys and gals here.  Low key and laid back place to relax.
author: Ethan R.

description:
What a welcome change of pace. I came here on Nish's recommendation/invitation after escaping the wall-to-wall crowd at Harlot this past weekend. Good call, Nish, good call. 

What you want, baby, they got it: bourbon, Scotch, tequila, and they had Champagne, not just sparkling wine. The thing that impressed me most was that there was a solid selection at reasonable prices. The bartender was attentive and friendly. At the end of the evening, a number of restaurant industry people strolled in: always a good sign.
author: Pamela B.

description:
it was fun. went with a few friends, we had a blast laughing with the bartender! hahaha
i just remember singing 'The drinks are on me, the drinks are one me' which was a mistake LOL

Cool, calm and casual. It seemed like a great place to go and just relax. Have a couple sweet cold ones and get hammered.
I wish it were a little more trendy and a little more young, i felt a little awkward being surrounded by older corporate types. Only a bit handful of young kids like me there.
author: Mark R.

description: Nice, sleek, sophisticated, cozy bar.  Little upstairs place to hang out at too.  Perfect place for happy hours! However, if you're looking for a good place to conversate, this place is more on the loud side.  Friendly staff, good drinks! I tried the mojito and it was tasty! Perfect amount of lime and mint.... although some more alcohol wouldn't have hurt... LOL
author: Tramy V.

description: Small bar, nondescript from the outside.  The front door has an "83" on it, but that's about all you can see.  It's across the street from a Jack in the Box, just for reference.  Drinks here are pretty strong, I think.  Was pretty buzzed off of a Long Island (or maybe I'm just lightweight), and quite affordable to boot.  Bartenders are nice.  Bar is small.  Clean bathrooms.  There is also a small area upstairs to lounge around, but it is quite smalllllllll. Decent place to pregame with friends before going out to other places.
author: Patty O.

description: Best selection and knowledge of spirits I have found so far. They know how to mix a great drink if your drink needs mixing and the prices for the good stuff are very reasonable.
author: Dave H.

description:
What a great little bar in SF. I'm so glad I decided to research some bars around the hotel this past weekend...

83 proof has very nice bartenders, an impressive array of alcohol, cheap prices and even nice bathrooms.

It was walking distance from our hotel (hyatt embaracadero).
author: Steph C.

description:
One of the best brown liquor collections at a bar downtown!

The prices are reasonable and it's super convenience for a drink after work.  The staff is very attentive and friendly and the atmosphere is pretty cool for a bar downtown.

If you are into single malts, they should have something to quench your thirst.
author: Rod C.

description:
Came here for New Years.  It's a small joint, but comfortable enough, and the men's bathroom is sensible enough to have a urinal and a toilet.  -1 star for no walls on the toilet though, and oddly the men's line was backed up more than the women's.  

Bartenders were nice, and overall a bar with good decor.  I'd try coming here on a non-holiday sometime.
author: Phil L.

description:
This place is so new it still smells like fresh paint...Like everyone else has said, this place is nice, but of course it is, its NEW. I didn't have anything to drink here last night (I'll wait til you pick yourself off the floor & you never know, pigs may be flying somewhere right now), but friends drinks were poured heavy which is always a good sign, but then again they're NEW, and plus ALL bars should be pouring heavy.

To be honest I'm not sure what the hype is all about, yea its new, yea its nice, but something was missing and I'm not sure what it was. Could be the music they had playing.. it was loud enough to know something was playing but you couldn't figure out for the life of you what was playing or maybe its the color schemes they went with (beige walls, white ceiling) or maybe the lighting is off. Hell I don't know, but something was off (and yes it could be that I it was me not drinking). This place seems like a good place to go after work before heading home to get ready and start the night back up again. 

I'll definitely be heading back to see how this place transforms itself.
author: melissa g.

description: Stopped by here after work since it is so close to my office. The happy hour specials are $3-4 draft beers and $4 cocktails (gin/tonic, cranberry/vodka). A pretty cool spot since there are no signs (literally just "83" on the door)
author: Tif L.

description: Arguably the best happy hour in the Financial District, the drinks are cheap, the atmosphere is very lively, the crowd is awesome, and the bartenders are very quick to serve. For all those reasons, 83 Proof does get pretty packed so if you're planning on going and want a place to sit, get there like 5 minutes before 5p just to be safe. But once you're settled, you'll wish happy hour lasted all night. This is a great place to have a drink and relax with the coworkers/friends after a long day of work.
author: Anthony C.

description: Amazing HH and cute spot in FiD with liquor bottles aligned up against the wall. I recall $5 beers and $7 or $8 cucumber gimlets. So much better than overpriced so-called HH spots elsewhere. Though crowded, surprisingly not difficult to buy a drink or get a seat at the bar. The bartenders are really nice here. Ended up staying from 5-8 and had a great time. Wish there were hooks to hang up jackets and laptop bags!
author: Jeanne C.

description: I went back recently, and realized that getting there early and snagging a spot on the mezzanine makes all the difference. I love that they have Boont on tap, and the bartenders are really great. If you arrive after 5, be prepared to deal with the early-20s happy hour set.
author: sar h.

description: My favorite bar after work.  It's a small area but if you go early you can grab a couch upstairs and its a little more spacious or the front of the bar by the big windows, on a nice day they open the window.   There's a TV so yes.. boys you can watch your games. The bartender Mark that works there always surprises me with a special new drink.  I was feeling a little under the weather once and he made me a drink that he said was healthy... hey.. works for me.  Very friendly staff, I feel at home when i'm here.  Decent selection on beer happy ends at 7pm.  On Tuesday or Wednesday nights ( I can't remember which) they have a piano player which I adore.  Writing this review makes me want to be there now.. ugh... i drink too much.
author: Joanne W.

description:
My favorite part of coming to this bar is that I parked right in front of it. Sure, we got here around 8:45 on a Saturday night, but you can't beat that in this city. 

The bar was completely average in all respects. The decor was nothing to write home about, the drinks were fair-priced and tasted fine, the people were neither hot and sexy nor crazy and cool. There's nothing wrong with this place by any means... but there's nothing that makes me want to come back. 

One plus: I tried an Alameda mandarin-flavored vodka that was really scrumptious.
author: Jared S.

description:
Awesome new low-profile-entry bar, and I'm thankful for it.  Once this bar gets popular, I might have to re-review.  I'd like to know how many 3 star "meh" reviews of 83 Proof are due to "meh" company.  Come here with people you like.  If not, you stand the chance of ruining it for all of us.  From my experience, this place deserves a good review.

Upon location of the nondescript entryway, we walked into a den of business-casual happy hour goers.  The sea of midweek FiDi workers began to thin and part around 7ish, making way for the more substantial crowd of anchor dropping drinkers.  This is definitely a one-stop shop, lacking all the pretention of any other "hip new SOMA bar" and befitting for people who want to chill and have a drink for CHEAP at a "hip new SOMA bar" that this is.  The bartenders are at-ease and easily please with their large rocks glasses and heavy hands with the tall cocktails.  They're well-staffed behind the bar and also in-front-- i never had to look at an empty glass before me for more than 3 minutes.

I'm almost ashamed to mention I came in with a nose for negative judgement (per the many 3 star reviews) but the service and the whole experience changed my tune real quick.
author: Marjorie B.

description: Not bad - great drinks and good beer selection.  The place can get very crowded on Thurs. & Fri. nights.  Totally worth checking out the after work crowd here.
author: Lisa R.

description:
Does San Francisco really need another chic bar in SOMA?!  Well, needed or not - they have one...and it's a good'un!

As is typical in SF, the space is small...blame it on the high rent!  If you want a larger, roomier bar go to San Jose!  That being said, good vibe there.  Bartenders are quick and friendly, the lights are dimmed just enough to relax and enjoy the evening but not so much that you're wondering if the hand on your ass is that of your significant other or some psycho stalker (not that I errr, speak from experience...).

Clientele seems to be late 20's-mid 30 local crowd.  This place is inconspicuous enough that people aren't lined up out the door to get in - and thank God because there are few enough places you can go on a Friday night without being packed in like cattle.  Definitely a place to check out with a small group of friends or on a date...it's low key enough that you can hold a conversation without yelling over the crowd and/or music.
author: Melanie N.

description: This place is where I go to play the bartender's version of russian roulette.  You give them a liquor, any liquor, and they make a drink.  You might get something tasty and you might get something that makes you throw up in your mouth. If you say you'd like something with gin in it they will offer several kinds of gin and make you something tasty.  However, if you say you'd like to try a drink with butterscotch rum you'll probably end up with something that tastes like cough syrup and bitters.  So stop by 83 Proof, but order unknown drinks at your own risk.
author: Lara O.

description:
the dude and i were trying to kill time before meeting up with friends for dinner and stumbled upon this place for a quick drink. 

they had a wide array of beers on tap, but i had to settle with my go to  blue moon that was a mere 4 bucks!  the bartender was knowledgeable enough to offer the orange slices without me having to ask!

i'll definitely have to come back dring happy hour :)
author: Coriemae P.

description: Small place, but the bartenders are cool and the drinks are stiff =)  Great place to grab a drink after work.
author: Ed B.

description:
I went for the first time because it was a friend of a friend's birthday (and maybe a DYL as well?), and really liked the layout as soon as I walked in.  Bright, classy (maybe a bit art deco?), with a kind of balcony level with seating overlooking the bar.  We ordered Manhattans to start -- and wow!  Not only were they fantastic, but we caught the bartender furtively watching to see how we reacted to our first sips, and he gave us a questioning look until we gave him the thumbs up, which made him smile.  Yay for bartenders who care whether people like their drinks, even on a super-busy Friday night!

I can't remember everything I had or tried there, but I do remember being particularly impressed by the mojitos, and I have rather a high bar for mojitos.  A perfect balance of rum, sugar, lime, and super-fresh mint.  It was so good I had another. :)

We went again a few months later -- the mojitos were still super tasty, and when I was feeling uninspired by my usual go-to cocktails, the bartender was happy to take a stab at making me something fun and tasty based on a few well-chosen questions about my cocktail / spirits preferences.

Big fan.  Will be back, in spite of the fact that it's a non-insignificant BART ride away.
author: Angela B.

description:
Location...random

Space...love the upstairs lounge

Drinks...cheap and yummy

Music...a little on the downer side

Restrooms...clean

Bouncer...what bouncer?, excellent

Overall...I heart 83 Proof
author: Jen C.

description:
I work in SOMA and must've walked by this place several times without even noticing it... but finally went here last nite for a b-day party and we all had a great time, especially after scoring the balcony around 8PM.

Drinks are reasonably priced and the bartenders really surprised me! For the first time in a LONG LONG time I actually liked the mojito I sampled... 

It can get pretty crowded in there cuz the space is narrow (set up is similar to Dada's) but overall it's a good time and I'll go back when I'm in the mood for more cocktails.
author: Nenette Y.

description: Awesome liquor selection, very friendly knowledgeable bar tenders.  Unpretentious and elegant at once.  Avoid Friday happy hours, it's a MAD HOUSE AHHH!!!!  b.t.w. Mike rules
author: Peter N.

description:
It's not a bad little bar: tons of drinks, plenty of space, friendly staff.  

First time I went here, though, it was crazy crowded and the acoustics were ridic.  Last time it wasn't as nuts, and we all gathered near the seats alongside the windows.    

It's very convenient for after-work happy hours.
author: Charlotte M.

description: ok, I have to admit the Happy Hour is cheap for beer and regular drinks. However, it gets too crowded and very hard to move around in there. I am 6'2" and can barely get to the bar to order. Here's where the issue is, have you heard of the term Sausage Factory? well go there and you will know what I am talking about. if you are a guy and like girl scenery, good luck - the ratio is 25:2. Also, around 8:30 or 9pm at most, the palce is a ghost town. I would recommend this place just as a starting point, if you can reach the bar and order :-)... BTW, the bar tenders are neutral, like no personality
author: Tongue-Me e.

description: A new bar on the block.  Oooooh-aaaaaaaah.  But walk in and you'll realize that it looks exactly like any other bar in the city.  Deja vu!  What's different?  The fact you'll have to wait 20 to 30 minutes to get a drink at the bar - even AFTER engaging in full eye contact with the bar tender.  Yep, they're THAT busy.  The place is PACKED.  You literally have to swim through a sea of bodies.  Urgh.  After suffering through all this only to get a glass of the lackluster absinthe, I don't see any reason to return.
author: Kristen S.

description:
No sign on the door; check.

Sultry warm lighting, high ceilings and cozy interior; check.

Basil Gimlet = Fanfuckingtastic.
author: Sara H.

description: Seems like the only bar in Downtown SF that accepts credit card! Great bar tenders, great atmosphere and great drinks !
author: kelly t.

description: I threw a belated birthday shindig here over the weekend. Apparently, there was another birthday gathering happening on the same night so it got really packed as the night progressed. The bartenders here are very friendly. The interior is chic. If you claim the seating area upstairs early you can have a reasonable amount of people to sit with you. The drinks are poured quite strong and are very reasonably priced. It's pretty well tucked away so if you don't know where you're going, you might mistake this unmarked building as just another random place in the city. I had a good time here partying like a rock star and I'm pretty sure my friends did too. I will more than likely go back, hopefully, on a slower night when it's less packed.
author: Amy J.

description: When it comes to places to hang out, have great drink, listen to some cool music , catch up on some good times, work or chill with the lover,  I swear this is one of the best spots for it. 83 Proof is dope hands down. The staff is great, friendly and cool ass hell! They make wonderful drinks, and they never seems to cease to amaze me. I always tell my friends about this place and every since its opening I have been a supporter. The world famous Basil Gimlet is always on point also. As well as the traditional special shot that I and the bar tenders share when I frequent the spot.... I have had a couple of special celebrations there and What can I say, its always love. Even the customers whom frequent the place are always cool, kind and just laid back. I like it because its chill, there's never any issues, no problems and its too wild, just right!
author: Tony G.

description: Typical bar. Decent 30's-ish crowd, not horribly priced beers. Came here on a Friday with some guys on a friend's recommendation and it wasn't too crowded, which wasn't exactly what I was looking for that night but could be good another night.
author: Rachid G.

description:
Meh. Nothing that exciting other than it is new and so full of people checking out the latest bar in SOMA. First of all, we tried going there with this information: new bar called 83 Proof at 1st and Mission. Considering this place doesn't have a sign, that isn't enough info to find the place. We had to look up the address via blackberry, and then we found the door that simply had the address of "83".

Booze selection is pretty good, but not worth going out of your way for (unlike, say Alembic). I got a Sarditious martini, which I thought I really liked (at Alembic, at least) and was excited to see (a local gin that's *not* N.209), but maybe it was the vermouth, but I was not into it here. 

I know it is still a work in progress, but the place could use some more chairs and serve some snackies. I like having snackies with my martinis. And please put a sign up. Sign-less bars are lame.

And it should be better once the smell of floor varnish dissipates.
author: Lauren H.

description: My kind of bar.  Clean, swanky, modern with a variety of alcoholic choices to melt your day away.  Bartenders are cool and will happily create a drink for you given your choice of booze.  I can't remember mine except for the rum in it, but it was delicious and no, I didn't have too much.  Will be back!
author: Carmina B.

description:
This place is great for happy hours. Their dark wood decor and friendly bartenders make this place a popular hang out. You'll find most people at this place right after work... around 5ish. So if you are planning on a happy hour with your friends or colleagues, grab a table early! This place fills up, fast! 

Love their mojitos as the bartender/owner will custom make one for ya... to your liking! 

This place does not have AC in the summer months so it can get pretty warm. They open their oversized windows for you but plan ahead to be toasty in the summer months!
author: Eva Y.

description: hot dayum, Micheal knows how to make a good drink. I went here once before and it was meh. Last night it was perfect. Basil Gimlet? Awesome. Micheal? Perfect.
author: Gilbert B.

description:
I should put together a list of SOMA bars, considering I did happy hour all summer long at these spots, until my liver made "me bleed my own blood."

83 Proof is solid for a quick drink, they have the full range of hard liquors and it's not too crowded after work.  I think I'm getting old because I just stick with single-malt these days.  They have the big 4 brands, so rest assured that the liver will continue to be unhappy at 83 Proof.
author: E L.

description: My friend recommended this place to me...upon entering, I honestly thought it was a bit shady. The outside looked very ghetto, but as soon as u walk in, it's definitely an interesting feeling. It's VERY dimly lit, and sorta eerie in a way....but it's pretty cool. Reminds me of some ancient antique place. My favorite part of this bar is definitely the bar tenders. Michael, the bar tender of the night, was super nice and specially designed cocktails for us. My friend got a ginger drink and I got the cilantro berry, which was DELICIOUS. Drinks are $9 each, but with all the efforts that the bar tenders put in making the drink guaranteed satisfying for you...definitely worth it =)
author: Louisa L.

description: After searching for a place for drinks after a Monday-night dinner at Barbacco, we found 83 Proof on Yelp. We were surprised how clean it is here, and immediately noticed how friendly the bartenders are. Also surprised that there were so many people here on a Monday night. Great place to just hang out and enjoy the company you're with. Ordered a Basil Gimlet because I saw so many people mention it in their reviews (not knowing what a gimlet was). Slightly embarrassed to receive my drink in a dainty glass, but felt better after tasting how delicious it was and drinking it all up in just a few sips. Anyhow, they have a good whiskey selection and some good beers on tap. Would definitely come again if in the area.
author: Rob L.

description:
Hey, pretty cool spot, newly opened on 1st Street, which could certainly use a bar or two.  The bartenders are super nice and make a STRONG drink.  They have a huge selection of top level libations and it sounds like they will be putting together an interesting drink menu.  

Right now the place is a little stark - no artwork, the floor is partly unfinished, but the sound system is rocking, the lighting is flattering and the loft upstairs looks comfy and cozy.

And ladies - the place was PACKED with men, including Nish, but we all know he's taken already.

Check it out!
author: .Hon H.

description:
Financial district had a bar, 
E-i ei o 
And in that bar it had some cliques, 
E-i ei o 
With a clique clique here and a clique clique there, 
And a here clique, there clique, everywhere clique clique. 
Financial district had a bar, 
E-i ei o.

************************************************************************
Here's my review and I promise not to be so elementary this time.

Not much to write home to mom.  Reminds a bit of another financial district favorite, John Colins.  Packed at happy hour, especially near the entrance.  People, let's make some room for the fashionably late.  Sheesh!

Typical drinks at typical drink prices.  I think it was like $6 for a well vodka tonic.  You didn't expect happy hour prices in the financial district, did you?

After happy hour, the place cleared out like the last at-bat by Barry Bonds.  Methodical and swift.

But, it looked like the best place to be is upstairs in the mezzanine.  A great perch to see and be seen by all.
author: James C.

description:
Hey, it's another little SoMa bar, with nothing much differentiating it from any other bar in the area. But it's right off Market, making it perfect for those of us working in the FiDi who need an post-work drink.

Of course, that's when it's most crowded, and the place is small to begin with, so you'll really need to work those elbows to get to the bar. But there's a nice upstairs hangout, and once things start clearing out around 7 the place becomes quite chill.
author: Chris M.

description:
1- The prices are so good they make a jew feel guilty for spending money
2- I know Tony P below (I went w him to proof)
3- The bartenders are hot.
4- They give you bar snacks.
5- Seriously. It's  a great place. Go.
6- The place is classy, affordable and definitely a go.
author: Noah K.

description: nice place for after work drinks, bar tender was friendly and recommended really good drinks... I liked spicy margarita.
author: Astha S.

description:
I enjoy going to bars without a sign, which 83 Proof conveniently lacks.  This is a small bar with friendly 'tenders and traditional absinthe service...  

Absinthe?  Yes, the recently legalized beverage is served with the whole ice water dripping on the sugar cube on the special spoon into your glass.  Is it worth $13?  I don't know! I was busy cutting off my ear...

I have been here a few times for a nice drink.  Not a clubbing experience, but as I get up in age I prefer to be able to hear people in conversation instead of smiling and nodding whilst having my ear drums blown in.  

In short, a good spot for your happy hour or casual Saturday night.
author: Greg K.

description:
What's up with not putting your name of business on your place of business these days? Oh well. 

Props to this place for letting us drink right up until 2 a.m.; props for serving cans of Hamm's for $3 (or maybe $2, I forget); pouring big healthy Fernet shots, and doing the special something that magically makes all the FiDi fucks fuck off by the time the news crew rolls in. 

Hard place to put a bar -- there's not much spirit, ambiance or community provided by the Transbay Terminal and the Millennium fucking Tower -- but it works.
author: Chris R.

description: The service and the cocktails seem to share a common formula: two parts lackadaisical filler, one part obnoxious surprise, minimal stirring, and a dash of the sweet stuff at the end to kinda-sorta-not-quite make you feel like we're all enjoying this.
author: R O.

description:
This place is pretty great for Happy Hour and they actually have HH discounts too.  Is it me or are financial district HH prices just hard to find nowadays?  Or maybe I'm still stuck at work at 6pm so I won't make it in time?

Anyways... I like the space.  Just enough room to get cozy n warm, but wasn't too overly crowded where I could smell your Quizno's lunch on your breath.  Not a complete sticky floor dive nor a place filled with douchey lawyers.  Bartender was super nice and it's the type of place where they would remember a customer.  $5 well drinks... albeit a bit weak in taste.  Bathrooms were actually clean.

Can get loud where you cant hear your buddy's complaints about their idiot co-workers, but dude this is a bar. Get loud and get stupid!
author: Chris T.

description:
The first time I went here, I couldn't remember a thing!  It was my birthday and my girlfriend brought me and my party from our dance-off at Harlets down the street.  
The Second time I went, I was totally diggin' it.  I'm a sucker for mood-lighting, high ceilings, and full bar.  I'm talking making use of entire back wall for your bottles of fine scotch, bourbons, and my fave Jeremy Weed Sweet tea.  (whatev, I love it and love that they had it onhand).
The Bartenders : ahhhhh sigh of relief.  they may look young, but they know their drinks.  
Come here with a small party.  It's small, no not small, but cozy.  You can grab a seat at the bar if you're one of the first customers, but if you come in later, those that beat you are stickin' around all night.  There have true, blue, committed patrons.  There are a few tall tables with a max of 2 barstools.  There is a great loft above the bar that has enough seating for about 6 people, but it's a great place to have a private little party.
Go there, that's all I need to say!
author: Becka C.

description:
Having drinks, meeting new people and sipping perfectly made slightly dirty martinis by a cute and nice bartender.  

Perfect end to a chill evening.
author: Jay H.

description:
this bar is pretty cool, but i don't really remember why ... hee hee.

No, seriously, oddball location aside, 83 Proof does it right. Spacious space, amazing booze selection, great wines and a decent selection of them, affordable prices. Oh, did I mention couches upstairs?
author: Jeff H.

description:
3.5 stars. Lovely space, but a bit tight. The bartenders are very nice. really really nice. This place is like in the middle of nowhere it seems. There needs to be some sign... it's too NYC the way they just have the 83 out front and are on some dark street with nothing else open. I think even the tacqueria was closed.

The upstairs space looks cush. I wish we had our group up there so we wouldn't have had to deal with the peeps trying to make their way to the bathroom. Long narrow bars.. what can you do?

The colors and ambiance were fantastic. There were some really attractive men there.... in that "birds of a feather" sort of way. Laura is so right about the aggressive eye contact. I was like "whoa, there's a lot going on here".

I did think it was sort of funny that I asked for a Level / Soda and the Level was waaaaaay in the corner without a spout. At least the Hanger was front and center. That was its saving grace.

I can see this as being a good after work spot. I will be back to try hhr.
author: Annie T.

description: RIDICULOUSLY crowded on friday happy hour time. this is a really small bar and smells mostly like.. beer is spilled everywhere. I didn't order anything because i felt too claustrophobic but i don't think this is my kind of bar. it's too chaotic and dark!
author: Melody L.

description:
Stumbled onto this place yesterday while running errands at the end of the day.  No signage out front  just  a window with heavy curtains and a door with 83 by it.  One of the owners, Chris, was just opening up the windows when I was walking by and I got to talking to him about the place.  Walked inside and new right away I was going to be a regular.
Entire staff is outgoing and knowledgeable about everything they pour.. which is EVERYTHING.  
Looking forward to returning again.
Cheer guys!
author: Aaron F.

description:
This is a great place to grab an after work drink...especially when you want to avoid places where you have to walk in puddles of beer (Irish Bank) or want to avoid skanky strip shows (Sutter Station). 

This area doesn't have a huge selection of happy hour places but I have to say that this bar has found its place in my selection of the 'off market' (barely SOMA) happy hour circuit.
author: lindsey l.

description: Recently went here for an after work drink with a gal pal and I loved the scene of it all. Really big after work crowd and a huge booze collection (which I loved). We were able to nab a seat at the bar, the bartenders were busy but took our order immediately. I love how its almost a hidden bar theres no sign outside you just know its there because of the smoking business attired people out front. I will definitely be back.
author: Jen R.

description:
HOT BARTENDER ALERT!!!

BEWARE. Hot bartender works here; covered in tattoos, wears diesel jeans, and is nice in a kind of slightly shy-awkward way. Oh, he's straight for all the ladies, despite the slight lisp.

Why has it taken so long to have a nice bar open up in our area? 83 Proof is a great little place just a stones throw from work and that makes it an instant hit for us bar deprived drinkers. The place has excellent lighting, i must say, though can be a bit difficult to navigate on a crowded night (it's long and narrow). Thanks to the bar for letting us take over a table and part of the bar for our Christmas exchange and damn those alcoholics who came in at 4 and beat us to the upstairs seating area. This place is sure to be a hit, especially with such a HOT bartender. Did I mention there was a hot bartender? 

Minus for the god awful music... Someone needs to redo that damned playlist they have. Yes, rock is good, but bad rock is mind numbing. Can we get the playlist from the Last Supper Club restaurant here? Thanks.
author: Robert P.

description:
It had always been pretty slim pickins for those who, for whatever reason, had found themselves in the nether lands somewhere between the dividing line of downtown and, um..."lower SOMA"....looking for a cool spot for a drink.  In a 'hood where the choices are limited to either the the likes of House of Shields, Rickenbacker-Knickebocker-Whatever, some place on the ground floor of a hotel, or dealing with the affectations of some california-cuisine-y restaurant bar...or taking the initiative to forge across Howard and plunge deeper into SOMA....83 Proof is a welcome addition.  

And it's kinda like a treasure hunt to even find the place...since, at the moment there's no signage of any kind.  

Here's the hint:  when you get to 1st and Mission....just imagine where the loading dock for Walgreens SHOULD be.

Bingo.

(Incidentally...it's awesome that Walgreens has a location at 1st and Mission...because the one at 2nd/N. Montgomery and Mission was just too inconvenient, no ?....)

Cool little place.  The barkeeps are nice, eccentric sorta fellows.  Bar seating, table seating, and a loft, too.  Nice interior.  Nice vibe. Mixed crowd as well...

And cool drink selection.  How many places have Tahitian beer ?  Or 'Sidecars' made with Tuaca as opposed to brandy? Or shots of Sambuca ...served with red vines from the Walgreens ?

Also of note, a cocktail of their own invention:  The Upright.  

Interpret the meaning of this drink's name as you will (you'll probably get it wrong)....but definitely try one.

Just a cool, fun spot for a drink ....in a 'hood which had been strangely devoid of such places....
author: El K.

description:
Excellent selection of the brown water and reasonable prices (for a bar).  I received some knowledgeable guidance and an introduction to some new single malts I would never have tried on my own.

Also, they have free WiFi as I discovered one afternoon when I held a meeting with a visiting sales guy.  I was the only person in the bar and got some work done while I sampled the scotches.  The staff was very friendly.  I'll be back again soon.
author: Jason W.

description:
There are two reasons why 83 Proof is a great place to be...

They have both Sheep's Dip and Pig's Nose out of the reach of commoners. It is only accessible to those who are worthy enough to know its power. 

AND they don't have a front window. Well at least when i was there last night there wasn't a front window which instantly let me know that this is this the coolest place in the world.

Although i do take one star away for serving me a Manhattan the girly way, i.e. in a martini glass. I expected it to come the way my boyfriends did. In a rocks glass and delicious. Don't get me wrong it was an amazing Manhattan but dammit I wanted it the manly way!
author: Brittany D.

description:
This place is great! Very good location for drinks after works with co-workers. The drink prices rock, too! $4.00 for a well drink. Not too bad in SF! Decent selection of Beer - Newcastle. Rogue, Heineken, Hoegarden.

Only bad thing is that this place is small. The entry-way gets crowded and then not very many places to mingle.

I'll still be back, though :)
author: Ian C.

description: Great happy hour. Really, REALLY loud... could barely hear myself speaking to my friend that was 10 inches from my face. One of the bartenders, Mark, was super responsive to our drink orders. Thanks Mark! I'd probably come back here but not on Friday happy hour. During the week maybe less chaotic.
author: Stephanie F.

description: Great happy hour with $3 pints, and interesting selection at that.  Love the Firestone Ale.  Excellent selection of scotches and whiskies and bartenders are knowledgeable about the different types.  Can get crowded after 5 on Thursday/Fridays as its not a big place, but good after work spot nonetheless.
author: Andrew E.

description:
List of Alcohols by Proof:

1.  Everclear Grain Alcohol = 190 proof
2.  Barcardi 151 = 151 proof
3.  Absinthe = 110 - 140 proof
4.  Wild Turkey = 101 proof
5.  Russells' Reserve 10 year old bourbon = 90 proof
6.  Table Wine = 14 - 28 proof
7.  Beer = 10 proof (approximately)

So since I was drinking beer and not the high proof alcohol straight I presume that means:

A.  My trachea is still intact
B.  My stomach can still digest things
C.  I'm not suffering from hallucinations or a two day hangover
D.  My kidney isn't shot
E.  My rectum isn't suffering from 2nd degree burns

I was in fact drinking $2 Heineken's during happy hour here.  And very happy I was.  The place has a good vibe, attentive bartenders with not so attentive patrons and a decent beat.  The music is loud which means you have to pump up the volume in your voice when speaking to someone.  But a small price to pay for a nice place to grab a cold one and reminisce those days in college when Everclear was a necessary addition to the cheapest fruit juice in the store.
author: Bill P.

description: This was the first time that I had been to 83 Proof and it might have just been the night but I wasn't too impressed.  It was packed and it was very difficult to get a bartender's attention and then get a drink.  I would probably give this another try but hopefully it won't be as packed next time.
author: Blake B.

description: Another one of the "hand made" cocktail bars that's opened in the past five years. It's a small place and always seem crowded every time I go by, but I finally got in here on a cold Wednesday night around 8:00 pm. The upstairs was open so it was easy to grab a seat and enjoy my shot/beer. Great selection of liquors, beers etc... you know the drill. The place is small and always packed, but if you're in the FiDi and want a good drink then this could be your place.
author: Corey V.

description: Well this place is right around the corner from my work and I go there often to hang out with friends and coworkers. The place is small but gets pack fast around 5ish, so go early if you want a table...the bartenders are very nice and friendly. I'm not sure if there is a happy hr menu...lots of Financial District peeps though...:)  but good hang out hole in the wall place...:)
author: Spoon P.

description: Cool crowd, nice joint albeit a bit cramped at happy hour.  Knowledgeable barkeeps kept the drinks flowing and showed a great characteristic rare in barmen these days.  The glass waggle and head nod = "hey dude, another beer here please"
author: J G.

description:
Yes, it's a bit hard to find but you can't walk by it without seeing the crowd. I really liked the decor in this bar, and especially that it has a mezzanine/private area. The HH specials are amazing ($4 well drinks), but that meant that the bar was packed.

 It would be nice to have a bit more seating at the entrance (what looks like the dance floor but not sure that's what it is). Overall, still a great place to go.
author: C B.

description: We attempted to visit this bar on Sat. Aug 10, 2013 and it was closed, boarded up and completely empty.  Did they close down permanently or are they just renovating?
author: Katie M.

description:
Fun. 

I was excited to find out about this new bar so close to our office. I've already gone by the past two Fridays after work with colleagues for a drink, or two, or three...  Each time, we've left much more relaxed, aka buzzed, and happy. 

The only pitfall is that it can get super crowded, but I've not had to wait more than 10 minutes to order our drinks which I think is tolerable. It certainly doesn't hurt that one of the bartenders is adorable and will make eye contact and smile as if to say..."I know you've been waiting, but I'll be with you ASAP, dear..."

The drinks are strong and cheap compared to some of the other places around Financial District (i.e., Americano...). I'll definitely be going back.
author: lily l.

description:
Living on Treasure Island has its ups and downs, and the worst of the latter is probably having to take the bus home from the Transbay Terminal since I can't even walk there.  Lately, though, I've discovered a silver lining:  83 Proof, a stone's throw from the Transbay, the perfect place for a quick beer (or five) after work.

I've always been served promptly and cheerfully, the bartenders seem capable and confident.  Apparently one of them is named Sky Jet, so that's cool also.

The place isn't huge, although there's a nice little mezzanine upstairs, although it's often booked.  The atmosphere, on the whole, is quite nice:  Not too loud, not too dark or bright, usually not too crowded.

Basically, a real nice bar to just relax at for an hour or two, or three.
author: Stephen M.

description: Not bad at all... spent my last night as a single man drinking here with good friends. Good atmosphere, crowd was friendly, and the music wasn't so loud that I had to scream to have a conversation. Wide selection of scotch whiskey's. Bit of a walk from the happening area but definitely doable, a few blocks. Next time I'll have to try the basil gimlet, see if their's taste like a cold bowl of Pho!
author: Gil A.

description:
It's been a pretty good start to 2011 since everywhere I've gone so far has been pretty good.  83 Proof's happy hour last night was crowded, yet we were able to get a seat at the bar.  Good beer selection, but I was definitely expecting a cocktail menu given the type of place it was.

Unique to Proof 83 was the pianist that played during happy hour, he had a good mix of music, including Lady Gaga.  The piano version of Poker Face was definitely interesting.
author: Olivia T.

description: You can walk by this place and not realize that it's there, or that it's open sometimes. It's chic, drinks are good (try their cucumber gimlet). I swear the bartenders know how to make anything and everything...they have an upstairs seating area and if you get there by 10:30 on a weekend you can find a seat, otherwise you'll be standing. If you're in the SOMA area, maybe you can go to dinner at Salt House and come here after for drinks
author: S K.

description:
I have to say this is probably my favorite place for a downtown happy hour within a couple blocks of my office.

On a sunny day, they open up the front windows which makes for a nice place to soak up some rays.  It also feels really cozy on a cold, winter day.
