Speaking of winter days... this place makes the best hot toddies I've ever had.  After having one here, I tried ordering them at a few other places, and nobody even compared.  mmmmm... so good!

I also like that the place is easy to miss.  Not much signage.  It's funny to watch people walk right by and not realize it's right there.

It can get pretty crowded, so get there early and try to claim the mezzanine if you've got a big group coming.

Good deals on beers for happy hour too!
author: Carolyn W.

description: I came here for drinks on a Thursday night with some friends.  The ambiance was great; a cool bar with tasteful decor and plenty of space to stand and chat.  The bartenders were incredibly friendly and very accommodating.  I was impressed with the selection behind the bar.  Dark n' Stormies are my new favorite drink and I was happy to see that they had Gosling's rum and Ginger Beer available to make it.  They even pulled off a rum swizzle for one of my friends.  This place is definitely worth checking out.
author: Tim N.

description:
Looks can be deceiving for this barely noticeable joint. No flashy signs or velvet rope, a simple large window and a plain door is all that beckons to your thirsty self.

Clean cut, presentable, and great drink prices makes 83 proof stand out. It gets pretty crowded when everyone gets off work (especially since this is a stone's throw away from the heart of the Financial District), so come early to stake a great seat. 

The bartenders are great, offer superb recommendations and are attentive enough to get you your drink promptly, even when it gets chaotic.

I've taken a bunch of friends to 83 proof and not one of them had a bad thing to say. One of them liked it so much so that it's now their go-to bar of choice on a night out in San Francisco. 

A nice hidden gem amongst the concrete jungle of San Francisco.
author: Danilo D.

description:
It's clean inside, I snagged a table with my friends and my greyhound was only $4 at happy hour, so I'll be back.

Perfect place for tying one on after work.
author: Suo L.

description:
3.5

I'm always a fan of owner-operated bars, but really, the bartenders/owners here are super nice and friendly. I talked to Sky the last time I went, we high-fived.

Regarding the location, I like that it's downtown but isn't yuppie. It's just a chill, comfy place to grab a drink with some friends. Don't bring the whole office though, it's an intimate place better suited for smaller groups. I recommend going on weeknights if you want to relax and avoid the scene. When this place gets crowded, expect to wait a while for a drink.

I was feeling a little under the weather but still wanted to go out to meet my friends so I asked Sky to recommend something. He came up with a Hot Toddy. How neat is that?!
author: Tony P.

description:
Me likey!!! 

The service here is awesome; the bartenders (Sky and Mark) were so friendly and so attentive. We did come in after the HH rush, so we got seats at the bar and some very lovely martinis. Don't really want to talk about how many, so I'll just leave that out. I will say that Sky made us many different and unique libations, all of which were tasty and well, full of alcohol (just the way I like'em!). I can't say I've ever had basil in a martini before! The place actually picked up around 11 (Thursday night) and there was a great vibe. Though in FiDi, it felt very local. Love that.
author: Lisa F.

description: I am really not a fan of this place. I have been here twice and it's always cramped, and the bartenders are always slow. It's like really? Every drink takes 5 minutes? Even a beer? And you can't multi-task? I would just avoid this place if you see people standing by the bar ... they have been there for a while. When you do get your drink it's pretty good. The setup of this place has a little overhang that you might be able to get to but it's nothing special. Overall just a run of the mill place.
author: Greg G.

description: One of the few bars that doesn't get annoying. It's probably because the crowd is always changing. The clientele ranges from financial district worker bee to hipster to bridge and tunnel.   But the main reason I like this place is because it's a great environment to drown your sorrows.
author: Roger H.

description:
This place is a great after-work spot.  I would get there early to get a spot at the bar as the seating can be tough.  

Its a nice mix of young professionals without the lame pretension of -Americano for example.  They interior of the bar is done really well - sleek and modern.  On a nice day there is a large open window at the front of the space which is really nice.  

One of my favorite spots in the Fidi for sure.
author: Moe J.

description:
Bars with no sign just seem cooler when you're there.

Cute bartenders help too.

It's nothing *super* special but a nice place to grab a drink or for a preparty...
author: Melanie C.

description:
Weird. Never would have guessed this place was a bar. It was a bit packed for my liking (especially considering it was a weeknight), but the excellent service (find the bald guy with the glasses), the amazing drink (a pomegrante tequila cocktail), and the kinds of people who come here make this place a fun spot for a post-work drink.

They also have Yamazaki scotch. Didn't have a chance to drink it but I've been longing for it since my trip to Japan two years ago... And rarely do you find it! Nice selection.
author: Aaron F.

description: If I have the correct place this was once called Bit Of Paradise, owned by Bernie.  I am talking forty years ago.  Even back then it was a work hangout as we worked just across the street.  A lot of time was spent there, and money.  As for best nights, back then it was seven days a week.  I do not remember seeing Bernie accept a credit card for anything, anyway, most of us did not have credit cards.  Great times.
author: Delbert W.

description: great for renting out and having a couple hundred people party with friends.  reasonably priced.  clever name
author: Rob C.

description: I've definitely referred this place to a few people of the last few months, it's pretty much the only bar that isn't packed with tourists or weirdos. Not to mention the bartenders are extremely talented and very cool. I suggest going there on a Thursday, saddle up to the bar and order an "Old Fashioned" well... Awww.... nothin' better.
author: Sean V.

description:
Cool spot for happy hour!

I met my friends downtown for HH on Friday, and easily spotted them and (except for one of the four rounds of drinks we got), drinks were relatively easy to get.  This is definitely a popular spot for HH but the crowd was cool and polite (very un-Marina), drinks were VERY reasonably priced (a grey goose pear with soda water was $7), and my friends and I were able to secure a spot easily without having to feel like sardines.  

My only small beef with the spot was that:
1.  The music was rather loud, so it was hard to have a conversation
2.  Freakin' hot in there.  

Super cool joint to meet up with friends and start a night off.  :o)
author: Ria D.

description:
Why the hype?  I miss the days where I could actually walk into this place, and not stand outside looking like a loser waiting to be let in.  And even when you get in, we are crammed like sardines with everyone else in there.  And almost impossible to get the bartenders' attention with everyone else waiting cash around.

But their drinks ARE delicious, and if you don't go during a popular day for happy hour you can probably get a table.
author: Jenny L.

description:
ooh, i love this place. the atmosphere is casual without being dingy or divey and attractive without seeming pretentious. drinks seem pretty cheap considering how tastefully decorated the place is, and despite being in the financial district it didn't seem yuppie-ish.

also, on a nice afternoon, that window seat is amazing.
author: Jane P.

description: Good beers...awful service.  Literally sat in front of the tap for 5 minutes on a Monday night, got spilled on when one of the taps went out, and when the bartender finally got my order, he shortchanged me.  If I wasn't meeting friends here I would have left already.  Never again.
author: Micah M.

description:
Atmosphere: Pretty nice bar. Simple decorations. Good feel.

Crowd: Typical bar for the people after work in the FiDi. Gets a little too crowded on a Friday, especially with such narrow walkways.

Service: Bartenders could be a little faster, but it is happy hour time on a Friday so can't really blame them. Good job.

Overall: I'd come here again if I had nothing else to do. Other than that, I'd prefer somewhere else.
author: Jimmy N.

description: I tried to meet up with friends here and there were too many of us for this spot. It's not good for groups of more than 4 people. And its important to go early - it gets packed quickly. While I didn't stay long, its definitely on my list to go back. It had a good vibe, good location, and seemed like a cool spot. I'll write another review once I have the opportunity to fully experience it.
author: Katie M.

description:
After having spent the weekend in Vegas where average price for drinks is north of $20 and the money-hungry bartenders would frown as if you got lupus when you tip them less than $5, we were in for a nice surprise when two pints of Stellas costs us $6 TOTAL and the bartender was actually cute AND at the same time nice to me and my girl friend.

Pleased as a punch, that Thursday must've been our lucky day as we immediately found a little table to sit around - it was Thursday evening and the place, which is not too spacious to begin with, was packed out with the usual FiDi dwellers who, like us, take advantage of their happy hour.  

Thank you www.mappyhour.com
author: Ange L.

description: Ridiculously loud after work, even on weeknight and nowhere to hang. Good looking interior but I prefer someplace where i know that at some point, a space will open up where my friends and I can sit a spell.
author: Barndi K.

description: I used to hang here back when it was a dive bar during the dot-com days. I remember a gun being pulled at one point and someone unfortunately died.   I never returned. Flash forward... Wow, what a difference a few years can make in SOMA. Entirely different bar for an entirely different hood. The row of bitters bottles in the front corner of the bar is a promising sign. The drinks are cheap and the crowds are full. Great bar, nothing stands out in the exceptional, and it was way too crowded. I will re-star as I return and get a better feel for the new place and the drinks.
author: Brian J.

description:
I like 83 Proof. I like the space. I like the floors. I like the bartenders. I like pretty much everything about it... except the location.

It is kind of in the middle of nowhere. I mean, for an after work bar it seems just too trendy. It seems like it belongs next to Oola or Rye or something.

Still, a super awesome bar.
author: Jordan M.

description: Based on other reviews, it looks like the experience might be different on weeknights after work vs. Saturday night. I went last Saturday night for a friend's birthday (yes, it is unmarked other than "83" so it's a little tricky to find) and it was deserted other than the birthday party even though we were there from 10 pm to midnight. It's a really nice and clean place but I definitely wouldn't go back for a Saturday night because there isn't much going on. I would consider checking it out for happy hour during the week.
author: Gina C.

description:
This place attracts a "fancy: crowd for happy hours.  

But his place has few seats and gets packed.  Going here on a Friday or Saturday night seems to attract a more diverse crowd compared to happy hour.  

This place has small "loft" upstairs too.
author: Alan T.

description: It's ok. The beer selection is well thought out. The spirits - gin, whiskey, bourbon is surprisingly varied and good. Nice vibe, not too loud. Maybe I didn't look like a startup guy which is why the barman kept passing me over for a drink - every time? Ok you don't like pinstripe suits. I get it. If you don't like the colour of my money there are plenty of other places to drink. Not as cool as it would like to make out. I'll find a friendlier place.
author: Surj S.

description:
Well, this place is close to work, and that's why I go. 

I couldn't imagine ever making a point to take more than 5 minutes to get here, unless it's still the closest bar to you downtown and you're done with work. 

Looks spiffy & has a great selection of liquor, but in the end it's just another non-descript bar built for those running the rat race.
author: Shawn S.

description:
What really sets 83 Proof apart is the care that goes in to the drinks. They actually make the drinks, not just mix them. For example - whiskey sour - they don't just pour some sour mix atop a weak pour of whiskey, they actually squeeze lemons and limes and a touch of soda water to actually make the drink. You don't find this sort of thing many places, its almost a shame to have beer or wine.

Of course the down side of this is that the bartenders are very, very busy and it can take a loooong time to get a drink on a busy night. It also gets very full, very fast and can be difficult to get through the pack. All in all, a very nice little spot to stop for some quality libations.
author: Ben K.

description:
Oo, me like. 

Classy little bar in SOMA w/ a cozy interior. Loved the live jazz band that was squished in the corner- it's just what a bar like this needs. There's an upstairs space, but I didn't get the chance to check it out- next time!

Drink menu hasn't taken shape yet, but the bartenders have some consistently creative hits that they like to recommend. I had a basil-something-or-other that was a bit on the sour side, but mucho satisfying after a long day at work.

Bartenders were friendly & drinks were cheap! I think it was around 7 bucks- a steal for post-happy hour SOMA spots. If I can make it all the way out there again, I'd love to stop by. It's a bummer that there isn't much else around to hop to, but if you work in the area and just want to grab a drink, this is the spot.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
Beautiful awesome bar.  

Small, intimate, great bartenders, elegant and sexy decor and strong drinks. Upstairs there is a private, VIPish lounge area.   The crowd is good looking, and friendly so there really should be no complaints.  

Really can't say much more, I had so much fun, I don't  remember any other details of the place, even with all the times I've been here!
author: Denise B.

description:
This place has a great ambience with lots of seating - the upstairs area is definitely cool. It's pretty small, but when we went on a Saturday night it was fairly quiet...not that I minded. Will definitely need to come back again - it looks like this is one of the places to be for HH.

This place is definitely a little hard to find - just look for the number #83, because it doesn't have a sign. It's on the same side of the street as Walgreens.
author: Adrienne C.

description:
Okay, I didn't realize Sky was an owner, but I did think he was great, friendly, smiling, and most importantly, a good bartender- made eye contact right away, made sure someone had taken my order etc. Good looking too. 

- What things stuck out? 

Music was a bit loud for a happy hour. Perhaps like 4-8 could be just a little softer and relaxing before kicking it up into night club mode. Although I could just be especially sensitive to this, since the night before I tried out Azul, and it was like a Sat night at 5:00 on a Wednesday.

Upstairs was closed for a private event- not sure what time that was at, but it made there be no sitting, and it got very crowded. 

Weird mix of people too, Bridge and Tunnel crowd that blocked the only seats at the bar, but never sat in them. Odd. 

So four stars. I would go back, my partner in crime said no way, but I think another shot in about 2 months might give a different perspective. Kinda like wine breathing. ( Ha, just read some other reviews, sounds like great Yelpers think alike!)
author: Danielle V.

description:
I like how it's so subtle..

I went on a Friday.. lots of people. Looks like the usual FiDi crowd, business suits and all. 

Very very crowded. I really liked the set up though. It was very clean, and there's a balcony up top too.

Overall, presentation wise, it's great... the look, the style, everything. 

Drinks were tasty. 

What they DO need to do is install some AC or something, it gets HOT!
author: Eugenia Y.

description:
I love love LOVE this place! It's an unmarked spot with no sign - just the street address number 83. 
It's on my way to the transit terminal so I stop by once in a while for a glass of chardonnay or beer. 
Always packed and crackin'! The crowd's usually your early 30's/40 fidi crowd needing to unwind after a long day's work. Also I never had a problem with getting the bartender's attention for a drink, even when crowded.
author: Britney C.

description: Yayyyy for great mojitos and wonderful service!
author: Ami N.

description:
I liked this place a lot - many people have mentioned the drink prices and the friendly bartenders, and for good reason. It's pretty rare combo anywhere these days, never mind SF/SOMA. 

Be forewarned though - the place isn't huge so planning a happy hour with 40 of your closest friends here probably isn't the smartest thing on a friday night. 

But we still had a great time. The tall bartender who smiles a lot was my absolute fav!

A quick WTF to the lack of food in this area - there are plenty of bars, which means people are going to want to eat at some point. I just don't get it.
author: Shal J.

description:
Since moving to SF, I've been looking for a great local bar. Unfortunately, I don't live in an awesome neighborhood where there are bars just down the block, and I can just stop by after work or grab a drink whenever I feel like it. 83 Proof has become that place for me.

When you walk in, you'll see a long bar on the left and a little upstairs lounge in the back. If you take a look at the bottles behind the bar, you'll realize that you're not looking at crappy liquor; there's some really excellent stuff on that wall. But instead of expecting to pay an arm and a leg, the drinks are reasonably priced and reasonably potent.

The fact that the owners are bartenders make them even more dedicated to their drinks and their customers. Last night, my roommate and I stopped by in order to just grab a quick drink before heading to another party. They had two large parties and the place was packed. Even with so much business, The bartenders took the time to talk to their regulars between orders.

Thanks for making me feel at home, guys.
author: Abhay K.

description:
This seems like a great place to hang out after work with a small group of your coworkers or friends - as long as you are dressed somewhat formally. I was in the area just for one day at my company's SF office and when my pretty big group of coworkers and I walked in, it was already filled up. It's a pretty small bar and the crowd isn't diverse - mostly white-collared guys and black-suited girls.I got the vibe that people who work nearby drop in and out, rather than purposely make the effort to make the trip to this bar from the other neighborhoods. 

Since that's the case, I guess I have no reason to go back there. But four stars for pretty good drinks.
author: Kelly G.

description:
You can easily miss 83 Proof walking down 1st street because the street isn't fill with other bars and restaurants nor is there a sign outside but once you walk in - it's worth it!  Great happy hour spot but it is small and narrow so get there early.  It's fun to sit at the bar and flirt with the cute bartenders and be able to see all the people walking in.  

Drinks are not that expensive.  Overall it just has a great vibe and good crowd... check it out!
author: Lily W.

description:
I organized birthday drinks for a Saturday night at 83 Proof a few weeks ago and all reviews in from my friends were that this was an awesome place! I know I definitely had a great time because time passed super quick -- or maybe that was a result of the good drinks?  ;)

I will start off by saying our experience was made really great by the fact that we chose to go on a Saturday and it was much, much less crowded than a weekday evening. My group of 40 pretty much had the place to ourselves for about half of the night.

Why did we love this place?

1. Bartenders -- the two guys on duty that night were awesome! Super friendly! They made us some fantastic drinks, including Manhattans that matched up to Bourbon and Branch and also coming up with a twist on a Kamikaze that almost everyone ended up ordering throughout the night!

2. Ambiance -- the high ceilings make the place feel bigger than it is. Most of all, I love how it's not pretentious, but still really modern. I feel at home here! Smaller groups will appreciate the loft seating upstairs -- it seats about 12-15 people.

3. Prices -- even without the weekday happy hour specials, my bar tab was super reasonable. And it's not like the drinks are watered down. My Manhattans were STRONG! It's nice to be at a placle that isn't looking to gouge customers. 

I'll be looking to come back here again very soon!
author: Mel M.

description: Horrible from 6pm-7pm, when the after work crowd swarms the place. They seem to be playing insanely loud thrash metal music to push the button-down crowd out, which by 7pm, worked. A pleasant bar for a beer - $3 beers at that. Friendly, good-looking bartenders.
author: Lauren G.

description:
Cheap strong drinks.

Hip owners.

and 

Sky.

Who could ask more of their local hip post-work cocktail establishment?
author: TheJane N.

description: Decent bar in the Financial District. Gets pretty busy around happy hour, but as do all bars around here during that time !!
author: Scoot S.

description:
in addition to being in a hidden spot on 1st between market and mission....

in addition to the amazing bartending knowledge that sky and marc both have of every drink in the universe...

in addition to having the great atmosphere that this place eludes...

it's a crazy place to spend any night of the evening. this is my go to spot after dinner because you know you're always be in good company, with quality drinks and the noise is just at the right level, the people are just the right crowd, you always meet someone interesting....

I can't say enough about this place, its gorgeous, the bartenders are so friendly, the crowd is just right. I just get sucked in time after time. I've never had a night which wasn't memorable.
author: Scarlet S.

description: This is a great bar, the staff are friendly and professional. I usually stop here for an in between drink or two at a busier time, last night was quiet and I really let the place sink in, I'm really impressed with the interior finishes here, lots of grainy wood finishes and their selection is huge, I was introduced to an interesting "tea" flavored liquor. Check it out folks!
author: Ryan M.

description: It was good.  I have not worked downtown for many years, but this was a nice change from the places of yesteryear.  The bartenders were very knowledgeable and cool but not too cool.  Scored a chair at the bar, apparently on a Thursday this is difficult.  Crowd was the usual mix of over-eager-eater-achievers and hipsters.  Met a cool travel agent and saw people smiling.
author: Erin M.

description: It's hard to find this bar. But once you do, it's the oyster's pearl. Intimate atmosphere; great looking women; dapper men; and best of all, the bartenders make all the decisions for you.  :-) Visit this bar.
author: Michael W.

description: This is a great, under-stated place.  The bartenders, especially Meghan, are laid-back and creative.  I admit it benefits from being less than a block from where I work, but I'd make a real trip to get here anyway.
author: Brian M.

description:
there is some serious happy hour goin on here. equipped  with a sly layout mix of open spaced perching stations in the front, an extra wide alley for the bar and cool loft area ala jade.

they were prompt, professional and decent mixologists making a subpar salty dog but winning me over on their well known basil gimlet.

a bit too overrun with heineken drinkin yuppies talking about how much points their companies are down, but fuck it..if I want some sexiness going on I can just hike over to harlot...hmm..maybe I will.
author: omar b.

description:
The bar tenders here really are attentive and if you have been sitting there waiting, they will serve you before Steve, Steve and Steve push up to the bar. 

Had a good time here last night, the Mezzanine is very comfortable.  Unfortunately, I do not remember much else.
author: Adam C.

description: This place just got so much better.  I recently discovered the Basil Gimlet drink.  I usually drink Belvedere Gimlets on the rocks.  But a coworker ordered this pretty green drink from 83 Proof and I thought it was an appletini.  No no, it's fresh basil leaves mashed with a pestle, shaken with all the toxicities, and poured into a martini glass.  Refreshing, full basil taste, and mind-blowing!  This is a must for basil lovers!
author: Diane L.

description:
i took the express train to FUCKEDUPVILLE last night, and it was an incredibly....umm....touchy-feely-huggy ride. 

i think i felt up all of the yelpers i met last night at my first DYL, channeling the amazing energy of cooter and adrienne (who almost didn't show, but thank god she did). and the ghost of doeke made a special appearance. 

they have newcastle on tap and mild sugared absinthe. 

so the express train had little green fairies pulling them at mach speed. my head was whirling with new names, new faces, old faces, hugs, cupcakes, birthdays, a hacking cough here and there and a couple of really good conversations (surprising, because this bar got as tightly packed as the subway in nyc at rush hour and it's about as big as one of those trains!). 

not usually my style of bar, but it was a warm night and i liked the open air window up front. i only spent $40 on drinks (i felt bad matt had to buy all the newbies drinks, so this newbie fronted a few rounds). 

having green fairies pull your train to destination FUCKEDUPVILLE has never been so fun.
author: May T.

description: This is my new favorite bar.  I've been to a few happy hours and one group party in the upstairs mezzanine, and only have good things to say about 83 Proof.  It's brand-new and modern/upscale in decor, but the vibe is mellow like a comfy Mission hangout.  The folks that work here are some of the friendliest on the planet.  They know their drinks and the beer is some of the coldest in town.  Prices are ridiculously reasonable.  Bonus -- sometimes you run into Nish here!
author: Andi T.

description:
My very fuzzy memories of 83 Proof say that this is a five star establishment.  Albeit a tad pricey.

The best part of the evening was Sky - the amazingly tattooed owner/bartender - who is hawt with a capital HAW!  He & his staff were really patient with us, even the drunkie drunks... (er-um, me.)

Had a good time there, would recommend it to anyone as a swank FiDi happy hour spot.

Cheers, 83 Proof!  I have to go lay down to fight the hangover that you helped to create.

UPDATE as to Drunken Antics from 83 Proof:
-Apparently, a bunch of Yelpers were walking behind me as I exited BART; but, I did not notice them - they were drunk invisible.
-My roommate told me on Sunday morning that I tried to talk her into fighting with some random chick at 83 Proof
-She also told me that I presented a very compelling argument for this; and, that she almost did it
-I stole Adrienne G's lighter
-I walked... wait, STUMBLED from Van Ness & Mission to 16th & Mission
-I called Rose L. repeatedly b/c I wanted her to come get a bacon dog with me
-I couldn't find a bacon dog vendor for the SECOND week in a row (though I could smell them)
-I bought a cheeseburger (again) at BK, but did not throw it at anyone
-I found Karl L. on BART & walked half way home w/him (b/c he lives in the same general direction that I do)
-I left tons of funny drunk messages for people
-I kicked my cell phone (the battery of which was dead) under my dresser & it took me 14 hours & a lot of crying about how I can't afford to replace it to find it...
author: Kate R.

description: Brought a couple frolleagues here for a drink when they were in town for business, its pretty nice, no sign outside, pretty minimal but classy on the inside, nice quick bartenders. i'd have to say that there were a few too many business types, not my crowd but, as long as you bring your own people you should be good.
author: Jared Z.

description:
what a cool little bar - think of a smaller, swankier john collins (the bar) with a sprinkle of nua (the restaurant).

i had the pleasure of popping the bartender's cucumber gimlet cherry (he claims he had never made one before) and it was quite memorable.  i'd never seen a man put so much love and detail into my one drink of the evening (lightweight that i now am).

one round for 6 of us and it only came out to $40 with tip.  what's not to love??

TIP:  the bar is unmarked except for the silver "83" by the door, and the  japanese chex mix was a nice touch to keep from getting too hammered on an empty stomach.  refills happily given.
author: Josie M.

description: I have a Chartreux headache right now. All I recall is that it's some sort of anisette type absinthe concoction made with 150 different herbs by monks. Where you get this stuff, I have no idea. But 83 Proof has it, and you really just have to try it. Let me stop my review right there and say the name alone warrants half its stars. And these guys know what they're doing, my martini was well made and the place was packed for being open for barely a couple weeks. I love the worn-out wood look of the floor and the bar and all of the decor. It does get a little loud in there, but I hear they're working on it. I'm giving this place five stars just for the most random, yet thoroughly enjoyable happy hour I just may have ever had. Unicorn shots anyone?
author: Michael E.

description:
I met a good friend here for drinks after work . The bar is relatively small, but was not overcrowded at 6:30pm on a Tuesday. WE got two prime seats at the wood paneled bar. Bar hooks were present. 

We asked for a drink menu and got a slight stink-eye. After a press for a recommended bourbon drink, I ordered an old fashioned. Very tasty. The also seemed to have a good beer selection and the bartender excitedly told us about a super-hoppy selection. 

The was a distressed piano in the back which was expertly played by a patron (or he may have been one of the bartenders). Ragtime renditions of Black Hole Sun and Wonderwall -- awesome. 

I would go here again.
author: Alon R.

description: Maybe I just came on a wrong day, it was 80F when my friends and I walked in. The place looks busy but not too crowded. We left right away because the place smells like sweaty dudes. Like I say, maybe it was just a bad day. This place is close to my office, so it will be cool if it is a good HH spot. :)
author: Ervinna L.

description: small in size...narrow in space..upper deck availability...drinks priced low....friendly quick service...flowing of booze steady 'n' strong....interiors neat....mostly bar stool seating.....second floor for cozy sofa seating....basil gimlets in regular cup...highly recommend...
author: Hen A.

description: Very cool indeed...great selection of beers on tap and a mellow, unpretentious vibe and interesting crowd that made me feel like I was at a house party instead of a bar. Plenty of seating (at least when I was there) and an upstairs with a balcony that offers an awesome view of the scene below.
author: Carrie E.

description: Great place to throw a tech happy hour!
author: Michael H.

description:
OK.... it has been a LOOOOOOOONG time since I've written a review, and I've actually been meaning to write one about these guys for awhile. alas, since I am no longer an office worker, I never seem to have the chance to sit down and write for yelp :(    so yes.... 83 proof very special ;)
Located right next to the Walgreens on 1st and Mission, 83 Proof took over the space that used to house that seedy asian gangster-ish bar attitudes... (i think that was the name of it) It was the type of bar you would try to walk past really fast if not cross over to the other side of the street. But.. now, the neew owners have done a really great job at opening making the space warm and welcome. I love that it's a block away from where I work, and that it is part of the new 2nd-1st street triangle. I love it... Working at Kates, it's always great when new bars open cause it brings more people into the neighborhood. And this area is fast becoming the new bar hopping mecca. I say NEW cause we all already know about the Mission, and North Beach (before it became ghetto fab), and "sigh" yes, the Marina. 
Now... for happy hour or after dinner you can go to John Colins, Zebulon, 83 Proof, Harlot, Rickenbacher, Steffs, Kates... etc :) 
Anyways... enough blabbering and back to 83. It's a beautiful space, very simple, with options to sit at the bar and chat with the hotties that work there, or sit at one of the high tables against the wall, or sit upstairs in a more intimate setting. Great for dates, but it's just as great for large groups. I can already see private parties happening in the upstairs loft area... hmmm maybe my birthday???? 
Oh yeah... and as of last night, they now serve absinthe... yup complete with sugar cubes :)    Yes... I am a fan of 83 Proof.
author: Marina K.

description:
Sporting only a street number outside as official proof of its existence, you're more likely to find 83 Proof by looking for the crowd out front, or listening for the noise pouring out of large open windows.  Walking in, the space is very high, with some classic gilt chandeliers and matching wall lamps.  As others have mentioned, it's a nearly perfect amount of lighting - not too bright, not too dark - for a comfortable, relaxed, classy bar.  Only the 2 flat-screen TVs in front detract from the ambiance.  Everything's a shade of brown or tan, and a bar nearly the length of the room fills one wall, fronting an enchantingly large selection of top-shelf beverages, and a reasonable beer selection too.  
Clearly, the bartenders here enjoy their alcohol, and being prepared to make anything you could think of.
Not only that, but they're expert at it!  I can personally attest to an extremely well made Manhattan (in the old style, with both sweet & dry vermouth, and a twist as well as 2 real cherries) and Mojito, and a well made Old Fashioned (I would have gone with less fruit).  The 'tenders are also very friendly, proud of their mixology, and want to make sure you enjoy their creations.  I was pleasantly surprised when they checked to make sure the Manhattan and Old Fashioned were to my liking.  That's class, folks, and I love it.  Prices are shockingly reasonable too, especially considering the amount of TLC that goes into making those drinks.

There's also a balcony in back with a great view of the bar and a bunch of couches for more relaxed drinking.  This is a great space to rent out, or take over if you get there early enough.
author: Don H.

description: Excellent bar. Been here a few times and they always make great cocktails. Bartenders are totally chill and the biggest thing is they make really good drinks. It's a bit of a mixologist bar. When they have them, they even do fresh squeezed grapefruit Greyhounds. A fresh squeezed grapefuit and vodka is night and day from the stuff that comes in bottles. They have a nice selection of booze and have a an upstairs. It can get pretty crowded and is definitely a downtown crowd.
author: Hyung L.

description: Simple, understated, the kind of place where you can think clearly (if you're so inclined while you're drinking - I'm not, particularly) and actually hear the person next to you.  (It was pretty quiet and almost empty from 9-10:30 on a Friday).  I really enjoyed my basil gimlet (a recommendation of the bartender) - a strong punch of flavors and pleasing viscosity (cloudy, substantial) but not TOO unpallatably similar to pesto - just enough.  The Manhattan was arguably the best I'd ever had, with those chewy, tangy drunken cranberries - nice touch!  A great setting to enjoy a great drink.
author: Jennifer B.

description: 83 Proof is the place for after work drinks- good crowd, real drinks, walking distance from soma and fidi, high ceilings (so even though it can get crowded, you don't get that claustrophobic feeling). Overall, a good scene and nice-looking lacquered bar make for a casually-sophisticated go-to spot.
author: Sonia S.

description:
My girlfriend is doing the AIDS Ride this summer, and last night I hosted a small fundraiser for her at 83 Proof. I've thought it was a nifty and stylish bar ever since Greg K.'s birthday (and also home to one of the best Lemon Drops in the city) but it is also an AMAZING place to throw a party. 

Nika, the bar's manager, was friendly and quick to respond to emails to set up the event. The mezzanine lounge was perfect because it wasn't cut off from the bar like some private rooms, but we still had our own space. Everyone had a great time and we raised a serious chunk of change for the SF AIDS Foundation. Thanks, 83 Proof!
author: Debbie K.

description: No Signs -what the hell is going on in there.  I pass this place everyday from work and there are always a crowd and I decided to try it out on Thursday, Happy hour is 4-7pm $2.00 Heineken $4.00 well drinks and there heavy on the drinks not bad for SF.  It's a nice place with an upstairs lounge, cool atmosphere.  The bartenders were very cool and friendly.
author: Edward M.

description: I'm almost tempted to give this place no stars because I want to keep this fabulous after work spot a secret! This place is awesome - great ambiance, amazing drinks and the 2 bartenders totally rock - LOVE THEM! This place tends to get super packed on Fridays so I'd recommend going earlier in the week.
author: Sadia J.

description: perfect spot for happy hour, at least for me.  all of the bartenders are incredibly versed in their knowledge of whiskeys, scotches, bourbons and more. they have an excellent liquor selection and offer one of the best old fashions i've had. they can make it the original way or the modern way, it just depends on what you like. all in all, they sure know how to mix great cocktails.  I love the decor and ambiance of this bar.  one drawback is it can get crowded depending on the time and day, but when it's filled to a pleasant capacity, it's great.
author: Laxme G.

description: Nothing all that special about this place. It's just a bar. A bar that kind of looks unfinished and with no coherent theme. The crowd was manageable and the beers were cold, but it's pretty small and on an out-of-the-way stretch of 1st St. Not bad for happy hour, but I definitely wouldn't make this a destination on a Friday or Saturday night.
author: Lindsey S.

description: This is a great happy hour spot, but can get pretty packed.  It's a pretty small bar, but going in for some down-time after work or with a few friends is perfect.  Not a dive bar (you can certainly dress cute). It's walking distance from a bunch of clubs, so it's a good choice for a venue to get your night started.  The upstairs area lets you and your friends have some privacy from the crowd, which I think is a neat touch in a bar.
author: Aristocles P.

description: I'm still a big fan of the ability to get serious, well-mixed classic and creative cocktails from people who will get excited when you ask for bartender's choice (or ask about the bitters their friend made this week) for impressively low prices, but subsequent visits at different times have revealed that this place gets a bit overrun by the happy hour crowd. (This is doubly true when there are baseball games.) This is good for the business, but bad for the low-key vibe which so impressed me the first time.
author: Jonathan R.

description: I'm not sure why people keep talking this place up. Sure, their drinks are cheap ($3 beers are hard to find in FiDi), but 83 Proof has possibly the worst ambiance for enjoying them in. It's extremely noisy and crowded, and you're most likely going to be standing... so good luck bringing a group of more than four here. The entire place is like a long and narrow room, making for an awkward setup. And of course, all those people make it hard for you to get to the bar and order a drink.
author: Angela X.

description: This bar won my heart and my respect when I saw they had Sierra Nevada Celebration Ale on tap. Similar to the warm, cozy cabin depicted on the Celebration label - 83 Proof has a very warm and inviting feel to it. Add to that the cute bartenders and a nice loft perfect for people watching from above... and they've got me hooked!
author: Brandy H.

description:
bartender showed great dedication and work ethics.  

i ordered a suntory.  it happened to be near the top of their gigantic shelf of alcohol.  she was a tiny girl but she climbed that bad boy all the way to the top, despite shaking a little at the knees and, after she came back down, poured with a winning smile.  i felt responsible for endangering her so i tipped extra.
author: Andrew P.

description:
What an adorable little place, nestled in the heart of SOMA. 

Warm, inviting, bustling with financial district folk in need of a stiff drink after a long day/week of work.
author: Vic M.

description: freshly squeezed grapefruit on my greyhound?  makes a helluva difference!  now nothing compares.
author: Lady K.

description: I came here on Friday to meet a friend for happy hour.  I got here just before 5 and found two seats at the bar.  I ordered the basil gimlet from a very handsome bartender and waited for my drinking companion.  Overall this place was pretty cool. It definitely starts to fill up with a lot of bourgeois soma types, but that's OK.  I could also stand to pay $8 for a drink instead of $10, but whatever, at least they were stiff drinks.  It's a fun little spot easily accessible to BART, so I won't hold the downsides against it too hard.
author: Maryam S.

description: fun atmosphere, dick bartender. i ordered something from their cocktail list - nothing weird or off-menu and the bartender looked at me like i was asking for his kidney. when i paid for my $11 dollar drink with $15 cash he didn't seem to want to give me any change. i stood there with my wallet out for 5 minutes, until he finally returned $2 to me. i didn't know gratuity was included when one person orders one drink at a bar. should i have taken both dollars? should i have taken any? it was definitely not a $15 drink. i would question it's $11 worth even.
author: Aubrey B.

description: I was randomly dragged to this bar with a group of friends. I was travelling from Seattle and was wary of where this group would bring me. I was pleasantly surprised. They had an excellent collection of fine Ryes, including my personal  fave (http://tuthilltown.com/QUALITY/rye.html).  Brittany (possibly misspelled) was a lovely mixologist and it was  true pleasure to drink pure rye whiskey, chat with friends, and enjoy the space. I will return there the next time I am in SFO.
author: r. david p.

description: I'm a big fan of small but nice welcoming bars. It has cheap HH drinks, plus very friendly bartender and other staffs. Never goes wrong if you wanna find a place hanging out. Problem is, music is too loud sometime, and if u try to find a seat, go there earliER... As early as it can be... lol
author: Flora F.

description: Solid after work option, but what I liked most was the window. No, it doesn't have that great of a view (ummm...jack in the box) but it is so nice to have some fresh air in the joint.
author: Leslie Ann R.

description:
Here's all you need to know:

It's a bar.  They serve pretty lovely drinks.  The space is completely unobjectionable.

So unless you're looking for something else, it's a solid four-star joint.
author: Alice T.

description: One of the better Manhattans I've had.  Two of the three owners actually tend bar, and the one who favors whiskies puts just a touch of cherry juice in his Manhattans.  Totally overrun by the downtown happy hour crowd just after work, but it seems to be chiller so far on the late nights.  I almost don't want to Yelp it, for fear of ruining that ...
author: Nori H.

description: A fine little establishment if you work downtown, are of a mind for some after work whiskey therapy, and don't feel like hitting the alley dive bar yet again.  It's close to work, it has an excellent selection of scotch, the waitstaff are on top of it.  I hear the well drinks are cheap, but I wouldn't know because, well, who wants well drinks when I can have the Glenrothes?
author: Peter V.

description: Small spot, great selection.  Michael behind the bar is a true artist, try the manhattan he makes with chocolate mole.
author: Jason G.

description: a new bar in the neighborhood you live in never hurt nobody! went here for the first time with some friends a week ago....went on a week night, could of been a Wednesday if I remember correctly. Not many people inside but the bartenders were great- it's a small, little bar with an upstairs as well....didn't feel like checking out the upstairs- but this place has potential....I hear there is line out the door on Friday's to get in....I will be back!!!
author: Ricquel N.

description: This is a great little place dangerously close to office and conveniently close to the bart station so you can just step in here have your 'couple' of after-work drinks, and hop right onto the train to get you off home safe and steady. The place is clean, has just enough seating - including the loft upstairs, plays good music, great selection of drinks, and you can afford to get drunk if you choose to ! Of course for the weekends it get too crowded coz its narrow and falls short of space as more people  know about it, making it a difficult natural choice on a Friday as it would be on a weekday. Definitely this one went on the top of the list !!!
author: Nitin K.

description: Just another nod to their awesome drink prices!  I stopped by on a crowded Saturday night (lucky for me a party bus unloaded right after I arrived) - the yelp reviews forced me to order a blueberry mojito...don't think the bartender lady was too happy with me, but oh well!  Totally reasonably priced, yummy drinks.  Cheers!
author: Joyce L.

description: 83 Proof...cool name and atmosphere...awesome bartenders... great location for those living and working in the FiDi. Street parking is reallly easy after 7ish. I've been a regular since it opened and have let the master mixers Sky, Chris, and Mark creatively stir up more than a few different cocktails for me. Every time I think they can do no better, they raise the bar. I'm a fan of Chris's Mojitos (heavy on the mint!). On the sweeter side, ask Sky to mix up a Blueberry Lemon Drop for you...it's AMAZING...they also have a couple of really good recipes that use fresh basil...ask for the Mira-Flores...it's very delicious!
author: Jeff M.

description: I like this place just fine, and it seems to be a favorite among my colleagues.   It has a cool atmosphere, especially with the big open window facing out to 1st Street, that makes it seem upscale - or at least not grungy - but retains a certain something of authenticity.  That's a difficult line to walk but they do it well.  Unfortunately the layout of the space means that when it gets crowded, as it does at all of those times you really want to be in a bar, it becomes very difficult to move around or sit down.
author: Oliver N.

description: I had a really bad experience with this place. I came in for happy hour just to hang out with some friends. It was incredibly loud, not very comfortable, and the staff was incredibly rude to us - I mean, I haven't experienced this level of rudeness before. I will NOT go back to this place, nor would I recommend it. Life's too short.
author: Beth G.

description: This place is ok. I went on a Friday after work and it was very crammed. Alot of sleazy guys in suits.. pretty common for the financial district. The drinks are really cheap though, which is a huge plus. Will go back, just maybe not on a friday again
author: Sarah W.

description: I love this place. It's a bit expensive, and it can get crowded at happy hour, but the drinks are soooo damn good. The bartenders are amazing, fun, and friendly. Having an absinthe drip is a plus, as is the mezzanine.
author: Monika M.

description: I go here on weekends sometimes with friends. The place has the rare distinction of being upscale-ish (meaning stylish with good clientelle) without being too expensive or snobbish. Everyone is welcome. The bartenders are good. The place can get a little cramped. But you can usually find a spot if you wait a few minutes.
author: Vivek N.

description: It's small, crowded, and energetic.  The full bar is a plus and it's a good after-work//happy hour location.  Look for the "83" out front b/c there's no signage.
author: Nina L.

description: Drinks were good and stiff. Crowd is a good mix but it was pretty packed right after work on Friday and hard to hear people (I don't like when I have to yell in a bar to be heard). If I had been there when it wasn't like being a sardine I may have given it another star.
author: Krystha B.

description: Solid professional staff without attitude, well made drinks, and fair prices.  Get there early if you want a seat though and yes, like the other reviewers mentioned -do try the basil gimlet.  In fact, start with two like I did.  Probably not a destination spot but if you work or live in the area it's worth stopping by for a drink...or four.
author: Spidermonkey J.

description: intimate, tucked-away mixology happens here.  one glance at the bar guarantees just that!
author: Jill k.

description: This is such a great bar!  I love that they know how to make my key lime pie, a drink I hadn't had in about 5 years before they made it for me again.  YUM!!!!  Best of all, their prices are great!  I always look at my tab and feel like they missed a drink or 2.  The bartenders are very friendly, attentive, and excellent mixologists.  Wonderful spot!!!  I highly recommend it.
author: Stephanie R.

description: I was here for happy hour on a Tuesday and the place was absolutely packed!  Luckily, a few of our friends got there early and grabbed a table in the back.  My girlfriend had a $5 Cosmo & I had a $8 mojito.  We stayed till 7:30 and then had to take off because we were starving.  If they served food, snacks or even pretzels/ nuts we probably would have easily stayed another 2-3 more rounds.
author: Stacey L.

description: Laid back spot with cool bartenders and a low key crowd.  Absinthe they have and enjoy absinthe I do.  The bottles are all well diplayed behind the bar and the bartenders are well versed in the spirits they serve.   Move over John Collins there's a new Sheriff in town and her name is 83 proof!
author: goldberg d.

description: Visited the second day it opened and its a great place to meet a friend for a post work drink. It's not like all the other fin district happy hour places and it exudes a casual, relaxed, yet social vibe. The bartenders there are pretty cool - we didn't know what to order and based on what we were feeling like drinking, he concocted a yummy cocktail based off our descriptions. Will probably be coming in here lots.
author: Bernadette L.

description: I finally stopped by this place on my way to the Transbay Terminal.  I must say, that it was packed, but I loved the atmosphere.  The music was cool and the drink wasn't bad either.  I'll definitely have to stop by again on my way home for some alcoholic relief after a long day at work.
author: Michael G.

description: It's a bit tricky to find, but I think you'll be pleased once you find it.  Outside you won't see much more than a simple "83" posted above the door, but inside there's nice lighting, solid drinks, a clean bathroom and a piano player that plays Arcade Fire, Duran Duran and Oasis.  The live piano was definitely my favorite; I love playing "name that tune."  Tables are small so I wouldn't recommend it for a large group and they don't serve food, so I wouldn't recommend it if you're hungry.  It is however, conveniently located across the street from a Jack in a Box, if that's what you're in to.
author: Krystle S.

description: Went for happy hour on Friday. Inside was pretty narrow and crowded. Asked for a Bulliet Ginger, but they gave me bourbon and ginger ale. Yuck!  But another bartender made me WHISKEY SCHNAPPS and it tasted great! He saved my evening! All the bartender were nice and ready to serve you. BTW, sit at the bar so you can get your drinks faster!
author: James T.

description: The owners are charming, yet are in the middle of trying to find their groove. It's a neighborhood bar with a little bit 'o the Yelp buzz that has them sitting a bit unprepared for being a hot spot. Time will work this out and 83 will no doubt prove to be a solid addition to the SOMA/Rincon Hill neighborhood. Plenty of selection, well mixed. I'm hoping for some good bar snacks. Who cares if you copy. Hey Sky, how about Truffled Popcorn, Three-Pepper Spiced Pepitas, or Edamame Tossed with Smoky Salt.... okay, maybe that's been done, how about some hot roasted nuts, fried garbanzos and spiced olives - who can resist?
author: Philip M.

description: I love this place.  Maybe it's because we didn't get there until after happy hour, but it wasn't crowded and my co-patrons were pretty chill.  Sky and Mark were awesome (chatted us up all night) and Sky made us a bunch of special drink concoctions.  Can't help but heart him.  Yeah, it's cozy, but I think that's part of it's charm.
author: Renee D.

description: Last time I was here was probably 5 years ago when it was "Attitudes"...wow has it changed.  I've passed by a few times, thought about what it was like b4 and skipped to Harlot.  Came here a couple weeks ago and I like it!  Great happy hr spot to hang out and chat.  House white was very decent.  Parking was okay also.
author: Jenny K.

description: An unpretentious bar in SF, fo real?!?! 83 Proof is a stone's throw from the TB terminal., making it an ideal spot for imbibing before the Bay Bridge commute :-) Rock on 83 proof!
author: Annalies H.

description: I met up with friends here for my birthday on a Wednesday evening. I purposely scheduled the shenanigans to begin around 9pm so that we missed the happy hour crowd. My plan worked as we had the place to ourselves and were able to enjoy the upstairs area. Our waiter from dinner told us to ask specifically for ____ (crap, forgot his name) and order the devil lemonade. Damn. From what I remember of the rest of the night, everyone enjoyed the venue. The bartenders were friendly and attentive, space was good, not too loud, etc. No complaints here!
author: Susan L.

description: Finally a place near my house that has Rye!  Checked out 83 proof last night and I must say I was quite impressed.  The owners, Chris and Sky, couldn't have been friendlier.  I was most impressed with their selection of alcohol.  From Pimms to Mezcal, Chartreuse to Lillet, 83 proof has it all.  They even had Remy Martin Louis XIII which they happily poured and sold at cost (~$50 a glass).  I would highly recommend ordering a Rye Manhattan, as it was one of the best I have ever had.  But if that's not your thing, this place is a good place to experiment.  Looking forward to my next visit....
author: Barrett F.

description: I went here last night and had a great time! The snacks were key, as well as the well-priced (I mean well-priced) drinks. The bartenders are super friendly and cute. The entrace area along the bar got crowded on a Thursday around 6PM and then again at 9:30PM. There is an upstairs area for more intimate, quieter conversations. This place is also small enough to rent out if you are having a private party. Parking in Soma is crazy, however there are parking lots and FREE metered parking after 6PM. Hooray!  :-)
author: Vanessa B.

description:
eh....  just yet another downtown bar that charges around $7 for a drink that should cost $5 at the most, has some lame new hip hop or bad trace/house playing, decorated by lots of new blonde wood and fancy light fixtures, and full of financial district dicks... 

see also:  John Collins, the Gallery Bar, DaDa bar, etc....

2 stars just because the more places to drink downtown, the better
author: kevin w.

description: Barkeep was super attentive even though the happy hour mobs from all nooks and crevices of the downtown sf area were in full effect.. It looked like a scene from the movie the Warriors, each mob deep with their own weapons and in powers of numbers but...i think the barkeeps are used to breaking all that jazz down and working through the requests. I recommend this place.
author: Joe J.

description: I think this just might be my new favorite after-work spot.  They've got absinthe which was the initial draw for me when I went for the first time yesterday.  The place isn't that big and usually packed but still a nice atmosphere, decent music, attentive bartenders (who were easy on the eyes to boot).  I probably wouldn't pay 13 bucks for absinthe every day but it certainly was delicious.  this place is easy to miss, being that it's got a plain wooden door and just the numbers 83 but that doesn't seem to affect its business, if anything, the mystique draws people in.  they've got flat screen tvs for spoorts but fortunately not distracting, and a ton of all sorts of liquor.  anyway, I'll definitely be hitting this bar up again soon.
author: Suzanne V.

description: pretty decent bar, not a ton of room, but pretty cool place, kinda in the middle of nowhere though
author: Michael E.

description: This place was surprisingly fun and cool despite its SOMA location. Definitely not your typical bar in that area. Cool atmosphere and great drink prices (during happy hour at least). Like many others, I recommend the basil gimlet!
author: Jon N.

description: Being in extraordinary close proximity to work, 83 Proof gets to be a regular haunt on the HH circuit.  It's got friendly barternders, a nice atmosphere, and has decent drink prices.  On busier nights, this place gets packed and due to the layout of the interior, the decibels reverberate and it gets tough to have conversations . . . the only detriment which prevents 83 Proof from getting 5 stars.
author: George J.

description: Awesome find, cant believe we did not try this place out earlier since we live a block away.  This place is awesome, subtle, unpretentious and great bartenders.  I cant really say much more about this place besides it has a great vibe and is a neighborhood gem for drinks both on busy and off nights.
author: Charles C.

description: I came here on a Wednesday night w/ a friend after a great Italian dinner in North Beach . Asked our bartender for a refreshing martini...She made us a cucumber-infused drink with a touch of basil, which was just perfect after a filling meal. The bar has a lounge/loft upstairs w/ good ambiance - great for catching up with old friends!
author: Belen M.

description: Nice downtown bar and nice downtown crowd after work. I came on Friday, when it was rainy and was pleasantly surprised by the clean but sophisticated decor. I heard of this place, but it sounded more taverny/homey at first. When I walked in, after showing my ID to the bouncer, it was definitely on the more sophisticated side. I guess I thought naming a bar after alcohol would mean musky and dusty and smelly?  The HH drinks are very reasonably priced, around $6 for a french martini.  Definitely will want to hit this place up again after work.
author: Natalie S.

description: This place is awesome, good stiff drinks and warm vibe.  For a high end whiskey bar that caters to tattooed SOMA hipsters and suits during the week, it sure is relaxing.  If you are able to get a stool before the crowds pack in, it's entirely advantageous as you and your crowd can hang and milk the service.  They always seems to have choice tunes on, good ipod mixes I guess.  Check it out, the entrance is very nondescript so keep your eyes peeled.
author: TJ D.

description: Was there on Thursday night.  What a great place to grab few drinks and hang out with good friends! Nice decor, helpful & knowledgeable bartenders, reasonable price and good liquor selections.
author: Yuko K.

description: Weekday update - same vibe as original post (good) but the music has been much louder these last few times I've gone.  Not sure why.  Still like it, though.
author: Melinda C.

description: I really like this bar for a post-office drink.  It's a FiDi crowd but not at all a meat market.  It's clean-feeling and airy, with big windows in the front and a windowseat in front of them that for some reason never seems to be occupied when I go there.  The service is quick and good and there's sometimes an awesome piano player there.  Definitely worth crossing one block into SOMA to get away from the gross bars near Embarcadero Center.
author: Sarah B.

description:
cool mellow place. good drinks and about 5 beers on tap. feels like john collins or that bar near medjool in the mission

would go back for happy hour. or to catch up w/ some friends. 

location is hard to find (next to walgreens) but parking shouldnt be that tough later at night.
author: Bobby B.

description: Cool place.  The upstairs area looks nice from afar, but I have yet to venture up there.  It would be a nice place for a private gathering.  The bartenders are nice and drinks taste like they should.  I came on a night that was slow, so I could not get a real vibe of what sort of crowds come here.  However, overall, it seems like a no fuss, low key spot for drinks.
author: Linda P.

description: Stopped in here on a friend's recommendation the other night... and found a fairly standard after work crown in a pretty generic box. Nice looking bar, but nothing out of the ordinary. My Manhattan was WAY too sweet - I should have sent it back, but, well, I had already consumed half of it. Plenty of other places that are more my speed anyhow, so no big loss.
author: Bowen D.

description: Love this spot! I met the fella's that own the place a few months ago and have been in several times for great drinks and great atmosphere. The staff is very gracious and the crowd is pretty unpretentious especially for the financial district. I have never had a bad time here.
author: Bill H.

description: ok pops was in town and wanted to grab a drink.  we stumbled upon this little jewel with no sign outside.  our kind of place for sure.  great place to stop in for a mix drink or frosty beer at a good price. also recommended if your taking the girl out for a drink and still want to be able to hold a conversation without the music killing the vibe
author: Jerry Lee F.

description: This place is great when it's not crowded with suits.  Great cocktails, good beer on tap and the bartenders are very nice.  However, it can be tough to get a drink in a timely manner when the suits show up.  All in all, 83 Proof is one of my favorite bars downtown.
author: Daniel B.

description: Tucked behind the Walgreen's in a non-descript storefront at 83 1st St. is a great bar with attentive (and attractive) bartenders, reasonbly priced drinks, and great ambience, albeit loud.  An early arrival will result in mixers with the Financial District suits, but late evening is a relaxed atmosphere.  The butterscotch walls, old wood floors, and Art Deco details provide great warm character to the place.  Highly recommended, either for a pint or gimlet any time of night.
author: Muenster T.

description: This is a decent spot if you don't mind the downtown crowd. They have a pretty amazing scotch selection. I would go back just for that. The big open wall/window in the front is a nice touch. The music wasn't bad either.
author: Zac H.

description: My happy hour bar of choice for close to work. They always get packed right at 5pm, but I love the place. It's not a dive bar like Beale Street, but it's not a "scene" either like Harlot (both of which serve their purposes)... just a good, easy place to grab an honest drink with a bunch of people happy to be out amongst friends.
author: Shoshana D.

description: Good vibe, really cool / nice bartenders, and right around the corner from my work = great HH spot.  I actually was able to have a semi-business meeting here as well - at about 5 pm on a Tuesday night it was empty and quiet enough that we could actually have a conversation!  I always order my standard Goose n' Soda, but after reading some of these reviews I will definitely be trying the flavored gimlets next time (Love the basil one at Rye).....
author: A B.

description: This place must be good for having lots of people coming here without a sign outside. You just have to KNOW about this place. If the window and door isn't opened, you just might miss it! Like one of the bartender said, they don't need a sign! drinks are great and their specialty is whisky. $2 Heineken during happy hour! Great place in the financial district to grab a drink after work!
author: Nancy N.

description: I hate to do this, but my subsequent experiences at the bar have not been as good as my first few.  The vibe has just not been great.  One of the bartenders looked like she'd rather be pulling teeth.  I'm so sad that this place changed - I really liked it, and hoped it could be one of my new hangouts.
author: Sienna L.

description: There isn't much to say about this spot-- it is pretty nondescript....  drinks were fine, they had a nice selection of liquor but, as my friend put it, not a "destination spot".
author: shoba d.

description: Best bar near the FiDi.  Hands down.  Not that it has much competition or anything but still.  Classy and clean without being snooty.  Especially good if you get off work in the afternoon since they open at 2pm and it doesn't really start to get crowded till after 5.  The bartenders are nice and the prices are reasonable.  I wouldn't consider going all the way downtown just to come here for the evening but for after work drinks, it's perfect
author: M M.

description: 3.5 stars, but it fluctuates on when you come.  In the peak of happy hour, I'd give 2 stars based on the level of noise and the length of time to get a drink.  Once the crowd dies down you now longer have to scream at your companions or wait 20 minutes for a drink, you get a four star experience.  The drinks are wonderful and the vibe is very cool.  I'll be back, but not between 5-7:30.
author: She-Ra ..

description: An ok bar just south of market in the Financial District.  Nothing special, crowd very average.  Maybe I need to go more often to discover what others are saying
author: Laurence H.

description: I think I had an unlucky night here as it took FOREVER to get a drink. There was what appeared to be a birthday party in progress that kept getting dozens of shots, which made my getting drinks damn near impossible. Once I got a drink, I enjoyed the atmosphere which was lively at first but quieted down fast. Definitely a good after work place. I'll definitely give it another shot.
author: Scott T.

description: 83 Proof is a great happy hour place. The bartenders are friendly and service is very efficient; they make pretty good cocktails and somehow always keep track of who to serve next, despite the lack of queues (I know it's a straight bar). It can get crowded on weeknights, but that's never stopped me from going there. This place is ridiculously inconspicuous, mainly because there's no signage - just look for the number 83! I'm definitely a fan!
author: Matin N.

description: Be careful trying to find this place at night. Almost walked right past, but was glad I didn't. The staff is what sets this place apart from all those other bars. The bartender was engaging in helping me and others try new and "uncomfortable" drinks. Hope to make it back here soon.
author: Andrew C.

description:
$9.00!! i got an amstel light for her and a vodka tonic for me, not bad!

there's not much going on around 83 proof, which means there is parking.  it's kinda hard to spot it, so i'd just aim for the walgreen's and cruise around the back in search of a door.

somehow i thought this place would be snooty upscale soma-scene type thing, it wasn't.  reasonable prices, good crowd, great place to hang out and enjoy the night.
author: Ameer N.

description: Came here to meet some old friends for happy hour. They have a piano player, which is fun, but the acoustics in there are not good. It was sooo loud! Anyway, you must order the basil cocktail, it's herby and citrusy, so good! We had a great time, particularly when it started to empty out around 8pm (on a Tuesday). Fun bar, good drinks, friendly bartenders, what  more do you need for happy hour?
author: Jennifer L.

description: T Dizzle found the place.  They have some really damn good drinks at a really damn good price.  I'm scared of poppin the joint since its on the bubble,  BUT my "wedding" drink for only 55? Jesus H Christ, where else can you find something more awesome than that!!!  It's a real mixed place and can get pretty crowded with the older side but its worth it.  Thanks dizzle its six foot kickin!
author: Bernardo C.

description: Popped into this sweet spot for the first time the other night after dinner and show in the YB Gardens.  Love the clean swanky decor. You can tell that the crowd that night were regulars, but the tattooed bartender broke away from conversation right away to greet us warmly and serve us newbies a drink.  I will definitely go back.  My only regret is the TV in the corner playing  sports.  I felt it took away from the atmosphere and opportunities to have great conversations with some of the amazing people in the room.
author: Lisa R.

description: Good place for Happy Hour and strong drinks...only problem is what awaits you on the outside...
author: Don R.

description: An excellent selection of booze (and bitters to boot) that are mixxed with care. When I call a liquor that the don't have, they've always been able to recommend a reasonable replacement. The open space in the front is a nice change from the usual overcrowded layout.
author: Ashton E.

description: Cute place.  I've been here twice with coworkers to drink after work and found it charming.  Good old school music and decent drinks.  You gotta get there early cause it fills up quick and becomes standing room only.  The other thing it gets kinda hot in there.  There is no name on the street so you have make sure you look for it right next to Walgreens.  Will be back again.
author: La C.

description: Girlfriend and I may have found our new Tuesday GNO spot! Lovely bartenders, good happy hour prices, nice mixed crowd, and it's across from the Tranny Bay! What more could a gal ask for?
author: C P.

description: Went back for HH with friends last night and had a good time - it's crowded and we had to wait a while for drinks but the bartenders were super nice the entire time and the bathroom lines were relatively short. too bad they don't serve food.
author: Lauren D.

description: Just Eh... we went here on the friday night of opening week around 5:30 PM.  You would think, hey, opening week, let's try to impress -  but, no, all they were striving for was a whole lot of MEDICROTY...drink "specials" included $5 semi-weak coctails (read: mostly ice and mixer in small glasses)  $4 beer on tap is okay, but they had a very small selection.  The decor was nothing to write home about either.  The place is small to medium sized, and there are tables, but by the time we got there at 5:30 it was 75% full and standing room only - to be honest, though, I think once the hype of the "newness" dies down and the reality of mediocrity sets in, you'll be able to get a seat.   On the plus side, there is a large window in the front that opens with a few tables in front for those rare warm SF nights.  There is also a cute little loft section above which would be great for a group of 15 or so if you get claim it early enough; it would be even better if they had a  little bar up there, but you can't have everything I guess.  Really, I'd give this place a 2.5 star rating if it was possible.  If you have the choice, I'd say avoid this place since there are a lot of better bars that are pretty close by.
author: Simmi M.

description:
I went to this place last Friday around 6 pm, jampacked w/ the 20/30 something after work crowd (that is not a bad thing, just sayin...)  One of the owners, Sky (Skye?) was really nice. I sat w/ a guy and we commented on the scenery/wildlife and had a drink together.  Reasonably priced, not a very intriguing beer selection for a beer drinker like me but I had a Chamuco tequila and sipped it and just took it all in.  I used to come here back in the day when it was the Leopard.  It has high ceiling now, knocked the false ceiling out.  Could use some artwork on the walls...maybe a flatscreen so I can watch some basketball.  But overall happy to see this location in action again and kudos to the ownership for opening a hopping new downtown watering hole that is pretty much no frills but w/ premium booze and already packing them in two or three weeks after opening (...not at all unusual for SF, everyone wants to go to the new "hot spot")
I shall return!
author: Tom M.

description: My two friends Kristina and Michelle, who happen to be roommates, decided to have their holiday party here.  I am happy to say that the party was a smashing success.  The vibe in this place is very cool and there is plenty of room to move about and mingle.  The bar did get very crowded around 11.30 on a Friday night but above all it was definitely a nice addition to an area that's about to blow up once the Transbay tower gets built.  If this place can muster up enough business until then they'll be sitting on a goldmine.
author: George K.

description: It's not super huge but definitely worth going to happy hour. This place makes me wish I work downtown again. Decor is nice, not pretentious. It's one long bar and tables on the right. It has a good amount of people and it's definitely lively but yet I don't have to scream to hear my friends talk. They also have a comfy looking loft area to lounge if you go early enough to snatch it up. The drinks are delicious and strong. Not too sweet. I went for the highly recommended basil gimlet by fellow yelpers and also the cucumber  gimlet too. I like both! Two was all it took for the perfect buzz for the rest of the night. Also I like that their happy hour prices are good 'til 7pm.
author: Yenly M.

description: The thing that makes this bar great is that they actually make killer cocktails.  Good pours and mixing.  The decor is fun.
author: e w.

description: This place officially became my watering hole! I'm not one for after work crowds or the whole vibe of yuppie infested hipster bars. But I have to tell you this is one cool place. Super laid back , clean, no puke smell, no attitude from anyone and the bartenders rock! The only complaint.... Turn up the music and play more Punk and Metal!
author: Dennis P.

description: It's a little hard to find this place.  I went here on Saturday night for someone's birthday.  Half of the bar were people who were there for the birthday party.  Since it wasn't too busy, it was a little easier to move around.  The drinks are priced pretty low at this place which is a definite plus.  Bartenders were okay, a little slow.  And this place needs to have a DJ to spin some tunes, because you could barely hear the music that was playing.  Other than that, this is a decent place.
author: daniel j.

description: Great prices and drinks are not that bad either. We had two bottles of beer, a mojito and two glasses of Hennessey heated and it was only 26 bucks! Plus one of the bartenders is great to look at! lol But seriously, this place is small! Like really small, so if you do not get there early you will be standing! Also, this place is easy to miss, it is right next to Walgreen's on 1st St. Good drinking all!
author: Tyler D.

description: Great little place! Awesome mezzanine to host a party - Nika was so helpful and friendly in helping me plan a bachelorette party. Enormous selection of booze, and cute bartenders!!
author: Katie J.

description: This was a nice chill place to hang out after work to grab a drink before dinner.  My friends and I went on a Wednesday evening at around 630. It was happening but not crazy packed.  It was loud but I was still able to carry a conversation without feeling I was yelling and spitting on everyone.  I wasn't impressed with their happy hour deal though.  Drafts were cheap (I paid $3 for a Hefeweizen) but all the other drinks were regular price (~8 for a martini).  The bartenders were all very nice and attentive. We found out they had 7 types of Absinthe and one bartender was patient enough to give us recommendations and prepare them for us.
author: Justin Y.

description: I gave 83 Proof three stars because my experience was not good nor bad. I met some girlfriends after work for happy hour. Prices weren't too bad. It was pretty crowded, but I have seen worse. Although there were tables up and downstairs, it was not easy to find a seat. The place is small and unpretentious. It was quaint and the service was friendly and speedy. Nice little stop by place for a quick drink, but I wouldn't go out here at night or anything.
author: Andrea S.

description: very cool bar. its always a good thing when u get more change than u were expecting. $2 heinekens?  cant really beat that.  really cool spot for a happy hour get together. bathrooms were clean too, which is a rarity nowadays! i was intrigued with the balcony too, maybe next time!
author: Andrew T.

description: loved this place.  love the decor, the high ceilings, industrial concrete walls, married w/ reclaimed wood floors, chairs and bar, love the huge front window that opens up so you feel like your actually outside (nice considering it was pretty warm today, a good breeze was coming thru that huge window.)  long wood framed mirrors rim the top of the walls, pointed slightly down to catch the light and the faces of the folks below, cute/nice/attentive bartenders.  upstairs mezzanine overlooks the long-thin bar area below, looked like there was a private party going on up there.  i like that there is no sign announcing it's presence, that if i hadn't known it was there, i wouldn't know it was there.  the place was cool, without trying too hard.  i will definitely be going back.
author: Suzanne A.

description: Fun.  Good times (after work) bar.  Good drink selection and bartenders who know what the drinks are, how they should be made, and decent service.  Nice private area on top if available.  A little crowded sometimes, but then again, that's what happens to a good bar.  ENJOY....
author: jonny s.

description: Cool spot. Nice vibe. Great Happy Hour prices. I met a friend there after work on a Wednesday, and it had just the right amount of people in it (not too crowded/loud, not too dead). The large windows at the front of the bar the open onto the sidewalk give the place some nice natural lighting and air (feels like a Manhattan casual happy hour place).  It also didn't hurt that some Macallan Scotch reps were there giving out tastings. The bartender (good looking dude with ton of tats all over arms) was really patient and friendly, despite the growing crowds and chaos. Metered parking on First was very easy to find.
author: Joe C.

description: After stumbling out of Mexico DF on Saturday night, my friends and decided to check out 83 Proof (thanks to YELP, of course).  It was kind of early (9:30) and it was still really quiet in here.  Thankfully, this allowed us to spend some time chatting with the mix-masters about their kick-ass booze selection and cool accessories such as a glass "Absinthe Fountain" used during the consumption of absinthe in the traditional manner (a.k.a. "the cool heroin-like way").  Someone in our group tried the house specialty "Cucumber Gimlet" - which was awesome.  And by the time we finished our first round, more people started to trickle in.  Ended up being a pretty chill evening at the bar (still plenty of standing room) but apparently it can get quite crowded here during weekday happy hour and some Saturday nights.  The area is "up-and-coming" as more and more people move in to the neighboring high-rises so with any luck, this could be quite the happening spot in the coming year or two.
author: Ari G.

description: Super-packed happy hour. Small but nice space. Great basil gimlet.
author: Ilona G.

description: maybe it was becuase i was there on a friday night, but i wasnt that impressed.  the drinks were fine - good service, but the overall atmosphere i wasnt sure about.  the lighting was really weird and it was very loud.  i might go back another night, see what its like on a regular week night.
author: Carolyn B.

description: A big shout out for 83 Proof!  This is a great addition to the limited bar selections in this area.  Beautiful decor, good mixed crowd, and nice strong drinks.  Fun and entertaining staff which is always a huge plus. Shout out to Sky and Chris, so much fun.  And Mark...special shout out to you man!!  You rock!!!  This is going to be a great place to hit up after work and on the weekends.  Welcome to area 83 Proof.........we needed you!
author: Allison M.

description: This bar is a great addition to this neighborhood- not snooty but not a dive.  Just the kind of place that's warm and welcoming from the bustle of the street and makes you want to hang out and enjoy a drink or two.  Plus, Chris the bartender is a ringer for George Clooney...nice.
author: Sarah B.

description: I recently hosted an alumni happy hour at 83 Proof and other than a complaint or two about the loud music, everyone seemed to have great things to say about the place. The bartenders were nice, the drink prices are reasonable and there's a great upstairs area to get cozy and people watch. Even though this place has rave reviews on Yelp, none of us had been there before. Someone in our group liked it so much that she decided to host a work party there. It did take them over two weeks to return my initial call re: setting up an event there, but once we connected, they were easy to work with and very prompt in responding to emails.
author: Cher E.

description: This place is easy to miss bc the entrance is a whole in the wall. However, once you walk in, it's quite sheik looking and it's pretty fun for happy hour. Of course, the place isn't all that big, but definitely bigger than what I had anticipated from looking at it from the outside.. There's an upstairs so if you get there early and the bar is already filled, try upstairs for additional seating :)
author: Julie M.
